RESEARCH METHODOLOGY AND IPR (SHS04) 
Unit-I 
Research methodology  objectives and motivation of research -Types of research, research 
approaches, research methods verses methodology, research and research methodology, scientific 
method, Importance of   research methodology, approaches of Investigation of solutions for research 
problem, data collection, analysis of interpretation, necessary instrumentations, criteria of good 
research.

necessity of defining the problem, technique involved in defining a problem.

child_6c9ef64144a74e72a28b1cf923039376.content:
6-hours 
Meaning of research 
Research is a derivative of French word "Researche” means quest, pursuit and search for truth.
child_6c9ef64144a74e72a28b1cf923039376.title: SH04-RM - IPR-NOTES-UNIT-I

child_119231137b264c9ba59d95d67bb15c19.title: SH04-RM - IPR-NOTES-UNIT-I

The following is the process  
Person    observes             phenomena

child_f18eccea99bf46239034932d6786b44a.content:
The following is the process  
Person    observes             phenomena    collection of data     Conclusions 
again and again                             analysis of data 
 
Therefore research means to observe the phenomena again and again from different dimension s, 
Collection of data, analysis of data and make conclusions.
child_f18eccea99bf46239034932d6786b44a.title: SH04-RM - IPR-NOTES-UNIT-I

child_524de15e7cea4e5099f8cbe27c278ac3.content:
• The dictionary meaning of research is “careful  investigation or inquiry especially through 
search for new facts in branch of knowledge” 
 
•  Research can also be defined as "a Scientific and systematic search for pertinent information 
on a specific topic".

• The research comprises defining and redefining a problem, formulating the h ypothesis or 
suggested solution s, collecting , organizing and evaluating data making deductions and 
reaching conclusions and at-last carefully testing the conclusions to determine whether they 
fit the formulating hypothesis.

ly testing the conclusions to determine whether they

Importance of Research or Significance of research 
“All progress is born of inquiry, Doubt is often better than overconfidence, for it leads to inquiry 
and inquiry leads to inv ention" is a famous Hud son maxim in context of which the  significance 
of research can be well understood.

The basic types of research are as follows.

• Applied vs Fundamental 
• Quantitative vs Qualitative 
• Conceptual vs Empirical 
• Some other types of research.

• Descriptive research includes surveys a nd fact finding enquiries of different kinds.

lytical

The 
major purpose of the descriptive research is description of the state of affairs as it exists 
at present 
• The main characteristic of this method is that the researcher has no control over its 
variables, he can only report what has happened or what is happening.
child_3aca2b03175747e5828703100794a7c2.title: SH04-RM - IPR-NOTES-UNIT-I

• Most ex  post facto research projects are used for descriptive research in which the 
researcher seeks to measure items such as, for example, frequenting of sh opping, 
preference of people etc 
• The method used are survey methods of all kinds 
 
 
Analytical research:-In analytical research, researcher has to u se facts or information 
already available.

is happening.

an Industry/business organization.

ate problem facing a Society or

how much?

It is used not only in physical sciences 
but also in economics, social scie

ation

Research problem 
What is research problem?
child_f5bbddcbd6d2419fb6bee65ad7c6fdfe.title: SH04-RM - IPR-NOTES-UNIT-I

child_cfe74e67ea82414083b73abe6e2d7563.content:
Research problem refers to some difficulty which a researcher experiences in the context of either 
a Theoretical or Practical situation or wants to obtain solution for the same.
child_cfe74e67ea82414083b73abe6e2d7563.title: SH04-RM - IPR-NOTES-UNIT-I

child_7c2b811abd2740d4bbe8fe8848b67cd2.content:
The components of research problem are 
1) There must be an individual or group which has some difficulty or the problem 
2) There must be some objective(s) to be attained at.
child_7c2b811abd2740d4bbe8fe8848b67cd2.title: SH04-RM - IPR-NOTES-UNIT-I

child_c425bc3c0fc54edcb3543e22302010f0.content:
3) There must be alternative means or (Course of action) for obtaining the Objective(s) 
one wishes to attain.
child_c425bc3c0fc54edcb3543e22302010f0.title: SH04-RM - IPR-NOTES-UNIT-I

child_459843194db2433389b3413c3c5ac749.content: 4) There must remain some doubt in the mind of a researcher with regard to t
child_459843194db2433389b3413c3c5ac749.title: SH04-RM - IPR-NOTES-UNIT-I

child_0360914820924892979e526b45630059.content:
4) There must remain some doubt in the mind of a researcher with regard to the selection 
of alternatives.
child_0360914820924892979e526b45630059.title: SH04-RM - IPR-NOTES-UNIT-I

child_6b21ee7778fe4dd29dcdd99c5bd811e4.content: 5) There must be some environment(s) to which the difficulty pertains.
child_6b21ee7778fe4dd29dcdd99c5bd811e4.title: SH04-RM - IPR-NOTES-UNIT-I

child_f8d1e932cec34e49b1b6528d4323d390.content:
Thus, a research problem is one which requires the researcher to find out the best solution for the 
given problem i.e., to find out which course of action the objective can be attained optimally in 
the context of a given environment.

ation

ia of good research

child_549840b63d0d420b9607be460697f4f4.content:
Research problem 
What is research problem?
child_549840b63d0d420b9607be460697f4f4.title: SH04-RM - IPR-NOTES-UNIT-I

child_c2e1a03f5de84be1bace60527dcf0630.content:
Research problem refers to some difficulty which a researcher experiences in the context of either 
a Theoretical or Practical situation or wants to obtain solution for the same.
child_c2e1a03f5de84be1bace60527dcf0630.title: SH04-RM - IPR-NOTES-UNIT-I

child_8bf9000c3c974ed5b40591919705dbb0.content:
The components of research problem are 
1) There must be an individual or group which has some difficulty or the problem 
2) There must be some objective(s) to be attained at.
child_8bf9000c3c974ed5b40591919705dbb0.title: SH04-RM - IPR-NOTES-UNIT-I

child_23d50e57f0d949d5b4c4e242d5c7f45a.content:
3) There must be alternative means or (Course of action) for obtaining the Objective(s) 
one wishes to attain.
child_23d50e57f0d949d5b4c4e242d5c7f45a.title: SH04-RM - IPR-NOTES-UNIT-I

child_66ba98ae2552483a89dc80bb26e26a7b.content: 4) There must remain some doubt in the mind of a researcher with regard to t
child_66ba98ae2552483a89dc80bb26e26a7b.title: SH04-RM - IPR-NOTES-UNIT-I

child_9a13b957e7254c79a279c88b9d122b4f.content:
4) There must remain some doubt in the mind of a researcher with regard to the selection 
of alternatives.
child_9a13b957e7254c79a279c88b9d122b4f.title: SH04-RM - IPR-NOTES-UNIT-I

child_45cf23189dde4cc7a5eca8161b7906ec.content: 5) There must be some environment(s) to which the difficulty pertains.
child_45cf23189dde4cc7a5eca8161b7906ec.title: SH04-RM - IPR-NOTES-UNIT-I

child_ac9cc838b5494e9ebfccea51262d283e.content:
Thus, a research problem is one which requires the researcher to find out the best solution for the 
given problem i.e., to find out which course of action the objective can be attained optimally in 
the context of a given environment.
child_ac9cc838b5494e9ebfccea51262d283e.title: SH04-RM - IPR-NOTES-UNIT-I

child_db527b6152db437ab4bb3a9adc70b22e.content:
Necessity of defining the problem 
We all hear that a problem clearly  stated is a problem half solved.
child_db527b6152db437ab4bb3a9adc70b22e.title: SH04-RM - IPR-NOTES-UNIT-I

child_586dba59db7546aeac34ac685f10f439.content:
This statement signifies  the 
need for defining a research problem.

child_463f80d8e6a64e34b31e76bf31184b58.content: The problem to be investigated must be defined clearly.

• Statement of the problems in general way

after the other; 
• Statement of the problems in general way  
• Understanding the nature of the problem

Dr. J P Ganjigatti, Professor, IEM 
Page 1 of 14 
 
RESEARCH METHODOLOGY AND IPR (SHS04) 
Unit-II 
SURVEY OF LITERATURE 
 
After defining a research problem, the researcher has to do literature survey connected with the 
problem.
child_8203eb5a69c34a9fa9f78eb396c38286.title: RM & IPR (SHS04) Unit-II JPG

child_2ad6ade8d3a644a294a770ce83d6be7e.content:
It is a collection of research publications, books and other documents related to the defined 
problem.
child_2ad6ade8d3a644a294a770ce83d6be7e.title: RM & IPR (SHS04) Unit-II JPG

child_a61befca8d3442ce8049db626e7fcfdf.content:
It is very essential to know whether the defined problem has already been solved, status of the 
problem and other related details one can survey  
1.
child_a61befca8d3442ce8049db626e7fcfdf.title: RM & IPR (SHS04) Unit-II JPG

child_8ff50ed00b8c4f4db1ab4668f056f25d.content: The journal which publishes abstract of papers published in various journals.
child_8ff50ed00b8c4f4db1ab4668f056f25d.title: RM & IPR (SHS04) Unit-II JPG

child_553537df0ecc469fbf71b1b009d9a0ee.content: Review articles related to the topic chosen.
child_553537df0ecc469fbf71b1b009d9a0ee.title: RM & IPR (SHS04) Unit-II JPG

child_2696353dc66d4066b11775833e7cae09.content: Advanced level books on chosen topic.
child_2696353dc66d4066b11775833e7cae09.title: RM & IPR (SHS04) Unit-II JPG

child_b3cddc3176ad40a886ac825fa6e8fb02.content: Reprint collections available with the supervisor and near by experts working on the chosen topic.
child_b3cddc3176ad40a886ac825fa6e8fb02.title: RM & IPR (SHS04) Unit-II JPG

child_51046ed934b9486db33c19ac66c390b2.content:
IMPORTANCE OF LITERATURE SURVEY  
Once the research problem is defined, the next logical step will be survey of background literature.

3rd party and presenting an one’s own.

child_529fa09eecbd4b4c88df856eeafb2e39.content:
Research ethics: Dr. J P Ganjigatti, Professor, IEM 
Page 7 of 14 
 
It refers to the guidelines and principle s that govern the conduct of
child_529fa09eecbd4b4c88df856eeafb2e39.title: RM & IPR (SHS04) Unit-II JPG

child_36c063f5d10c49b59905b5a800cc0522.content:
fessor, IEM 
Page 7 of 14 
 
It refers to the guidelines and principle s that govern the conduct of research to ensure that it is 
conducted with integrity, respect and responsibility.
child_36c063f5d10c49b59905b5a800cc0522.title: RM & IPR (SHS04) Unit-II JPG

child_a3ef1846f43b4eea950b773f15240d43.content:
Respect the persons:-  
• Informed consent: - Researches must enure that participants voluntarily agree to participate in the 
study with a full understanding of its purpose procedure, risks and benefits.
child_a3ef1846f43b4eea950b773f15240d43.title: RM & IPR (SHS04) Unit-II JPG

child_bdaf22d9452e41b6a9eda0a8fbfd5cfa.content:
• Autonomy:- participants should have the right to make their own decisions about participating in 
research.
child_bdaf22d9452e41b6a9eda0a8fbfd5cfa.title: RM & IPR (SHS04) Unit-II JPG

child_71c632a688024022901b0607098db19c.content:
Beneficence:-  
• Maximizing benefits, minimizing harm: -Researches should ensure that it potential benefits of its 
research outweigh the risk or harm to participants.
child_71c632a688024022901b0607098db19c.title: RM & IPR (SHS04) Unit-II JPG

child_0c92f4eac98c423c918bddc84c52641e.content:
Justice:- 
• Fair treatment: - The benefits and burdens of research should be distributed fairly among all 
groups.
child_0c92f4eac98c423c918bddc84c52641e.title: RM & IPR (SHS04) Unit-II JPG

child_a32087a197a24909a07fe342347e6668.content:
• Equitable selection of participants: - Researcher’s must ensure that participant recruitment is done 
fairly and withot bias.
child_a32087a197a24909a07fe342347e6668.title: RM & IPR (SHS04) Unit-II JPG

child_95c1fd0715a84d5397cfe6e0635ee083.content:
re that participant recruitment is done 
fairly and withot bias.
child_95c1fd0715a84d5397cfe6e0635ee083.title: RM & IPR (SHS04) Unit-II JPG

child_2106f88db5924e59990b7bffb328853c.content: Confidentiality:- The researcher must ensure that the participants data is handled confidentially.
child_2106f88db5924e59990b7bffb328853c.title: RM & IPR (SHS04) Unit-II JPG

child_b1e71696f07f46cbb8f25006b64b995a.content:
Integrity and transparency: -Researcher’s must avoid fabrication, plagiarism, or any form of 
misconduct.
child_b1e71696f07f46cbb8f25006b64b995a.title: RM & IPR (SHS04) Unit-II JPG

child_765f6523401a45ddbf11542491b591da.content:
All aspects of the research process from methodology to reporting should be clear and 
transparent to ensure trust worthiness.
child_765f6523401a45ddbf11542491b591da.title: RM & IPR (SHS04) Unit-II JPG

child_efae7bc11b414ffca8ef766099c2a19b.content: Social responsibility:- Researcher’s should ensure that their work contribute positively to society.
child_efae7bc11b414ffca8ef766099c2a19b.title: RM & IPR (SHS04) Unit-II JPG

child_80a735bc32ee445c93b1e2ffd0692cc2.content:
Accountability:- Researcher’s are accountable to their institutions, funding agencies, and the 
public.
child_80a735bc32ee445c93b1e2ffd0692cc2.title: RM & IPR (SHS04) Unit-II JPG

child_6fb103ce5b5e4172b0f22cbea2fc2b20.content:
﻿Robot Learning: A Tutorial
Francesco Capuano Caroline Pascal Adil Zouitine ThomasWolf Michel Aractingi

University of Oxford, Hugging Face

Abstract
Robot learning is at an inflection point, driven by rapid advancements in machine learning and the growing
availability of large-scale robotics data.
child_6fb103ce5b5e4172b0f22cbea2fc2b20.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_eb3283fecada4595ae3117356f0d74ba.content:
This shift from classical, model-based methods to data-driven,
learning-based paradigms is unlocking unprecedented capabilities in autonomous systems.
child_eb3283fecada4595ae3117356f0d74ba.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_625bce772eec45ee81aa1580a06917e6.content:
This tutorial
navigates the landscape of modern robot learning, charting a course from the foundational principles of
Reinforcement Learning and Behavioral Cloning to generalist, language-conditioned models capable of
operating across diverse tasks and even robot embodiments.
child_625bce772eec45ee81aa1580a06917e6.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_19e38ad442b949abaa37ab97177f764c.content:
This work is intended as a guide for researchers
and practitioners, and our goal is to equip the reader with the conceptual understanding and practical tools
necessary to contribute to developments in robot learning, with ready-to-use examples implemented in lerobot.
child_19e38ad442b949abaa37ab97177f764c.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_bf81159b6e1e4375aa8a444325d2e862.content: ontribute to developments in robot learning, with ready-to-use examples implemented in lerobot.
child_bf81159b6e1e4375aa8a444325d2e862.title: ROBOT LEARNING

Foreword
Robotics is an inherently multidisciplinary field, which is witnessing unprecedented advancements since its inception
in the 1960s.
child_4373b51148ed4310aafb0fe437cc5d87.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_a4fc390e84394f1b8d5ed69235c90222.content:
Yet, more than sixty years after the debut of Unimate, robots have still not fully integrated into the rich,
unstructured, and dynamic world we humans inhabit.
child_a4fc390e84394f1b8d5ed69235c90222.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_3278ab825c4f4ac6b58d6f91bb4c1bba.content:
Over the decades, numerous disciplines have shown immense
promise in tackling the challenges of creating autonomous robotic systems.
child_3278ab825c4f4ac6b58d6f91bb4c1bba.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_115159d38a714f18954ca2cd052fb2d8.content:
This tutorial takes a clear stance in the
debate on whether modern Machine Learning can play a pivotal role in the development of autonomous robots: we
believe this to be the case.
child_115159d38a714f18954ca2cd052fb2d8.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_752035663a3d4435a3602f98b128e596.content:
Nonetheless, we also hold that the wealth of research from both academia and industry in classical robotics over the
past six decades is, simply put, too valuable to be cast aside
child_752035663a3d4435a3602f98b128e596.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_adcc60fa58ef46988bb4ddb17901b2d9.content:
ustry in classical robotics over the
past six decades is, simply put, too valuable to be cast aside in favor of purely learning-based methods.
child_adcc60fa58ef46988bb4ddb17901b2d9.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_cd02ade11955436b93bef07d3efc0616.content:
However,
the interplay between classical robotics and modern machine learning is still in its nascent stages, and the path to
integration yet to be clearly defined.
child_cd02ade11955436b93bef07d3efc0616.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_4c85f215e2fc42e8a0a773fab69bc706.content:
In turn our goal here is to present what we consider to be the most relevant
approaches within robot learning today, while warmly extending an invite to collaborate to expand the breadth of
this work! Start contributing today here.
child_4c85f215e2fc42e8a0a773fab69bc706.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_a10a2c25369042a49989004ce67c638e.content:
• Does not aim to be a comprehensive guide to general field of robotics, manipulation or underactuated systems: Si-
ciliano and Khatib (2016) and Tedrake (a,b) do this better than we ever could.
child_a10a2c25369042a49989004ce67c638e.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_2f01cf09ff4d44b481d80fa31114a0cd.content:
• Does not aim to be an introduction to statistical or deep learning: Shalev-Shwartz and Ben-David (2014) and Prince
(2023) cover these subjects better than we ever could.
child_2f01cf09ff4d44b481d80fa31114a0cd.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_5488480826a042f5af51e83a6162f44a.content: • Does not aim to be a deep dive into Reinforcement Learning, Diffusion
child_5488480826a042f5af51e83a6162f44a.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_251cd17037224476b784cac9a8bcc6d4.content:
• Does not aim to be a deep dive into Reinforcement Learning, Diffusion Models, or Flow Matching: invaluable works
such as Sutton and Barto (2018), Nakkiran et al.
child_251cd17037224476b784cac9a8bcc6d4.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_4ddf9c2ccb09466e9090ff5ed76152fd.content:
(2024) do this better than we ever
could.
child_4ddf9c2ccb09466e9090ff5ed76152fd.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_857501fec81d4e159be8d87e773c590c.content:
Instead, our goal here is to provide an intuitive explanation as per why these disparate ideas have converged to form
the exciting field of modern robot learning, driving the unprecedented progress we see today.
child_857501fec81d4e159be8d87e773c590c.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_fdae9d9876ca41dbbd2ecc4da2bce6db.content:
In this spirit, we follow
the adage: "a jack of all trades is a master of none, but oftentimes better than a master of one."
We sincerely hope this tutorial serves as a valuable starting point for your journey into robot learning.
child_fdae9d9876ca41dbbd2ecc4da2bce6db.title: ROBOT LEARNING

integrated on the entire robotics stack, supporting low-level control of real-world robot devices, advanced data and inference
optimizations, as well as SOTA robot le

rol of real-world robot devices, advanced data and inference

child_537b868ca5374c91a0e35b6af69f194c.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_3ec37304f485432e9264cf7ff3168f7b.content:
1 Introduction
Autonomous robotics holds the premise of relieving humans from repetitive, tiring or dangerous manual tasks.
child_3ec37304f485432e9264cf7ff3168f7b.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_2952f9afe879408884d7159916270b18.content: Consequently, the field of robotics has been widely studied since its first inception in the 1950s.
child_2952f9afe879408884d7159916270b18.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_be35d2c783054eef818a69b64407c13b.content:
Lately, advancements
in Machine Learning (ML) have sparked the development of a relatively new class of methods used to tackle robotics
problems, leveraging large amounts of data and computation rather than human expertise and modeling skills to
develop autonomous systems.
child_be35d2c783054eef818a69b64407c13b.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_2307a63a201b4edaaabb1f51e40fea29.content:
The frontier of robotics research is indeed increasingly moving away from classical model-based control paradigm,
embracing the advancements made in ML, aiming to unlock (1) monolithic perception-to-action control pipelines
and (2) multi-modal data-driven feature extraction strategies, together with (3) reduced reliance on precise models
o
child_2307a63a201b4edaaabb1f51e40fea29.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_d20749ff25c44ec6b686733ed567d523.content:
al data-driven feature extraction strategies, together with (3) reduced reliance on precise models
of the world and (4) a better positioning to benefit from the growing availability of open robotics data.
child_d20749ff25c44ec6b686733ed567d523.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_6e741145d9b644b388ab62a293533abb.content:
While
central problems in manipulation, locomotion and whole-body control demand knowledge of rigid-body dynamics,
contact modeling, planning under uncertainty, recent results seem to indicate learning can prove just as effective as
explicit modeling, sparking interest in the field of robot learning.
child_6e741145d9b644b388ab62a293533abb.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_b71d2c77a64645a9a55dc8697c3909de.content:
This interest can be largely justified considering the
significant challenges related to deriving accurate models of robot-environment interactions.
child_b71d2c77a64645a9a55dc8697c3909de.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_fda6886e3023416fa0534c349c36f6a7.content:
Moreover, since end-to-end learning on ever-growing collections of text and image data has historically been at the
core of the development of foundation models capable of semantic reasoning across multiple modalities (images, text,
audio, etc.), deriving robotics methods grounded in learning appears particularly consequential, especially as
child_fda6886e3023416fa0534c349c36f6a7.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_8c8d7633f21e42ab86354cd3009e9dbc.content:
), deriving robotics methods grounded in learning appears particularly consequential, especially as the
number of openly available datasets continues to grow.
child_8c8d7633f21e42ab86354cd3009e9dbc.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_7a284d83606945b29365bfdaae07ba02.content:
Robotics is, at its core, an inherently multidisciplinary field, requiring a wide range of expertise in both software and
hardware.
child_7a284d83606945b29365bfdaae07ba02.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_0c55f577b23e40728fd853da7a20c682.content:
The integration of learning-based techniques further broadens this spectrum of skills, raising the bar for
both research and practical applications.
child_0c55f577b23e40728fd853da7a20c682.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_78a3cd6f5289412385dc4a5a804ba11e.content:
lerobot is an open-source library designed to integrate end-to-end with
the entire robotics stack.
child_78a3cd6f5289412385dc4a5a804ba11e.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_36fac3c7449e4d0caaa88875a3b34cfc.content:
With a strong focus on accessible, real-world robots (1) lerobot supports many, openly
available, robotic platforms for manipulation, locomotion and even whole-body control.
child_36fac3c7449e4d0caaa88875a3b34cfc.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_a6d206dd72dc49cb94156bc8e932b5c6.content:
lerobotalso implements a
(2) unified, low-level approach to reading/writing robot configurations to extend support for other robot platforms
with relatively low effort.
child_a6d206dd72dc49cb94156bc8e932b5c6.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_f7c2a25192c54dba8bd8fe6d7a489baa.content:
The library introduces LeRobotDataset, (3) a native robotics dataset’s format currently
being used by the community to
child_f7c2a25192c54dba8bd8fe6d7a489baa.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_109754ca7d364622b78d1686c3b09e43.content:
uces LeRobotDataset, (3) a native robotics dataset’s format currently
being used by the community to efficiently record and share datasets.
child_109754ca7d364622b78d1686c3b09e43.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_626079f8539c4da88e9251b1069e04cf.content:
lerobot also supports many state-of-the-art
(SOTA) algorithms in robot learning—mainly based on Reinforcement Learning (RL) and Behavioral Cloning (BC)
techniques—with efficient implementations in Pytorch, and extended support to experimentation and experiments
tracking.
child_626079f8539c4da88e9251b1069e04cf.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_a5dc7147a5c14783ad1f4f6db2d6853c.content:
Lastly, lerobot defines a custom, optimized inference stack for robotic policies decoupling action planning
from action execution, proving effective in guaranteeing more adaptability at runtime.
child_a5dc7147a5c14783ad1f4f6db2d6853c.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_92febe8f2a444b09b7c870abeab2e732.content:
This tutorial serves the double purpose of providing useful references for the Science behind—and practical use
of—common robot learning techniques.
child_92febe8f2a444b09b7c870abeab2e732.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_daaf29d27710430a90b880f2c873a09f.content:
To this aim, we strike to provide a rigorous yet concise overview of the core
concepts behind the techniques presented, paired with practical examples of how to use such techniques concretely,
with code examples in lerobot, for researchers and
child_daaf29d27710430a90b880f2c873a09f.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_eafc3f5a48c347b4ab1815752784ea5f.content:
amples of how to use such techniques concretely,
with code examples in lerobot, for researchers and practitioners interested in the field of robot learning.
child_eafc3f5a48c347b4ab1815752784ea5f.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_f33b2fbf1aa94a44a589fdbe5d71d84c.content:
This tutorial
is structured as follows:

• Section 2 reviews classical robotics foundations, introducing the limitations of dynamics-based approaches to
robotics.
child_f33b2fbf1aa94a44a589fdbe5d71d84c.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_78993bada1c94a4e95adda9bc8e79428.content:
3



• Section 3 elaborates on the limitations of dynamics-based methods, and introduce RL as a practical approach to
solve robotics problems, considering its upsides and potential limitations.
child_78993bada1c94a4e95adda9bc8e79428.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_a5234413d6c64a65be7e8f6774027c8f.content:
• Section 4 further describes robot learning techniques that aim at solving single-tasks learning, leveraging BC
techniques to autonomously reproduce specific expert demonstrations.
child_a5234413d6c64a65be7e8f6774027c8f.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_b9b2c9cd25a04899a6c4c2731075e42a.content:
• Section 5 presents recent contributions on developing generalist models for robotics applications, by learning from
large corpora of multi-task & multi-robot data (robotics foundation models).
child_b9b2c9cd25a04899a6c4c2731075e42a.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_cc38fdec22d8429cb12f9d71e3b68de1.content: Our goal with this tutorial is to provide an intuitive explanation of the reasons various disparate ideas
child_cc38fdec22d8429cb12f9d71e3b68de1.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_15632a54a62b434c9b51e461c4091fb5.content:
oal with this tutorial is to provide an intuitive explanation of the reasons various disparate ideas from Machine
Learning (ML) have converged and are powering the current evolution of Robotics, driving the unprecedented progress
we see today.
child_15632a54a62b434c9b51e461c4091fb5.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_ca683cd139314cdc8ea2e81ed10e7707.content:
We complement our presentation of the most common and recent approaches in robot learning with
practical code implementations using lerobot, and start here by presenting the dataset format introduced with
lerobot.
child_ca683cd139314cdc8ea2e81ed10e7707.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_17f12a9f6c914eb79021a4594acd21f6.content:
1.1 LeRobotDataset
LeRobotDataset is one of the most impactful features of lerobot, developed in keeping with the observation that
robotics data is increasingly central in robot learning.
child_17f12a9f6c914eb79021a4594acd21f6.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_ecaed02e84714809a6435b1ea5d2bac5.content:
Thus, lerobot defines a standardized dataset format designed to
address the specific needs of robot learning research, providing a unified and convenient access to robotics data across
modalities, including sensorimotor readings, multiple camera feeds and teleoperation status.
child_ecaed02e84714809a6435b1ea5d2bac5.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_2972752cd3a843e8b4d867ab33c81bdf.content:
LeRobotDataset also
accommodates for storing general information regarding
child_2972752cd3a843e8b4d867ab33c81bdf.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_8e1423119ec14914a63c0fc983cf491f.content:
LeRobotDataset also
accommodates for storing general information regarding the data being collected, including textual descriptions of the
task being performed by the teleoperator, the kind of robot used, and relevant measurement specifics like the frames
per second at which the recording of both image and robot state’s streams are proceeding.
child_8e1423119ec14914a63c0fc983cf491f.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_c0267fb5475e4244b1e83958f0cba806.content:
In this, LeRobotDataset provides a unified interface for handling multi-modal, time-series data, and it is designed to
seamlessly integrate with the PyTorch and Hugging Face ecosystems.
child_c0267fb5475e4244b1e83958f0cba806.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_138cb0e6f1a14c7abaa8782004607f38.content:
LeRobotDataset can be easily extended by
users and it is highly customizable by users, and it already supports openly available data coming from a variety of
embodiments supported in lerobot, ranging from manipulator platforms like the SO-100 arm and ALOHA-2 setup,
to real-world humanoid arm and hands, as well as entirely simulation-based datasets, and self-driving cars.
child_138cb0e6f1a14c7abaa8782004607f38.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_cc663c7b47614ce6bb760aeb0d86f0db.content:
This
dataset format is built to be both efficient for training and fl
child_cc663c7b47614ce6bb760aeb0d86f0db.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_f704ed64ab7046efb83b601baa5060e8.content:
This
dataset format is built to be both efficient for training and flexible enough to accommodate the diverse data types
encountered in robotics, while promoting reproducibility and ease of use for users.
child_f704ed64ab7046efb83b601baa5060e8.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_ecedfa86668441fd89ee16517cfd145c.content:
1.1.1 The dataset class design
A core design choice behind LeRobotDataset is separating the underlying data storage from the user-facing API.
child_ecedfa86668441fd89ee16517cfd145c.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_84f49e8ae83f4db8b18667abcea135a7.content: This allows for efficient storage while presenting the data in an intuitive, ready-to-use format.
child_84f49e8ae83f4db8b18667abcea135a7.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_7702685178ec435192ca9735f05402df.content:
Datasets are always organized into three main components:

• Tabular Data: Low-dimensional, high-frequency data such as joint states, and actions are stored in efficient memory-
mapped files, and typically offloaded to the more mature datasets library by Hugging Face, providing fast with
limited memory consumption.
child_7702685178ec435192ca9735f05402df.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_cb702366c5c94083bb31027caec9d6a0.content: • Visual Data: To handle large volumes of camera data, frames are concatenated and encoded into MP4 files.
child_cb702366c5c94083bb31027caec9d6a0.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_50498456296d48ab88868e05cde6ff79.content:
Frames
from the same episode are always grouped together into the same video, and multiple videos
child_50498456296d48ab88868e05cde6ff79.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_f229fa354a9440d882da132a6a7cd8b5.content:
Frames
from the same episode are always grouped together into the same video, and multiple videos are grouped together
by camera.
child_f229fa354a9440d882da132a6a7cd8b5.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_83718d0ba5b2434fab0940e8fb175f03.content:
To reduce stress on the file system, groups of videos for the same camera view are also broke into
multiple sub-directories, after a given threshold number.
child_83718d0ba5b2434fab0940e8fb175f03.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_e6f5404505b94f5a8bbefb963df66d8d.content:
• Metadata A collection of JSON files which describes the dataset’s structure in terms of its metadata, serving as the
relational counterpart to both the tabular and visual dimensions of data.
child_e6f5404505b94f5a8bbefb963df66d8d.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_88593df377134f819d1985063559c8d9.content:
Metadata include the different feature
schema, frame rates, normalization statistics, and episode boundaries.
child_88593df377134f819d1985063559c8d9.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_d395f4d1a6f443d2a0768d3e78e11d74.content:
For scalability, and to support datasets with potentially millions of trajectories (resulting in hundreds of millions
or billions of individual camera frames), we merge data from different episodes into the same high-level structure.
child_d395f4d1a6f443d2a0768d3e78e11d74.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_2033fa87daa341ce833a51d7c2c6f35f.content:
Concretely, this means that any given tabular collection and video will not typically contain information about one
episode only, but rather a concatenation of the informat
child_2033fa87daa341ce833a51d7c2c6f35f.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_abe84e7ebf0d47beb19c3ce29ead80d6.content:
not typically contain information about one
episode only, but rather a concatenation of the information available in multiple episodes.
child_abe84e7ebf0d47beb19c3ce29ead80d6.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_7e01138b7bd64c0cad3a489b47702aba.content:
This keeps the pressure on
the file system limited, both locally and on remote storage providers like Hugging Face, though at the expense of
leveraging more heavily relational-like, metadata parts of the dataset, which are used to reconstruct information such
as at which position, in a given file, an episode starts or ends.
child_7e01138b7bd64c0cad3a489b47702aba.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_c7a92822fd7542b9bf13ff99ea7e1d94.content:
An example struture for a given LeRobotDataset would
appear as follows:

• meta/info.json: This metadata is a central metadata file.
child_c7a92822fd7542b9bf13ff99ea7e1d94.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_f8e094b706ab4c348695ea6b1f9386bb.content:
It contains the complete dataset schema, defining all

4



features (e.g., observation.state, action), their shapes, and data types.
child_f8e094b706ab4c348695ea6b1f9386bb.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_cfd4dd35a418465288b44502ee2cbfaf.content:
It also stores crucial information like
the dataset’s frames-per-second (fps), lerobot’s version at the time of capture, and the path templates used to
locate data and video files.
child_cfd4dd35a418465288b44502ee2cbfaf.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_ccdc1757b71549cfa5cf2be0617f6013.content: • meta/stats.json: This file stores aggregated statistics (mean, std, min, max) for each
child_ccdc1757b71549cfa5cf2be0617f6013.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_edee5e9478bb4ee1889f199f46bf9edf.content:
• meta/stats.json: This file stores aggregated statistics (mean, std, min, max) for each feature across the entire
dataset, used for data normalization for most policy models and accessible externally via dataset.meta.stats.
child_edee5e9478bb4ee1889f199f46bf9edf.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_2befd7246e6045d9b62a864e9321b1ec.content:
• meta/tasks.jsonl: This file contains the mapping from natural language task descriptions to integer task indices,
which are useful for task-conditioned policy training.
child_2befd7246e6045d9b62a864e9321b1ec.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_82bdfada61ba4a4caf0d9f83f11fc51b.content:
• meta/episodes/* This directory contains metadata about each individual episode, such as its length, the corre-
sponding task, and pointers to where its data is stored in the dataset’s files.
child_82bdfada61ba4a4caf0d9f83f11fc51b.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_315ebf35566e43618c138d7235d9dd03.content:
For scalability, this information is
stored in files rather than a single large JSON file.
child_315ebf35566e43618c138d7235d9dd03.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_2aa58dca3b774109a81532a5bdcfbd25.content:
• data/*: Contains the core frame-by-frame tabular data, using parquet files to allow for fast, memory-mapped
access.
child_2aa58dca3b774109a81532a5bdcfbd25.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_2d9997959c6844f7a363deb0d06a19ba.content:
To improve performance and handle large datasets, data from multiple episodes are concatenated into larger
files.
child_2d9997959c6844f7a363deb0d06a19ba.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_c5217fbb7541447c9882ee12d1e22031.content: These files are organized into chunked subdirectories to keep the size of
child_c5217fbb7541447c9882ee12d1e22031.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_fbeea2947cd24afaa2edb87bba02edfa.content: These files are organized into chunked subdirectories to keep the size of directories manageable.
child_fbeea2947cd24afaa2edb87bba02edfa.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_e83d3c1287004081abe909542ca2dd6a.content:
A single file
typically contains data for more than one single episode.
child_e83d3c1287004081abe909542ca2dd6a.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_b5ed5e21a3f04c9b9063dbf193679ef5.content: • videos/*: Contains the MP4 video files for all visual observation streams.
child_b5ed5e21a3f04c9b9063dbf193679ef5.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_fec05339f18441b9bff64a9831d4d88b.content:
Similar to the data/ directory, the
video footage from multiple episodes is concatenated into single MP4 files.
child_fec05339f18441b9bff64a9831d4d88b.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_270736d19aa84b0c8de7c961468a14d8.content:
This strategy significantly reduces the
number of files in the dataset, which is more efficient for modern filesystems.
child_270736d19aa84b0c8de7c961468a14d8.title: ROBOT LEARNING

This section provides an overview of how to access datasets hosted on Hugging Face using the LeRobotDataset class.

Every dataset on the Hugging Face Hub containing the three main pillars presented above (Tabular, Visual and
relational Metadata), and can be assessed with a single instruction.

In practice, most reinforcement learning (RL) and behavioral cloning (BC) algorithms tend to operate on stack of
observation and actions.

ehavioral cloning (BC) algorithms tend to operate on stack of
observation and actions.

of frame.

For instance, RL algorithms may use a history of previous frames ot−Ho:t to mitigate partial observability,
and BC algorithms are in practice trained to regress chunks of multiple actions (at+t+H ) rather than single controls.

To accommodate for these specifics of robot learning training, LeRobotDataset provides a native windowing operation,
whereby users can define the seconds of a given window (before and after) around any given frame, by using the
delta_timestemps functionality.
child_7dd4adbe3a604853a81ad2443ea05e1c.title: ROBOT LEARNING

Unavailable frames are opportunely padded, and a padding mask is also returned
to filter out the padded frames.

higher level wrappers commonly used in training ML models such as torch.utils.data.DataLoader.

Know your enemy [...]

Sun Tzu

TL;DR

Learning-based approaches to robotics are motivated by the need to (1) generalize across tasks and embodiments
(2) reduce dependency on human expertise (3) leverage historical trends on the production of data—all
traditionally overlooked by dynamics-based techniques.
child_0f83dca1eb234693bc5ff9c24cb3aa1e.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_41196b1aaf0840ceaeb55ae2996ae0f5.content:
2.1 Explicit and Implicit Models
Robotics is concerned with producing artificial motion in the physical world in useful, reliable and safe fashion.
child_41196b1aaf0840ceaeb55ae2996ae0f5.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_87453f80e3b442ccbcbb699c89cef313.content:
Thus,
robotics is an inherently multi-disciplinar domain: producing autonomous motion in the physical world requires, to the
very least, interfacing different software (motion planners) and hardware (motion exe
child_87453f80e3b442ccbcbb699c89cef313.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_b094637d2f0b446f9d06ee21ce72b30b.content:
quires, to the
very least, interfacing different software (motion planners) and hardware (motion executioners) components.
child_b094637d2f0b446f9d06ee21ce72b30b.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_5355e6a7020242ca910a2e5d7ab09277.content:
Further,
knowledge of mechanical, electrical, and software engineering, as well as rigid-body mechanics and control theory
have therefore proven quintessential in robotics since the field first developed in the 1950s.
child_5355e6a7020242ca910a2e5d7ab09277.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_aef6a46a72e24340b22a0ee1b7f28c64.content:
More recently, Machine
Learning (ML) has also proved effective in robotics, complementing these more traditional disciplines (Connell and
Mahadevan, 1993).
child_aef6a46a72e24340b22a0ee1b7f28c64.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_0e21cb269ed04baabcb58938e07fcd64.content:
As a direct consequence of its multi-disciplinar nature, robotics has developed as a rather wide
array of methods, all concerned with the main purpose of producing artificial motion in the physical world.
child_0e21cb269ed04baabcb58938e07fcd64.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_297b6a11c7c24cbb84e6bc5114a86de9.content:
Methods to produce robotics motion range from traditional explicit models—dynamics-based1 methods, leveraging
precise descriptions of the mechanics of robots’ rigid bodies and their interactions with eventual obstacles in the
environment—to implicit models—learning-based methods, treating artifici
child_297b6a11c7c24cbb84e6bc5114a86de9.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_2f2f3d70e1cb476280c09757284eb567.content:
h eventual obstacles in the
environment—to implicit models—learning-based methods, treating artificial motion as a statistical pattern to learn
given multiple sensorimotor readings (Agrawal; Bekris et al., 2024).
child_2f2f3d70e1cb476280c09757284eb567.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_3429bde6e00241f1a1eed11b2c1bc84b.content:
A variety of methods have been developed
between these two extrema.
child_3429bde6e00241f1a1eed11b2c1bc84b.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_8d10f6ee48a14395b864c8f8bca0707d.content:
(2022) show how learning-based systems can benefit from
information on the physics of problems, complementing a traditional learning method such as Temporal Difference
(TD)-learning Sutton and Barto (2018) with Model-Predictive Control (MPC).
child_8d10f6ee48a14395b864c8f8bca0707d.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_7c6313e9e6c14874a2178ab6e3b44fbd.content:
Conversely, as explicit models may
be relying on assumptions proving overly simplistic—or even unrealistic—in practice, learning can prove effective
to improve modeling of complex phenomena or complement perception (McCormac et al., 2016).
child_7c6313e9e6c14874a2178ab6e3b44fbd.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_bae25e40f41341fea06fd94288773f4c.content:
2.2 Different Types ofMotion
In the vast majority of instances, robotics deals with producing motion via actuating joints connecting nearly
entirely-rigid links.
child_bae25e40f41341fea06fd94288773f4c.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_b9dfcd6a2b5d4fdb9b9eb528667abc05.content: A key distinction between focus areas in robotics is based on whether the generated mot
child_b9dfcd6a2b5d4fdb9b9eb528667abc05.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_b510fad313044c798605f39ea83373c0.content:
A key distinction between focus areas in robotics is based on whether the generated motion
modifies (1) the absolute state of the environment (via dexterity), (2) the relative state of the robot with respect to
its environment (exercising mobility skills), or (3) a combination of the two (Figure 3).
child_b510fad313044c798605f39ea83373c0.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_49960523e5574d9d8db047b6e268512f.content:
Effects such as (1) are typically achieved through the robot, i.e. generating motion to perform an action inducing
a desirable modification, effectively manipulating the environment (manipulation).
child_49960523e5574d9d8db047b6e268512f.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_16e4c88802e140c1b4036f3509edf0ef.content:
Motions like (2) may result in
changes in the robot’s physical location within its environment.
child_16e4c88802e140c1b4036f3509edf0ef.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_f42892fa2c2742238e667919cf6e3086.content:
Generally, modifications to a robot’s location within
its environment may be considered instances of the general locomotion problem, further specified as wheeled or legged
locomotion based on whenever a robot makes use of wheels or leg(s) to move in the environment.
child_f42892fa2c2742238e667919cf6e3086.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_97bfd7ddf2854fea929c617b3b3f8ce4.content:
Lastly, an increased
level of dynamism in the robot-environment interactions can be obtained combining (1) and (2), thus desi
child_97bfd7ddf2854fea929c617b3b3f8ce4.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_b00bbe41794c4488b080d862e53b21b7.content:
l of dynamism in the robot-environment interactions can be obtained combining (1) and (2), thus designing
systems capable to interact with and move within their environment.
child_b00bbe41794c4488b080d862e53b21b7.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_843acbe8e6194b10ac39e8f29d863650.content:
This category is problems is typically termed
mobile manipulation, and is characterized by a typically much larger set of control variables compared to either
locomotion or manipulation alone.
child_843acbe8e6194b10ac39e8f29d863650.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_427eeb935e7c4b8f86081f23e2101f3c.content:
The traditional body of work developed since the very inception of robotics is increasingly complemented by learning-
based approaches.
child_427eeb935e7c4b8f86081f23e2101f3c.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_b00fd744e9fa4c48acbcb6ed886f9757.content:
ML has indeed proven particularly transformative across the entire robotics stack, first empowering
planning-based techniques with improved state estimation used for traditional planning (Tang et al., 2023) and
then end-to-end replacing controllers, effectively yielding perception-to-action methods (Kober et al.).
child_b00fd744e9fa4c48acbcb6ed886f9757.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_8de7403ab4984d65af6c962630a571e3.content:
Work in
producing robots capable of navigating a diverse set of terrains demonstrated the premise of both dynamics and
learning-based approaches for locomotion (Griffin et al., 2017
child_8de7403ab4984d65af6c962630a571e3.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_a1cf62f01b7d48a79590d1b6283be137.content:
ated the premise of both dynamics and
learning-based approaches for locomotion (Griffin et al., 2017; Ji et al., 2023; Lee et al., 2020; Margolis et al., 2022),
and recent works on whole-body control indicated the premise of learning-based approaches to generate rich motion
on complex robots, including humanoids (Zhang et al., 2024; Bjorck et al., 2025).
child_a1cf62f01b7d48a79590d1b6283be137.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_6732707d643f4a61a4f2f439cf82a575.content:
Manipulation has also been widely
studied, particularly considering its relevance for many impactful use-cases ranging from high-risk applications for
humans (Fujita et al., 2020; Alizadeh and Zhu, 2024) to manufacturing (Sanneman et al., 2020).
child_6732707d643f4a61a4f2f439cf82a575.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_f3c9eefb8b4542d1900610ac5876a16e.content:
While explicit models
have proven fundamental in achieving important milestones towards the development of modern robotics, recent
works leveraging implicit models proved particularly promising in surpassing scalability and applicability challenges
via learning (Kober et al.).
child_f3c9eefb8b4542d1900610ac5876a16e.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_9f14696a545348e19009a79cb6268a95.content:
2.3 Example: PlanarManipulation
Robot manipulators typically consist of a series of links and joints, articulated in a
child_9f14696a545348e19009a79cb6268a95.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_abc4c85238414c00afbc6dcf2ed48998.content:
rManipulation
Robot manipulators typically consist of a series of links and joints, articulated in a chain finally connected to an
end-effector.
child_abc4c85238414c00afbc6dcf2ed48998.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_d59b4e65d92f460eaaa889da47287375.content:
Actuated joints are considered responsible for generating motion of the links, while the end effector is
instead used to perform specific actions at the target location (e.g., grasping/releasing objects via closing/opening a
gripper end-effector, using a specialized tool like a screwdriver, etc.).
child_d59b4e65d92f460eaaa889da47287375.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_96bc342a5e874e66991f515b205d0d55.content:
Recently, the development of low-cost manipulators like the ALOHA (Zhao et al., 2023) ALOHA-2 (Aldaco et al.)
and SO-100/SO-101 (Knight et al.) platforms significantly lowered the barrier to entry to robotics, considering the
increased accessibility of these robots compared to more traditional platforms like the Franka Emika Panda arm
(Figure 4).
child_96bc342a5e874e66991f515b205d0d55.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_e1d5504b2a034e2da56fb5bda577315e.content:
Deriving an intuition as per why learning-based approaches are gaining popularity in the robotics community requires
briefly analyzing traditional approaches for manipulation, leveraging tools like forward and inverse kinematics (FK,
IK) and control theory.

Providing a detailed overview of these methods falls (well) out of the scope of this tutorial,
and we refer the reader to works includi
child_06d2ef4b40e742ecbbc4d49ac213272a.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_9055eddac20641f1aa99231950bfcea3.content:
ese methods falls (well) out of the scope of this tutorial,
and we refer the reader to works including Siciliano and Khatib (2016); Lynch and Park (2017); Tedrake (a,b) for a
much more comprehensive description of these techniques.

these traditional techniques

Deriving the end-effector’s pose—position and orientation—in some m-dimensional space p ∈ P ⊂ Rm starting from
the configuration q ∈ Q ⊂ Rn of a n-joints robot is referred to as forward kinematics (FK), whereas identifying the
configuration corresponding to any given target pose is termed inverse kinematics (IK).
child_1ea12ecbd12944b0abc546b3acf79065.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_07dfa19ed77c4cb1bea500a6c8335996.content:
In that, FK is used to map a
robot configuration into the corresponding end-effector pose, whereas IK is used to reconstruct the configuration(s)
given an end-effector pose.
child_07dfa19ed77c4cb1bea500a6c8335996.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_578d9b11f9d04b89b32b19f4919e27ae.content:
In the simplified case here considered (for which p ≡ p, as the orientation of the end-effector is disregarded for
simplicity), one can solve the problem of controlling the end-effector’s location to reach a goal position p∗ by solving
analytically for q : p(q) = fFK(q) = p∗.
child_578d9b11f9d04b89b32b19f4919e27ae.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_af4287fe50254b0c937f6854c66d8f52.content:
However, in the general case, one might not be able to solve this problem
analytically, and can typically
child_af4287fe50254b0c937f6854c66d8f52.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_e4e89eb7c67042dca0708656e76c420d.content:
er, in the general case, one might not be able to solve this problem
analytically, and can typically resort to iterative optimization methods comparing candidate solutions using a loss
function (in the simplest case, ∥p(q)− p∗∥22 is a natural candidate), yielding:

min ∥p(q)− p∗∥22 .

workspace, resulting in constraints on the possible values of q ∈ Q ⊆ [−π,+π]n ⊂ Rn in the general case of n-links
robots.

2.3.1 Adding Feedback Loops
While very effective when a goal trajectory has been well specified, the performance of diff-IK can degrade significantly
in the presence of modeling/tracking errors, or in the presence of non-modeled dynamics in the environment.
child_a387790b62fd4c43b8e3ac95b279fc71.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_bc9ce4a3da2549ebbdbcb7c8fc1d7a0f.content:
One such case is presented in Figure 7, where another rigid body other than
the manipulator is moving in the environment along the horizontal axis, with
velocity ẋB .

child_55bd70da8cb34584bfa50219f42f8155.content:
Accounting analytically for the presence of this disturbance—for
instance, to prevent the midpoint of the link from ever colliding with the
object—requires access to ẋB at least, to derive the equation characterizing
the motion of the environment.

Less predictable disturbances however (e.g., ẋB ← ẋB + ε, ε ∼ N(0, 1)) may
prove challenging to model analytically, and one could attain the same result of Figure 7 | Planar manipulator robot
preventing link-object collision by a

preventing link-object collision by adding a condition on the distance between in the presence of a moving obstacle.

the midpoint of l and xB, enforced through a feedback loop on the position
of the robot and object at each control cycle.

child_1e7aea80ee7d41ebb0521d33b32eae62.content:
To mitigate the effect of modeling errors, sensing noise and other disturbances,
classical pipelines indeed do augment diff-IK with feedback control looping back quantities of interest.
child_1e7aea80ee7d41ebb0521d33b32eae62.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_ab9a7573d9a343d785efa881a84891ae.content:
In practice,
following a trajectory with a closed feedback loop might consist in backwarding the error between the target and
measured pose, ∆p = p∗ − p(q), hereby modifying the control applied to q̇ = J(q)+(ṗ∗ + kp∆p), with kp defined as
the (proportional) gain.
child_ab9a7573d9a343d785efa881a84891ae.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_e63979a8c3054901ae6b97857e3a8ab5.content:
More advanced techniques for control consisting in feedback linearization, PID control, Linear Quatratic Regulator
(LQR) or Model-Predictive Control (MPC) can be employed to stabilize tracking and reject moderate perturbations,
and we refer to Sic
child_e63979a8c3054901ae6b97857e3a8ab5.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_ac3d7ac5cc0d46e196057d5f9a991832.content:
l (MPC) can be employed to stabilize tracking and reject moderate perturbations,
and we refer to Siciliano and Khatib (2016, Chapter 8) for in-detail explanation of these concepts, or (Tedrake, a,
Chapter 8) for a simple, intuitive example in the case of a point-mass system.
child_ac3d7ac5cc0d46e196057d5f9a991832.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_978f894dfae646048656b412453b3df9.content:
Nonetheless, feedback control presents
its challenges as well: tuning gains remains laborious and system-specific.
child_978f894dfae646048656b412453b3df9.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_4585eb8b925d45c4bc111693aaeeb2cc.content:
Further, manipulation tasks present
intermittent contacts inducing hybrid dynamics (mode switches) and discontinuities in the Jacobian, challenging
the stability guarantees of the controller and thus often necessitating rather conservative gains and substantial
hand-tuning.
child_4585eb8b925d45c4bc111693aaeeb2cc.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_094871cc40c34518a1586078d7df2ea9.content:
We point the interested reader to Siciliano and Khatib (2016, Chapter 2,7,8), Lynch and Park (2017, Chapter 6,11),
and Tedrake (a, Chapter 3,8) for extended coverage of FK, IK, diff-IK and control for (diff-)IK.
child_094871cc40c34518a1586078d7df2ea9.title: ROBOT LEARNING

Despite the last 60+ years of robotics research, autonomous robots are still l

child_a561d58aef5848a48dd59503f1598ff4.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_4b001d102b5c4ab49a80ea8f841fdf16.content:
While
essential in the early development of robotics, the aforementioned methods require significant human
child_4b001d102b5c4ab49a80ea8f841fdf16.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_e70db86bbe0a421da9ba9392b113e280.content:
essential in the early development of robotics, the aforementioned methods require significant human expertise to be
used in practice, and are typically specific to a particular applicative problem.
child_e70db86bbe0a421da9ba9392b113e280.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_3810b5fd7c1f443c86d4cb936b9f0fb3.content:
Dynamics-based robotics pipelines have historically been developed sequentially, engineering the different blocks now
within most architectures for specific purposes.
child_3810b5fd7c1f443c86d4cb936b9f0fb3.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_d2a5cfa3175048799754e07186d1e734.content:
That is, sensing, state estimation, mapping, planning, (diff-)IK, and
low-level control have been traditionally developed as distinct modules with fixed interfaces.
child_d2a5cfa3175048799754e07186d1e734.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_6c576ac713ab40d88f644bbe15be3e73.content:
Pipelining these specific
modules proved error-prone, and brittleness emerges—alongside compounding errors—whenever changes incur (e.g.,
changes in lighting for sensing, occlusion/failure of sensors, control failures).
child_6c576ac713ab40d88f644bbe15be3e73.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_23a5f81bb5b14f599cc04fdc0c62581e.content:
Adapting such a stack to new tasks
or robotic platforms often entails re-specifying objectives, constraints, and heuristics at multiple stages, incurring
significant engineering overhead.
child_23a5f81bb5b14f599cc04fdc0c62581e.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_10beab6acbbf465c9327d44ce2d2412a.content: Moreover, classical planners operate on compact, assumed-suffi
child_10beab6acbbf465c9327d44ce2d2412a.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_045b2aa880c14a91b3cf542f404a5aca.content:
Moreover, classical planners operate on compact, assumed-sufficient state representations; extending them to reason
directly over raw, heterogeneous and noisy data streams is non-trivial.
child_045b2aa880c14a91b3cf542f404a5aca.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_a6ccb582133d435db96f7722d5ded3fb.content:
This results in a limited scalability to
multimodal data and multitask settings, as incorporating high-dimensional perceptual inputs (RGB, depth, tactile,
audio) traditionally required extensive engineering efforts to extract meaningful features for control.
child_a6ccb582133d435db96f7722d5ded3fb.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_94256a055a574bcdb3c1404acc7aa50c.content:
Also, the large
number of tasks, coupled with the adoption of per-task planners, goal parameterizations, and safety constraints,
results in an explosion in design and validation options, with little opportunity to reuse solutions across tasks.
child_94256a055a574bcdb3c1404acc7aa50c.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_75681b8e7dd4473596fa35aceee43a6c.content:
Setting aside integration and scalability challenges: developing accurate modeling of contact, friction, and compliance
for complicated systems remains difficult.
child_75681b8e7dd4473596fa35aceee43a6c.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_4cd990fdca814c298e4321070991c68c.content:
Rigid-body approximations are often insufficient in the presence of
deformable objects, and relying on appro
child_4cd990fdca814c298e4321070991c68c.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_e7faa47423ce4603b273cd66b0cb016e.content:
dy approximations are often insufficient in the presence of
deformable objects, and relying on approximated models hinders real-world applicability of the methods developed.
child_e7faa47423ce4603b273cd66b0cb016e.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_0ef3328614b54e6e9ca74e8def7ab7bd.content:
14



In the case of complex, time-dependent and/or non-linear dynamics, even moderate mismatches in parameters,
unmodeled evolutions, or grasp-induced couplings can qualitatively affect the observed dynamics.
child_0ef3328614b54e6e9ca74e8def7ab7bd.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_9eac854ccb1640a09f8f75c4357aef68.content:
Lastly, dynamics-based methods (naturally) overlook the rather recent increase in availability of openly-available
robotics datasets.
child_9eac854ccb1640a09f8f75c4357aef68.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_d8f42573a01244409d5da65bcb1b6ffb.content:
The curation of academic datasets by large centralized groups of human experts in robotics (O’Neill
et al., 2025; Khazatsky et al., 2025) is now increasingly complemented by a growing number of robotics datasets
contributed in a decentralized fashion by individuals with varied expertise.
child_d8f42573a01244409d5da65bcb1b6ffb.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_37974fd5227a40b581ddc448ecb11f97.content:
If not tangentially, dynamics-based
approaches are not posed to maximally benefit from this trend, which holds the premise of allowing generalization in
the space of tasks and embodiments, lik
child_37974fd5227a40b581ddc448ecb11f97.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_a9312d53dfd64bb0ac6244e1ab48b97b.content:
trend, which holds the premise of allowing generalization in
the space of tasks and embodiments, like data was the cornerstone for advancements in vision (Alayrac et al., 2022)
and natural-language understanding (Brown et al., 2020).
child_a9312d53dfd64bb0ac6244e1ab48b97b.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_169571f39fb646f0a3b355b80bc76da3.content:
Taken together, these limitations (Figure 8) motivate the exploration of learning-based approaches that can (1)
integrate perception and control more tightly, (2) adapt across tasks and embodiments with reduced expert modeling
interventions and (3) scale gracefully in performance as more robotics data becomes available.
child_169571f39fb646f0a3b355b80bc76da3.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_b54ee56152ea45aa924ed62407727ca4.content:
15



Figure 9 | Learning-based robotics streamlines perception-to-action by learning a (1) unified high-level controller capable to
take (2) high-dimensional, unstructured sensorimotor information.
child_b54ee56152ea45aa924ed62407727ca4.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_cf36b5d3865843b19376cf2d17ecbb7d.content:
Learning (3) does not require a dynamics model and instead
focuses on interaction data, and (4) empirically correlates with the scale of the data used.
child_cf36b5d3865843b19376cf2d17ecbb7d.title: ROBOT LEARNING

TL;DR

The need for expensive, high-fidelity simulators can be obviated learning from real-world data, using sample-
efficient algorithms that can safely train directly on hardware.
child_85f02a24cff848f4a7b967774eff044d.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_d819bc3af6fc4e208f2d23225af2325e.content: Learning-based techniques for robotics naturally address the limitations presented in Section 2 (Figure 9).
child_d819bc3af6fc4e208f2d23225af2325e.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_20ace950efeb425ea4d39e7aac17e30f.content:
In particular,
learning-based techniques typically rely on monolithich prediction-to-action pipelines (visuomotor policies) which
do directly map sensorimotor inputs to predicted actions, streamlining control policies by removing the need to
interface multiple components.
child_20ace950efeb425ea4d39e7aac17e30f.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_3acfe0ff479241b7b7e30db43a892d91.content:
Mapping sensory inputs to actions also makes it possible to incorporate diverse
input modalities, leveraging the automatic feature extraction capabilities of modern learning systems.
child_3acfe0ff479241b7b7e30db43a892d91.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_8d587c2ab58d44b9b92b4724830c7b5b.content:
Moreover,
learning-based approaches can, in principle, bypass explicit modeling altogether and instead rely solely on interaction
data—an advantag
child_8d587c2ab58d44b9b92b4724830c7b5b.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_0a87d3fc00a24d9d9a9d973e925fb48a.content:
inciple, bypass explicit modeling altogether and instead rely solely on interaction
data—an advantage that proves transformative when dynamics are difficult to model or entirely unknown.
child_0a87d3fc00a24d9d9a9d973e925fb48a.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_bd935f48d9014c38beee73a4a5c55a25.content:
Lastly,
learning for robotics (robot learning) is naturally well posed to leverage the growing amount of robotics data openly
available, just as computer vision and natural language processing did historically benefit from large-scale corpora of
data, in great part overlooked by dynamics-based approaches.
child_bd935f48d9014c38beee73a4a5c55a25.title: ROBOT LEARNING

In this section, we provide a conceptual overview of applications of RL to
robotics, as well as introduce practical examples of how to use RL within lerobot.

While signif-
icantly different in spirit—generalist models are language-conditioned and use
instructions to generate motion valid across many tasks, while task-specific
models are typically not language-conditioned and used to perform a single
task—foundation models are still largely trained to reproduce trajectories
contained in a (large) training set of input demonstrations.

reproduce trajectories

generalist policies can indeed be grouped alongside other task-specific BC
methods, as they both leverage similar training data and schemas.

child_7c4d7a5ed48840d0b86aa5c1c5bbb36f.content:
3.1 A (Concise) Introduction to RL
The RL framework (Sutton and Barto, 2018), which we briefly introduce here, has often been used to tackle robotics
problems (Kober et al.).
child_7c4d7a5ed48840d0b86aa5c1c5bbb36f.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_6c8ce130e291438d8a5a50d12e70b23e.content:
RL is a subfield within ML fundamentally concerned with the development of autonomous
systems (agents) capable to continuously behave in an evolving environment, developing (ideally, well-performing)
control strategies (policies).
child_6c8ce130e291438d8a5a50d12e70b23e.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_29549a7a62234b00899f289def1ecc6e.content:
Crucially for robotics, RL agents improve through trial and error, bypassing explicit
models of the problem dynamics in favor of interaction data.
child_29549a7a62234b00899f289def1ecc6e.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_4209d4496348402ebae9bdec0df42ebc.content:
In RL, this feedback loop between actions and outcomes
(Figure 12) is established through the agent sensing a scalar quantity (reward) measuring how desirable a given
transition is for the accomplishment of its goal.
child_4209d4496348402ebae9bdec0df42ebc.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_a51afdae72fc44a38218f89bb377ac96.content:
Representing robotics problems via MDPs offers several advantages, including (1)
incorporating uncertainty through MDP’s inherently stochastic formulation and (2) providing a theoretically-sound
framework for learning without an explicit model of the environment dynamics.
child_a51afdae72fc44a38218f89bb377ac96.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_e8599525612d41a4b93751ab86010489.content:
While accommodating a continuous
time formulation too, MDPs are typically considered in discrete time in RL, assuming interactions to atomically take
place at discrete timestep t = 0, 1, 2, 3, .

child_0bc991b241284f708059ea149fefe086.content:
MDPs allowing for an unbounded number of interactions (T → +∞)
are termed infinite-horizon, and opposed to finite-horizon MDPs in which T is finite.
child_0bc991b241284f708059ea149fefe086.title: ROBOT LEARNING

Unless diversely specified, we
will only be referring to discrete-time finite-horizon (episodic) MDPs.
Formally, a lenght-T Markov Decision Process (MDP) is a tuple M = ⟨S,A,D, r, γ, ρ, T ⟩, where:

• S is the state space

child_42d6434dc40f48f09afb23fe37313e4d.content:
A variety of algorithms have been developed in RL attempting to find (approximate) solutions to the
problem of maximizing cumulative reward (we report some in Figure 13).
child_42d6434dc40f48f09afb23fe37313e4d.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_71333a1d42d0481197f08a4c2a7ee9c6.content: Popular approaches to continuous state and action space—such as those studied within robotics—i
child_71333a1d42d0481197f08a4c2a7ee9c6.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_b81a6240ae01456793505ebfda1b01fc.content:
Popular approaches to continuous state and action space—such as those studied within robotics—include Schulman
et al.
child_b81a6240ae01456793505ebfda1b01fc.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_3a7b971502394ecda527265c5489110f.content:
Discrepancies in the simulation dynamics (reality gap) pose risks
to policy transfer.
child_3a7b971502394ecda527265c5489110f.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_178a942af6bb46fe83993e39d8e7c4c6.content:
et al., 2019) and locomotion problems (Lee et al., 2020), RL proved extremely effective in providing a platform to (1)
leverage a unified, streamlined perception-to-action pipeline, (2) natively integrate propioperception with multi-modal
high-dimensional sensory streams (3) disregard a description of the environment dynamics, by focusing on observed
interaction data rather than modeling, and (4) anchor policies in the experience collected and stored in datasets.
child_178a942af6bb46fe83993e39d8e7c4c6.title: ROBOT LEARNING
