For
a more complete survey of applications of RL to robotics, we refer the reader to Kober et al.; Tang et al.
child_bb5d821edeff4fd5afb5dff1e4344f2f.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_567e88df17c24b2d83d2d951e7270b58.content: to robotics, we refer the reader to Kober et al.; Tang et al.
child_567e88df17c24b2d83d2d951e7270b58.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_b640620b50084504903d445803115fd0.content:
3.2 Real-world RL for Robotics
Streamlined end-to-end control pipelines, data-driven feature extraction and a disregard for explicit modeling in favor
of interaction data are all features of RL for robotics.
child_b640620b50084504903d445803115fd0.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_24a9dafcfda944ff97062bc087ecf4ec.content:
However, RL still suffers from limitations concerning safety and
learning efficiency, particularly pressing for real-world robotics applications.
child_24a9dafcfda944ff97062bc087ecf4ec.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_f90fd1a5ab6c4b1da97fb46571d7e26d.content: First, especially early in training, actions are typically explorative, and thus may be erractic.
child_f90fd1a5ab6c4b1da97fb46571d7e26d.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_9d64cc8a6c7d45d59974934b15961cb4.content:
On physical systems,
untrained policies may command high velocities, self-collisiding configurations, or torques exceeding joint limits,
leading to wear and potential hardware damage.
child_9d64cc8a6c7d45d59974934b15961cb4.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_b67106f4b22a48c0ace345749f835b20.content:
Mitigating these risks requires external safeguards (e.g., watchdogs,
safety monitors, emergency stops), often incuring in a high degree of human supervision.
child_b67106f4b22a48c0ace345749f835b20.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_6f5b7b2c0b5549779a28483df2c93a0d.content:
Further, in the typical
episodic setting considered in most robotics problems, experimentation is substantially slowed down by the ne
child_6f5b7b2c0b5549779a28483df2c93a0d.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_dc9cea7c828c453884c4456ea4f12a19.content:
setting considered in most robotics problems, experimentation is substantially slowed down by the need to
manually reset the environment over the course of training, a time-consuming and error-prone process.
child_dc9cea7c828c453884c4456ea4f12a19.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_3fbd7964eacf4ded85fe507c4b6e4835.content:
Second, learning
efficiently remains problematic in RL, limiting the applicability of RL in real-world robotics due to consequently
prohibitive timescales of training.
child_3fbd7964eacf4ded85fe507c4b6e4835.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_a2383360fa6144ec9a8992b7220987a8.content:
Even strong algorithms such as SAC (Haarnoja et al., 2018) typically require a
large numbers of transitions {(st, at, rt, st+1)}Nt=1.
child_a2383360fa6144ec9a8992b7220987a8.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_9fa129e6b9964f0abab3593d0ed529db.content: On real-world hardware, generating this data is time-consuming.
child_9fa129e6b9964f0abab3593d0ed529db.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_4477f591b4b149c7a78e6c7d0ceae953.content:
Training RL policies in simulation (Tobin et al., 2017) addresses both issues, eliminating physical risk and dramatically
increasing throughput.
child_4477f591b4b149c7a78e6c7d0ceae953.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_39d963adce724d3dba5451ce3066f3cc.content:
Yet, simulators require significant modeling effort, and rely on assumptions (simplified physical
modeling, instantaneous actuation, static environmental conditions, etc.) limiting the possibilities to transfer the
policies learned in simulation, due the discrepancy between real a
child_39d963adce724d3dba5451ce3066f3cc.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_9cc0b8433c084996bd66d85b353c9313.content:
the possibilities to transfer the
policies learned in simulation, due the discrepancy between real and simulated environments (reality gap, Figure 14).
child_9cc0b8433c084996bd66d85b353c9313.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_43ffbdf8dec642f08347c0efd1407251.content:
Domain randomization (Tobin et al., 2017) (DR) is a popular technique to overcome the reality gap, and consists in
randomizing the parameters of the simulated environment during training, aiming at inducing robustness to specific
disturbances.
child_43ffbdf8dec642f08347c0efd1407251.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_3f408c3ab761493d8b19129ce25b7d41.content:
In this, DR is typically employed to increase the diversity of scenarios over the course of training,
improving on the performace sim-to-real transferred policies (Akkaya et al., 2019; Antonova et al., 2017; Ji et al.,
2023).
child_3f408c3ab761493d8b19129ce25b7d41.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_e90d47b36cea43f693c6e364ecfca7a3.content:
In practice, DR is performed training in simulation on simulated dynamics D, further parametrized as D ≡ Dξ,
with a dynamics (random) vector ξ drawn an arbitrary distribution, ξ ∼ Ξ.
child_e90d47b36cea43f693c6e364ecfca7a3.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_70209b50200143d59b80315a80935046.content:
For instance, one could decide to
randomize the friction coefficient of the surface in a locomotion task (Figure 15), or the center of mass of an object
for a manipulation task.
child_70209b50200143d59b80315a80935046.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_794b698247b24a02a8d6a56742922c79.content:
tion task (Figure 15), or the center of mass of an object
for a manipulation task.
child_794b698247b24a02a8d6a56742922c79.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_cab6162b49124716aeefb5bfa86b9b5d.content:
Over the course of training—typically at each episode’s reset—a new ξ is drawn, and used to
specify the environment’s dynamics for that episode.
child_cab6162b49124716aeefb5bfa86b9b5d.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_22f5bd451efe44178c1274ad75bb37e1.content:
While effective in transfering policies across the reality gap in real-world robotics (Tobin et al., 2017; Akkaya et al.,
2019; Ji et al., 2023; Tiboni et al., 2024), DR often requires extensive manual engineering.
child_22f5bd451efe44178c1274ad75bb37e1.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_d7036f19514f48a482ed506e4ad267b7.content:
First, identifying which

20



Figure 15 | The same locomotion task can be carried out in different (simulated) domains (exemplified by the difference in
terrains) at training time, resulting to increased robustness over diverse environment dynamics.
child_d7036f19514f48a482ed506e4ad267b7.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_f6f3311861e04b27a934f1cb8a0bfd13.content: parameters to randomize—i.e., the support supp(Ξ) of Ξ—is an inherently task specific process.
child_f6f3311861e04b27a934f1cb8a0bfd13.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_c32883f87cbd48228b74a0ac2b2e45e6.content:
When locomoting over
different terrains, choosing to randomize the friction coefficient is a reasonable choice, yet not completely resolutive as
other factors (lightning conditions, external temperature, joint
child_c32883f87cbd48228b74a0ac2b2e45e6.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_1619340caa424631b1633b1d60c8c922.content:
e, yet not completely resolutive as
other factors (lightning conditions, external temperature, joints’ fatigue, etc.) may prove just as important in practice,
making selecting these parameters yet another source of brittlness.
child_1619340caa424631b1633b1d60c8c922.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_66c7044df1ad48489f63d8de75e1376b.content: Selecting the dynamics distribution Ξ is also non-trivial.
child_66c7044df1ad48489f63d8de75e1376b.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_a414a2dce3934a4398e4db4989e27746.content:
On the one hand, distributions with low entropy might risk
to cause failure at transfer time, due to the limited robustness induced over the course of training.
child_a414a2dce3934a4398e4db4989e27746.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_dd543361da0e4720b65bf53ad1bc3501.content:
On the other hand,
excessive randomization may cause over-regularization and hinder performance (Margolis et al., 2022).
child_dd543361da0e4720b65bf53ad1bc3501.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_46e3bcb3e1de4181a6a5b512edde3655.content:
Consequently,
the research community investigated approaches to automatically select the randomization distribution Ξ, using
signals from the training process or tuning it to reproduce observed real-world trajectories.
child_46e3bcb3e1de4181a6a5b512edde3655.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_ac39ac7d95054db3b8beee3a6a6bbf39.content:
(2019)
use a parametric uniform distribution U(a, b) as Ξ, widening the bounds a, b as training progresses and the agent’s
performance improves (AutoDR).
child_ac39ac7d95054db3b8beee3a6a6bbf39.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_83e5369bc44f44a18e9cb26926ed8248.content:
gresses and the agent’s
performance improves (AutoDR).
child_83e5369bc44f44a18e9cb26926ed8248.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_ca062b7c374e4b89979732b33a9ffc8d.content:
While effective, AutoDR requires significant tuning—the bounds are widened by a
fixed, pre-specified amount ∆ along—and may disregard data when performance does not improve after a distribution
update (Tiboni et al., 2024).
child_ca062b7c374e4b89979732b33a9ffc8d.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_33cc5eaebeb54e8f93f9da540de34e2b.content:
(2024) propose a similar method to AutoDR (DORAEMON) to evolve Ξ
based on the training signal, but with the key difference of explicitly maximizing the entropy of a parametric Beta
distribution—inherently more flexible than uniform distributions—with learned updates instead of fixed ∆.
child_33cc5eaebeb54e8f93f9da540de34e2b.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_878991be088844c38f12d6e3117c0334.content:
In this,
DORAEMON proves particularly effective at dynamically increasing the entropy levels of the training distribution by
employing an outer-loop max-entropy objective, tackled under performance constraints in the inner-loop RL problem.
child_878991be088844c38f12d6e3117c0334.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_7894fb681dbb4d39b8e2a756a3a42235.content:
Other approaches to automatically perform DR consist in specifically tuning Ξ to align as much as possible the
simulation and real-world domains.
child_7894fb681dbb4d39b8e2a756a3a42235.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_8498096619af4fa0b981391c5f9032e8.content:
align as much as possible the
simulation and real-world domains.
child_8498096619af4fa0b981391c5f9032e8.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_cc31a3c4a3324e85b9ce73f23a7b10ec.content:
(2019) interleave in-simulation policy training with
repeated real-world policy rollouts used to adjust Ξ based on real-world data, while Tiboni et al.
child_cc31a3c4a3324e85b9ce73f23a7b10ec.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_bc04909bb5a94f15aab568346fa547e3.content:
(2023) leverage a
single, pre-collected set of real-world trajectories and tune Ξ under a simple likelihood objective.
child_bc04909bb5a94f15aab568346fa547e3.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_f8ef76cfb9e24f16a0fbfeb0f155f1e0.content:
While DR has shown promise, it does not address the main limitation that, even under the assumption that an ideal
distribution Ξ was available, many robotics problems cannot be simulated with high-enough fidelity under practical
computational constraints.
child_f8ef76cfb9e24f16a0fbfeb0f155f1e0.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_a9a9fed44c0d48a3b6fdc7eda3e20332.content:
Simulating contact-rich manipulation of possibly deformable or soft materials—i.e., folding
a piece of clothing—can prove time-intensive, limiting the benefits of in-simulation training.
child_a9a9fed44c0d48a3b6fdc7eda3e20332.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_1425f32afdcb4163bad26db5cb1ab3d1.content:
A perhaps more foundamental limitation of RL for robotics is the general unavailability of complicated tasks’ dense
reward function, the design of which is essentially based on human experti
child_1425f32afdcb4163bad26db5cb1ab3d1.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_7ac3b43a6b4449adaf76041e5473ba13.content:
complicated tasks’ dense
reward function, the design of which is essentially based on human expertise, ingenuity and trial-and-error.
child_7ac3b43a6b4449adaf76041e5473ba13.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_8d1a1ee6cce44c8689654277b1cc3342.content:
In
practice, sparse reward functions can be used to conclude whether one specific goal has been attained—has this t-shirt
been correctly folded?—but unfortunately incur in more challenging learning.
child_8d1a1ee6cce44c8689654277b1cc3342.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_b91e9135cd72411fbd3ebc2ba2d7ceec.content:
As a result, despite notable successes,
deploying RL directly on real-world robots at scale remains challenging.
child_b91e9135cd72411fbd3ebc2ba2d7ceec.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_56974b6b725047b6a6fcdcee7a206ce9.content:
To make the most of (1) the growing number of openly available datasets and (2) relatively inexpensive robots like the
SO-100, RL could (1) be anchored in already-collected trajectories—limiting erratic and dangerous exploration—and
(2) train in the real-world directly—bypassing the aforementioned issues with low-fidelity simulations.
child_56974b6b725047b6a6fcdcee7a206ce9.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_54576428b9a34d0bb6ee1d0ae3bfdde4.content:
In such a
context, sample-efficient learning is also paramount, as training on the real-world is inherently time-bottlenecked.
child_54576428b9a34d0bb6ee1d0ae3bfdde4.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_9efa1ca7fb884656baa76abf343cf181.content: Off-policy algorithms like Soft Actor-Critic (SAC) (Haarnoja et al., 2018) tend to be mor
child_9efa1ca7fb884656baa76abf343cf181.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_bb1dfe87eafd45809a8ec59a68ce2ae3.content:
Off-policy algorithms like Soft Actor-Critic (SAC) (Haarnoja et al., 2018) tend to be more sample efficient then their
on-policy counterpart (Schulman et al., 2017b), due to the presence a replay buffer used over the course of training.
child_bb1dfe87eafd45809a8ec59a68ce2ae3.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_c2a0199c32454e3da43656e7d2164688.content:
Other than allowing to re-use past transitions (st, at, rt, st+1), the replay buffer can also accomodate for the injection
of previously-collected data in the training process (Ball et al., 2023).
child_c2a0199c32454e3da43656e7d2164688.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_484bd42643154bf19d2925dc15a3a1f1.content:
Using expert demonstrations to guide learning
together with learned rewards, RL can be effectively carried out in the real-world (Luo et al., 2025).
child_484bd42643154bf19d2925dc15a3a1f1.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_33297b076a2f4e938e586fac700ed318.content:
Interestingly,
when complemented with in-training human interventions, real-world RL agents have been shown to learn policies
with near-perfect success rates on challenging manipulation tasks in 1-2 hours (Luo et al., 2024).
child_33297b076a2f4e938e586fac700ed318.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_b6bf43a304aa4e91b9d44a985e6f10b8.content:

child_6e9a3eaad26d43b2bb28b6c0d522375f.content:
Effective in its early applications to small-scale discrete problems, vanilla Q-learning was found complicated to scale
to large S ×A problems, in which storing Q : S ×A 7→ R alone might result prohibitive.
child_6e9a3eaad26d43b2bb28b6c0d522375f.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_0774bcd8a93d45708fd2048d9f53aa62.content:
Also, vanilla Q-learning is
not directly usable for continuous, unstructured state-action space MPDs, such as those considered in robotics.
child_0774bcd8a93d45708fd2048d9f53aa62.title: ROBOT LEARNING

Soft Actor-Critic (SAC) (Haarnoja et al., 2018) is a derivation of DDPG in the max-entropy (MaxEnt) RL framework,
in which RL agents are tasked with maximizing the discounted cumulative reward, while acting as randomly as
possible.
child_5cd2f1aca1c54e79be44273748d1b5f7.title: ROBOT LEARNING

ounted cumulative reward, while acting as randomly as

child_ad2b210825a04285bbfbfcab790a40ed.content:
Sample-efficient, data-driven RL Sampling (st, at, rt, st+1) from the replay buffer D conveniently allows to approx-
imate expectations for TD-target and TD-error through Monte-Carlo (MC) estimates.
child_ad2b210825a04285bbfbfcab790a40ed.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_8e56d3de2e8b48759bf65b97199c9e66.content:
The replay buffer D also
proves extremely useful in maintaining a history of previous transitions and using it for training, improving on sample
efficiency.
child_8e56d3de2e8b48759bf65b97199c9e66.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_dc63db2ba728417a922b89803257d3cf.content:
Furthermore, it also naturally provides an entry point to inject offline trajectories recorded by a human
demonstrator into the training process.
child_dc63db2ba728417a922b89803257d3cf.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_176af97174e04c05909b5da6ba9fb07d.content:
Reinforcement Learning with Prior Data (RLPD) (Ball et al., 2023) is an Offline-to-Online RL algorithm leveraging
prior data to effectively accelerate the training of a SAC agent.
child_176af97174e04c05909b5da6ba9fb07d.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_2d86ec3039ea45879f600e979cbbffdc.content:
Unlike previous works on Offline-to-Online RL, RLPD
avoids any pre-training and instead only uses the available offline data Doffline to improve online-learning from scratch.
child_2d86ec3039ea45879f600e979cbbffdc.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_031e2b76321b438881d3a5f0d049c551.content: During each training step, transitions from both the offline and online replay buffers a
child_031e2b76321b438881d3a5f0d049c551.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_22a25d99951645ca8ccbdfb82c5fca31.content:
During each training step, transitions from both the offline and online replay buffers are sampled in equal proportions,
and used in the underlying SAC routine.
child_22a25d99951645ca8ccbdfb82c5fca31.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_4987d2967d4f422bac6f7a379f093d4c.content:
Together with other implementation details (using LayerNorm layers to
prevent value overestimation, and the use of ensembles techniques to form the TD-target), RLPD proves a particularly
simple yet effective approach to use Doffline for Offline-to-Online RL.
child_4987d2967d4f422bac6f7a379f093d4c.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_d1ce3d83bee34d79853efc7ff4fc6b7e.content:
Sample-efficient, data-driven, real-world RL Despite the possibility to leverage offline data for learning, the
effectiveness of real-world RL training is still limited by the need to define a task-specific, hard-to-define reward
function.
child_d1ce3d83bee34d79853efc7ff4fc6b7e.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_7a18173c147e4df2aaa73348e1551cc5.content:
Further, even assuming to have access to a well-defined reward function, typical robotics pipelines rely
on augmenting propioperceptive inputs with camera streams, and thus even well-defined rewards would need to be
defined starting from unstructured observation—a challenging assumption in practice.
child_7a18173c147e4df2aaa73348e1551cc5.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_f293483d10da4ae39a792ed51d943d03.content: rting from unstructured observation—a challenging assumption in practice.
child_f293483d10da4ae39a792ed51d943d03.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_d3700587d90c4ee983eb40d274ae9f6b.content:
In their technical report, Luo
et al.
child_d3700587d90c4ee983eb40d274ae9f6b.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_c51580da09ae4b249087a0fad49b8729.content:
(2025) empirically address the needs (1) to define a reward function and (2) to use it starting from unstructured,
image observations.
child_c51580da09ae4b249087a0fad49b8729.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_d0ce32c704e347e8b83a284c2945a2ff.content:
(2025, SERL) introduces a suite of tools streamlining training of reward
classifiers c, as well as jointly learn forward-backward controllers to speed up real-world RL.
child_d0ce32c704e347e8b83a284c2945a2ff.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_5e7c8f62d25e4028b6f2b4eb3297bb69.content:
Reward classifiers are particularly useful in treating complex, dynamic tasks—e.g., folding a t-shirt—for which a
precise reward formulation is arbitrarily complex to obtain, or that do require significant shaping and are more easily
learned directly from demonstrations of success (e+) or failure (e−) states, rather than from a precise formulation
of rt, with a natural target for the reward classifier being r(s) = log c(e+ verts).
child_5e7c8f62d25e4028b6f2b4eb3297bb69.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_e68180b9b77a4f7fb730cba7d95fb769.content:
(2025)
demonstrate the benefits of learning separate (1) forward and (2) backward controllers—param
child_e68180b9b77a4f7fb730cba7d95fb769.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_efd8f32fe3e746c0b09f930d6534028b.content:
(2025)
demonstrate the benefits of learning separate (1) forward and (2) backward controllers—parametrized by separate
policies—where (1) the former learns to execute a task to completion and (2) the latter learns to reset the environment
to its initial state from terminal states, thereby aiding training in real-world episodic settings.
child_efd8f32fe3e746c0b09f930d6534028b.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_b7bcfe9e6315432ca471e93c260b3077.content:
Lastly, in order to improve on the robustness of their approach to different goals while maintaing practical scalabil-
ity, Luo et al.
child_b7bcfe9e6315432ca471e93c260b3077.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_0b266fd8abdc41899be9703f5f1befd8.content:
(2025) introduced a modified state and action space, expressing proprioperceptive configurations q and
actions q̇ in the frame of the end-effector pose at t = 0.
child_0b266fd8abdc41899be9703f5f1befd8.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_37cfb9ac192742218ad7b01fb03cbe1d.content:
Randomizing the initial pose of the end-effector (s0), Luo
et al.

(2025) achieved a similar result to that of manually randomizing the environment at every timestep, but with

Human-in-the-Loop, Sample Efficient Robot reinforcement Learning (HIL-SERL) (Luo et al., 2024) augments offline-
to-online RL with targeted human corrections during training, and employs prior data to (1) train a reward classi
child_87873a8140694f2bae96d319ca39d940.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_fd1c62cb4d994fe7835ed7a8d6bb77c6.content:
with targeted human corrections during training, and employs prior data to (1) train a reward classifier
and (2) bootstrap RL training on expert trajectories.

child_9c8a77c2fef242ccae718dc60f647650.content:
While offline demonstrations provide the initial dataset seeding
learning and constraining early exploration, interactive, online corrections allow a human supervisor to intervene on
failure modes and supply targeted interventions, greatly aiding the learning process (Luo et al., 2024).
child_9c8a77c2fef242ccae718dc60f647650.title: ROBOT LEARNING

human intervention data is stored in both the offline and online replay buffers, differently from the autonomous
transitions generated at training time and stored in the online buffer only.

child_d2b9294607f94e01baad4d3016db0db1.content:
This code example is organized
into four parts: we first show how to train a reward classifier from a custom set of demonstrations, then define
the Actor and Learner components, and finally, we bring them together in a complete script showing how to use
HIL-SERL in practice.
child_d2b9294607f94e01baad4d3016db0db1.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_be24d8cca0714914905bf4bb566d5b44.content:
At a higher level, the HIL-SERL architecture (Figure 17) relies on two main components:

• An Actor, running a frozen policy network used to interact with the environment and obtain observations.
child_be24d8cca0714914905bf4bb566d5b44.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_5f672e332f0845d1a5bcecfac76b81e8.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_226ff6e953fd4800849b7a003ef12dca.content:
Observations are used to both condition the frozen actor in selecting the action to enact, and to form (st, at, rt, st+1)
transitions that are shared with the Learner.
child_226ff6e953fd4800849b7a003ef12dca.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_3d38d7f6091d428ba545dfc7e2d446af.content:
Rewards are inferred using a custom, learned reward classifier trained
on a dataset of offline demonstrations.
child_3d38d7f6091d428ba545dfc7e2d446af.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_36813ce5332948759fe92aa908f07485.content: • A Learner, used to optimize the policy’s parameters θ for maximum expected return.

3.2.2 Limitations of RL in Real-World Robotics: Simulators and Reward Design
Despite the advancements in real-world RL training, training RL agents for real-world tasks still suffers from the
following limitations:

• In those instances where real-world training experience is prohibitively expensive to gather (e.g., Tokamak
control (Degrave et al., 2022), Autonomous Stratospehere Navigation (Bellemare et al., 2020))in-simulation training
is often the only viable option.
child_39ab0072ad3c44fa83c6d457a273d96e.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_b5c7a750a3634f8485a300b6662b4348.content:
However, high-fidelity simulators for real-world problems can be difficult to build
and maintain, especially for contact-rich manipulation and tasks involving deformable
child_b5c7a750a3634f8485a300b6662b4348.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_70767c9abe2a431e95e3e1ecd8bcea46.content:
icult to build
and maintain, especially for contact-rich manipulation and tasks involving deformable or soft materials.
child_70767c9abe2a431e95e3e1ecd8bcea46.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_deb8d24d56f147c083bda6adaebcd3ad.content: • Reward design is a fundamental source of brittleness in real-world RL pipelines.
child_deb8d24d56f147c083bda6adaebcd3ad.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_f93a8b7b5ce94e37b1af22071a47113b.content:
While shaping dense rewards
is often necessary to guide exploration in long-horizon tasks, the process is error-prone and heavily reliant on
human expertise and intuition.
child_f93a8b7b5ce94e37b1af22071a47113b.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_5ec5dc20718d4160a6eb063070319132.content:
Poorly tuned terms can lead to specification gaming or convergence to local optima,
making reward shaping a critical challenge for applying RL in practice.
child_5ec5dc20718d4160a6eb063070319132.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_5e6e99bf7934428caee1b4170d1ecc5d.content:
Sparse rewards that only signal successful
trajectories can avoid these pitfalls but typically result in much slower learning due to reduced supervision.
child_5e6e99bf7934428caee1b4170d1ecc5d.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_1dfbdaf6192c4b3a820fc347a7e48d65.content:
Advances in learning to act from potentially large corpora of human demonstrations via Behavioral Cloning (BC)
address both of these concerns.
child_1dfbdaf6192c4b3a820fc347a7e48d65.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_de2a66478b6345b983053c867428bc56.content:
Although suffering from an inherent suboptimality—imitation learning can at most
match the performance level of the demonstrator—learning to reproduce expert demonstratio
child_de2a66478b6345b983053c867428bc56.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_715366dfc579408e9370047c6c818e6d.content:
an at most
match the performance level of the demonstrator—learning to reproduce expert demonstrations via BC has proven
increasingly competitive and practical, bypassing the need for simulated environments and hard-to-define reward
functions.
child_715366dfc579408e9370047c6c818e6d.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_ec9b52bd819a4a108b9beadbac48daf4.content: Learning from human demonstrations provides a pragmatic alternative to the RL pipeline discussed in Section 3.

child_895076a5422a4e40a3a3c3c6f07caff1.content:
Indeed, especially in real-world robotics, online exploration is typically costly and potentially unsafe, and designing
(dense) reward signals is a brittle and task-specific process.
child_895076a5422a4e40a3a3c3c6f07caff1.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_72daa25ca26844d7b67bc05debdf087b.content:
Further, even success detection itself often requires bespoke
instrumentation, while episodic training demands reliable resets—all factors complicating training RL algorithms
on hardware at scale.
child_72daa25ca26844d7b67bc05debdf087b.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_e867ce2e7a7847e9b3f5e308aca12ed6.content:
Behavioral Cloning (BC) sidesteps these constraints by casting control an imitation learning
problem, leveraging previously collected expert demonstrations to anchor the learned autonomous behavior.
child_e867ce2e7a7847e9b3f5e308aca12ed6.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_0cbcfeb621b844e69120d63667f8c630.content:
Most
notably, by learning-to-imitate, autonomous systems naturally adhere to the objectives, preferences, and success
criteria implicitly encoded in the data, which reduces early

child_acaf145ea4894be89bbd815f5f8a32e5.content:
he objectives, preferences, and success
criteria implicitly encoded in the data, which reduces early-stage exploratory failures and obviates hand-crafted reward
shaping altogether.

SL assumptions, the samples

In practice, this aspect can be partially mitigated by considering pairs in a non-sequential

Another strategy to mitigate the impact of regressing

aggregating multiple datasets iteratively.

child_62b5e65b242f407da44289155064a86f.content:
Despite the inherent challenges of learning from non-i.i.d. data, the BC formulation presents several operational
advantages in robotics.
child_62b5e65b242f407da44289155064a86f.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_edd5ea76e0cf48b3941800ccb80a73ee.content: First, training happens offline and naturall
child_edd5ea76e0cf48b3941800ccb80a73ee.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_5bf8d4fb40f84386a5c2286112287d3d.content:
on presents several operational
advantages in robotics.
child_5bf8d4fb40f84386a5c2286112287d3d.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_9fbd7b78bfea4a058aa38b8b019f199f.content:
First, training happens offline and naturally accomodates for expert, demonstration data,
hereby severily limiting exploration risks by preventing the robot from performing dangerous actions altogether,
by anchoring action in imitation.
child_9fbd7b78bfea4a058aa38b8b019f199f.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_5ab00cf9189744a9b8693000147a8590.content:
Second, reward design is entirely unnecessary in BC, as demonstrations already
reflect human intent.
child_5ab00cf9189744a9b8693000147a8590.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_c577ef6072b5436e88c4124e92fca58b.content:
The absence of rewards also prevents the risk of misalignment and specification gaming (reward
hacking), otherwise inherent in purely reward-based RL (Heess et al., 2017).
child_c577ef6072b5436e88c4124e92fca58b.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_e90600965ac94b978601a326dad279dc.content:
Third, because expert trajectories encode
terminal conditions, success detection and resets are implicit in the dataset.
child_e90600965ac94b978601a326dad279dc.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_a1b4a7de7dd74880bc3ca43e3f28d4f8.content:
Finally, empirical evidence suggests the
performance of BC scales naturally with growing corpora of demonstrations collected across tasks, embodiments, and
environments.
child_a1b4a7de7dd74880bc3ca43e3f28d4f8.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_f6ef0cbaf3d240e59ab93fc6aceb2b16.content:
Nonetheless, BC can, in principle, only reproduce behaviors that are at best as good as those of the
demonstrator, and therefore offers no reme
child_f6ef0cbaf3d240e59ab93fc6aceb2b16.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_9975e2658f414641bef9df7cb584a2e4.content:
roduce behaviors that are at best as good as those of the
demonstrator, and therefore offers no remedy for the suboptimal decisions that humans may enact.
child_9975e2658f414641bef9df7cb584a2e4.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_5f69475f5762429b9a017ea182dffcbd.content:
This limitation is
particularly problematic in sequential decision-making tasks where expert demonstrations are scarce–—either because
data collection is costly or because human performance is inherently suboptimal.
child_5f69475f5762429b9a017ea182dffcbd.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_3b989894eba640888a2c2b2ed90f2187.content:
Yet, many robotics applications still
benefit from relatively inexpensive pipelines for collecting high-quality human-generated trajectories, justifying the
use of BC in such settings.

4.1 A (Concise) Introduction to GenerativeModels
Generative Models (GMs) aim to learn the stochastic process underlying the very generation of the data collected, and
typically do so by fitting a probability distribution that approximates the unknown data distribution, p.
child_f6c0f8c55e684b21a93c7f67cab9d96d.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_ecb38595ba4e45fb89e1debc14203eb9.content:
In keeping
with the GM literature, p(x) ← P(x), x ∼ p.
child_ecb38595ba4e45fb89e1debc14203eb9.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_3dbdcfa748af421cb6bfb219703fcbbc.content:
In the case of BC, the unknown data distribution p may represent
the expert’s joint distribution over (o, a)-pairs.
child_3dbdcfa748af421cb6bfb219703fcbbc.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_fadae4e651ec4469a8aea882d66c65ef.content:
Thus, given a finite set of N pairs D = {(o, a)i}Ni=0 available as an
imitation learning target (and thus assumed to be i.i.d.), GMs seek to learn a parametric distribution pθ(o, a) such
that (1) new samples (o, a) ∼ pθ(•) resemble those stored in D, and (2) high likelihood is assigned to the observed
regions of the unobservable p.
child_fadae4e651ec4469a8aea882d66c65ef.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_3f4e73560105464b9105c68c21990af8.content: Likelihood-based learning provides a principled train

child_1967358899c247ffa2211d086c66667c.content:
to the observed
regions of the unobservable p.
child_1967358899c247ffa2211d086c66667c.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_5515006144904408a6468c9843fb2ae8.content:
Likelihood-based learning provides a principled training objective to achieve both goals,
and it is thus extensively used in GMs (Prince, 2023).

child_8b31a593cb184199b96c33fc91dcabdd.content:
Nevertheless, a
reasonable application-driven intuition is that Hierarchical Markov Latent Variable (HMLV) models, by capturing
hierarchical and decoupled interactions among latent variables, can reflect the different resolutions at which conditioning
factors intervene.
child_8b31a593cb184199b96c33fc91dcabdd.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_d15bb14d4889456ca94f94b7235e5597.content:
For example, in a robotics setting, one might naturally distinguish between high-level trajectory
planning (higher up in the hierarchy, t→ T ) and fine-grained motion adjustments (closer to empirical observations,
t→ 0).
child_d15bb14d4889456ca94f94b7235e5597.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_f17cf59292904794ac66b2ca925bffb5.content:
In that, HMLV models thus provide a framework to perform variational inference via multiple, sequential
sampling steps from different higher level distributions instead of approximating the generative process with a
single-latent varia√ble model.
child_f17cf59292904794ac66b2ca925bffb5.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_d9a7899cf8374cb8846cd4f18985a27f.content:
DMs are a particular instantiation of HMLV models for which the posterior is fixed to
q(zt|zt−1) = N (z 1− βt, βtI),
child_d9a7899cf8374cb8846cd4f18985a27f.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_544767f9cc454ed4a53c7a7c3a327485.content:
lar instantiation of HMLV models for which the posterior is fixed to
q(zt|zt−1) = N (z 1− βt, βtI), for a given βt ∈ R+

t .

child_548c81388ebe4f499f568c095d033f99.content:
In practice, βt is used to iteratively reduce the signal-to-noise
ratio along the latents’ hierarchy, similarily to how a diffusion process influences the information of a physical system.
child_548c81388ebe4f499f568c095d033f99.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_2c70c694c69b4159a81e90d17ccf0882.content:
Just like VAEs, DMs attemp to learn to reproduce an underlying data distribution p(o, a) given a collection of
i.i.d. samples approximating the model posited to have generated the data in the first place (eq.
child_2c70c694c69b4159a81e90d17ccf0882.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_80641441ebd74a07b602ce91df27a59f.content:
Similarily to
VAEs, DMs approximate the process of sampling from the unknown p(o, a) by (1) sampling from an easy-to-sample
distribution (e.g., Gaussian) and (2) learning to reconstruct high-likelihood samples under the unknown distribution.
child_80641441ebd74a07b602ce91df27a59f.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_31d66b72a07e4a25bca3120c6edc0512.content:
However, in stark contrast with VAEs, the easy-to-sample distribution contains no mutual information regarding the
data distribution p(o, a).
child_31d66b72a07e4a25bca3120c6edc0512.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_11605eeb9e5641a6946bb63f1d5151b8.content: Crucially, as no information from the sample (o, a) (denoted as z0 ≡ (o, a) for simplici
child_11605eeb9e5641a6946bb63f1d5151b8.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_dccc7aef69c5464482eba033088e5472.content:
Crucially, as no information from the sample (o, a) (denoted as z0 ≡ (o, a) for simplicity of
notation) is assumed to be propagated throughout the chain of latents, the posterior q(zt|zt−1) assumes a relatively
amicable structure in DMs, reducing complexity.
child_dccc7aef69c5464482eba033088e5472.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_212369f62e834a57bad2152889e04f5d.content:
The true likelihood p(zt−1|zt) is instead typically approximated using
the parametrization pθ(zt−1|zt).
child_212369f62e834a57bad2152889e04f5d.title: ROBOT LEARNING

via a process in which samples from a fixed distribution are iteratively turned into (ideally) high-likelihood samples
under p(o, a)—a process referred to as denoising.

and, under the assumption that the likelihood of the totally diffused samples is low under the original unknown data
distribution, one can effectively approximate the unkwown distribution by learning to reverse such displacement.

child_96f78ed270a44501b5a736213f97069d.content:
4.1.3 FlowMatching
The posterior parametrization adopted by DMs proved traditionally effective, yet it raised concerns circa its efficiency
at inference time, where a possibly large number (hundreds) of compute-expensive denoising steps are needed in
order to recover a sample from the target distribution.
child_96f78ed270a44501b5a736213f97069d.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_122c21d517a74112913f774637d539a3.content:

child_42ac4ee56572431fa1905630903e7c78.content:
FM models learn to approximate a target vector field,
thereby producing arbitrary (goal) transformations of an easy-to-sample initial distribution.
child_42ac4ee56572431fa1905630903e7c78.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_731c8e490e6945e29e20006212cbb040.content:
to the general case of arbitrary likelihood and posteriors, and in this defines a superseding class of GMs providing
a unified framework for learning continuous transformations between distributions, encompassing and generalizing
DMs. Instead of a stochastic, discrete, multi-step denoising process, FM aims to learn a deterministic, continuous,
differentiable flow ψ : [0, 1]×Z 7→ Z, fo
child_731c8e490e6945e29e20006212cbb040.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_c64b13f531c342c0b5f4ee022d0a7720.content:
ing process, FM aims to learn a deterministic, continuous,
differentiable flow ψ : [0, 1]×Z 7→ Z, formalized starting from a (possibly time-dependent) vector field v : [0, 1]×Z 7→ Z
transporting over time samples from a simple prior distribution p0—e.g., a standard Gaussian—to a more complex,
typically unknown data distribution p1.
child_c64b13f531c342c0b5f4ee022d0a7720.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_12645a837b4b4e7dac5bed668ad53979.content:
In this, FM accomodates for arbitrary intermediate distributions, breaking
free from the particular case where posterior and likelihood are exclusively Gaussians.
child_12645a837b4b4e7dac5bed668ad53979.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_d12317f16e0c4101a0e55439f7774361.content:
Note also how FM models time
t ∈ [0, 1] to be varying continuously while moving away from an easy-to-sample distribution p0 towards the unknown
data-distribution, p1.
child_d12317f16e0c4101a0e55439f7774361.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_6a374aab9f02481e974cc1222df60206.content:
This results in a continuous (and deterministic) trajectory at inference, which is in practice
more efficient compared to following stochastic paths like in DMs. Formally, FM can be fully characterized by an
ordinary differential equation (ODE) relating instantaneous variations of flows with the underlying vector field, and
hence prov
child_6a374aab9f02481e974cc1222df60206.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_ee2b7cad822b4a96b103bcfc0505a59f.content:
on (ODE) relating instantaneous variations of flows with the underlying vector field, and
hence providing complete trajectories over the distributions’ support when integrating over time,

child_824f7e4b9c304ecebae5b8266fa70379.content:
In the FM literature the likelihood and
posterior probabilty densities defined along a HMLV model are typically referred to as a probability path, where the
distrib
child_824f7e4b9c304ecebae5b8266fa70379.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_d86dbc133c8f46c4bf6674e1bafd7d43.content:
sities defined along a HMLV model are typically referred to as a probability path, where the
distributions for successive adjacent transitions in the HMLV model are related by the (normalized) flow between them
(Figure 26).
child_d86dbc133c8f46c4bf6674e1bafd7d43.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_5a6a62613b184f7b8c060ebc0ed10543.content:
The inherent flexibility of FM is one of their key advantages over DMs, as it opens up the possibility of

child_3843c3802dfb48059f37c735b5d3d566.content:
The visualization shows an example comparison between these two
methods on joint distribution of robot observations and actions over T = 50 steps.
child_3843c3802dfb48059f37c735b5d3d566.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_bb2d33d4047649b0b7a3a19a8a57290a.content:
For instance, one can design probability paths inspired by Optimal Transport (OT), a
mathematical framework concerned with characterizing the most efficient morphings between probability distributions.
child_bb2d33d4047649b0b7a3a19a8a57290a.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_8c9b85544b1541b4ac31246c48d1fa65.content: Probability paths obtained through OT paths tend to be straighter than diffusion paths (Figure 27), whi
child_8c9b85544b1541b4ac31246c48d1fa65.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_39fa3f557fd94381b7aa131455b4683c.content:
bability paths obtained through OT paths tend to be straighter than diffusion paths (Figure 27), which can lead
to faster and more stable training, as well as empirically result in higher-quality generations with fewer denoising
steps at inference time.

Besides the intractability of the observations’ marginal pθ(o) given pθ(o, a), DP’s choice to model the data distribution
through pθ(a|o) also stems from the computational burden of diffusion at test time: generating actions together with
observations would require a large number of denoising steps—an unnecessarily slow and ultimately unhelpful process,
given that robotics focuses on producing controls rather than reconstructing observations.

(2023) adopt a different strategy, whereby the robot controller interleaves chunk prediction At ← π(ot)
and chunk consumption at ← PopFront(At), and computes a new chunk of actions at every timestep t, to then

k, which we refer to as asynchronous (async) inference (1), also enables optimized inference by

child_e349d4d36f2a457792e484f7bdfea2e6.content:
In async inference, a RobotClient sends an observation ot to a PolicyServer,
receiving an action chunk At once inference is complete (Figure 32).
child_e349d4d36f2a457792e484f7bdfea2e6.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_2f318e1427324d089bcdecc1aa14eb10.content:
In this, we avoid execution lags by triggering
chunk prediction while the control loop is still consuming a previously available chunk, aggregating the previous
and incoming chunks whenever the latter is available to the RobotClient.
child_2f318e1427324d089bcdecc1aa14eb10.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_a21e8b94b8424a9e9a00fe8c82955dd9.content:
In turn, async-inference tightens the
loop between action prediction and action execution efficienty, by increasing the frequency at which observations are
processed for chunk prediction while not running inference at every timestep.

from action execution also allows to allocate more computational resources on a remote policy server s

om action execution also allows to allocate more computational resources on a remote policy server sending actions
to the robot client over the network.

3: for t to Ha do
4: at ← PopFront(At)
5: Execute(at) ▷ execute action at step t

H < g then ▷ queue below threshold
a

7: capture new observation, ot+1
8: if NeedsProcessing (ot+1) then ▷ similarity filter, or triggers direct processing
9: async_handle ← AsyncInfer(ot+1) ▷ Trigger new chunk prediction (non blocking)

10: Ãt+1 ← π(ot+1) ▷ New queue is predicted with the policy
11: At+1 ← f(At, Ãt+1) ▷ aggregate overlaps (if any)
12: end if
13: end if
14: if NotCompleted(async_handle) then
15: At+1 ← At ▷ No update on queue (inference is not over just yet)
16: end if
17: end for

Heinlein

TL;DR

Openly available, large-scale datasets and the development of stable-to-train, expressive and efficient architectures
fostered research on the development of generalist robot policies that can operate across embodiment and tasks.
child_adc5c209e97f4d64afd6caa081510ff1.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_0763a3129ce145aaad26345c726d09f8.content:
The advent of large models trained on internet-scale datasets has drastically influenced fields like Computer Vision
(CV) and Natural Language Processing (NLP), shifting the previously task-specific paradigm towards combining (1) an
initial, task-agnostic large-scale pre-training stage and a (2) task-specific, adjustment phase.
child_0763a3129ce145aaad26345c726d09f8.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_47a7d53451a246019c27c41f2bef6814.content:
This pre-train-and-adaptat
paradigm has now largely replaced more classic approaches consisting of task-specific data collection, curation and
model training in many subdomains within CV and NLP, and it is
child_47a7d53451a246019c27c41f2bef6814.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_2f3de7bbe52e45768edc48d81469e259.content:
pecific data collection, curation and
model training in many subdomains within CV and NLP, and it is motivated by the main drawback of limited
scalability for task-specific approaches, which have been traditionally more labor intensive.
child_2f3de7bbe52e45768edc48d81469e259.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_967b5bcbe5ff4dac9b06de9307f17077.content:
Factors including (1)
the advancements in generalist models learned with self-supervision for perception (Oquab et al., 2024) or semantic
understanding (Devlin et al., 2019) and (2) the popularization of collective efforts to aggregate large-scale openly
available datasets (O’Neill et al., 2025; Khazatsky et al., 2025) are increasingly pushing the field of robot learning
towards the pre-train-and-adapt paradigm.
child_967b5bcbe5ff4dac9b06de9307f17077.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_aaa4cfb3e59248f4a6fdf49d763617cb.content:
This shift taps into the long-standing challenge of developing generalist
robot policies, and holds the premise to surpass traditionally siloed approaches to robotics problems and develop
a foundation robotics model.
child_aaa4cfb3e59248f4a6fdf49d763617cb.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_41967edc1c6e45368097b047830e91c5.content:
While Section 4 introduced methods for learning single-task policies such as ACT
or Diffusion Policy, in this section we present a
child_41967edc1c6e45368097b047830e91c5.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_48c07df8e9bf47fdb9a6fefddfc23799.content:
hods for learning single-task policies such as ACT
or Diffusion Policy, in this section we present advancements in developing generalist, multi-task, policies, capable
of performing a wide range of tasks across different environments and embodiments, and guided by unstructured
instructions typically given in plain, natural language.
child_48c07df8e9bf47fdb9a6fefddfc23799.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_b120754af9e54544924a0cb24d9e12f9.content:
57



Figure 35 | Early efforts in the development of generalist models for robotics include BC-Zero (Jang et al., 2022), RT-1 (Brohan
et al., 2023b), and RT-2 (Brohan et al., 2023a): large scale models trained on thousands of demonstrations.
child_b120754af9e54544924a0cb24d9e12f9.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_3fadb42b7864476eadb541f6f00e47aa.content:
The open release
of the Open-X (O’Neill et al., 2025) and DROID datasets (Khazatsky et al., 2025) fostered the development of open source
models: OpenVLA (Kim et al., 2024), π0 (Black et al., 2024) and SmolVLA (Shukor et al., 2025).
child_3fadb42b7864476eadb541f6f00e47aa.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_85622a1e266946d3ac3bf0b687b022c6.content:
5.1 Preliminaries: Models and Data
The remarkable success of foundation models in NLP and CV seems to be increasingly predicated on two core
principles: architectural innovation and (join
child_85622a1e266946d3ac3bf0b687b022c6.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_54a2a5477bd0463b8770ec12357f8417.content:
nd CV seems to be increasingly predicated on two core
principles: architectural innovation and (joint) data-compute scaling.
child_54a2a5477bd0463b8770ec12357f8417.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_fdc8eef62f7b40e4959f10e9b7368db8.content:
Indeed, the transformer architecture proved very
effective in capturing long-range dependencies in a variety of data formats, and its stability and expressivity made it
the de facto standard for modern large-scale models trained on internet-scale datasets.
child_fdc8eef62f7b40e4959f10e9b7368db8.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_ea641408fcb64867be83ca65a578c896.content:
However, in stark contrast with
large-scale NLP and CV datasets (Raffel et al., 2023; Deng et al., 2009), robotics has historically developed around
small, task-specific datasets.
child_ea641408fcb64867be83ca65a578c896.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_6e876085e5ee44b68c3119146fc5e081.content:
In turn, this traditionally hindered scalability across problems as well as results, posing
concrete challenges to developing general-purpose robot learning algorithms.
child_6e876085e5ee44b68c3119146fc5e081.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_158e7ba8588a4bdf9e09bbae2e77db9b.content:
Indeed, differently from the wealth
of relatively readily-available task-agnostic text and images datasets on the internet, robotics data is intrinsically
embodied and thus task-specific: datasets collected for manipulation differ significantly from locomotion.
child_158e7ba8588a4bdf9e09bbae2e77db9b.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_79a9d68903974e519cd2b26fefbdfde5.content: hus task-specific: datasets collected for manipulation differ significantly from locomotion.
child_79a9d68903974e519cd2b26fefbdfde5.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_e1f158915fe346cb95410a330cd1a229.content:
In particular,
since each expert trajectory is tied to a specific robot platform and the operating conditions of its environment
and task, data heterogeneity has long posed a methodological challenge for scaling robotics datasets via aggregation.
child_e1f158915fe346cb95410a330cd1a229.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_3d55fc06af4f45c383aded6abfa83407.content:
Further, datasets consisting of expert demonstrations are (1) intrinsically more expensive to collect and (2) notoriously
heterogeneous—different human experts may perform the same task in very different.
child_3d55fc06af4f45c383aded6abfa83407.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_b2e92f0106bb49f29cc2711c0d74ee42.content:
Beyond this, heterogeneity also
raises conceptual issues: naively mixing data across embodiments can induce negative transfer, as control strategies
developed in isolation for different robot systems in different environments may even conflict when combined.
child_b2e92f0106bb49f29cc2711c0d74ee42.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_18574dccad444a66a1faa534ec7a5a17.content:
Thus,
the high degree of fragmentation of robotics datasets and tasks has traditionally led to the development of specialist
policies, trained on small, task-specific datasets, developed to perfor
child_18574dccad444a66a1faa534ec7a5a17.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_3b8e2135576c47698dcf96138a381331.content:
he development of specialist
policies, trained on small, task-specific datasets, developed to perform well at their designated task but that fail to
generalize to new deployment scenarios (Figure 34).
child_3b8e2135576c47698dcf96138a381331.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_99c5f75bd7c04886b37e63f82277da3b.content:
Driven by the goal of developing generalist robot policies, the research community has increasingly explored how
insights and techniques from other areas of ML can be integrated into robotics.
child_99c5f75bd7c04886b37e63f82277da3b.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_98fdff9a0e5c49158039335290c31b5c.content:
Figure 35 shows a timeline of some
of the most popular contributions attempting at developing generalist policies.
child_98fdff9a0e5c49158039335290c31b5c.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_3ed194242ac54bfc9ce89907a68eb673.content:
Starting from BC-Zero, a latent
variable model trained on 25k+ demonstrations, the field has now evolved into π0, a transformer-based model trained
on 10M+ demonstrations and exhibiting strong few-shot capabilities across tasks and embodiments.
child_3ed194242ac54bfc9ce89907a68eb673.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_6b608a3f14c047abbae22f0e8da2434d.content:
In between,
Robotics Transformer 1 (RT-1) (Brohan et al., 2023b) represented a significant step in the direction of developing a
generalist robot policies over prior work including (1) BC-Zero (Jang et al., 2022) and (2) Gato (Reed et al., 2022),
child_6b608a3f14c047abbae22f0e8da2434d.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_61c0c580fabb41088b5de393942713a7.content:
policies over prior work including (1) BC-Zero (Jang et al., 2022) and (2) Gato (Reed et al., 2022), in
that Brohan et al.
child_61c0c580fabb41088b5de393942713a7.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_5fc7a59a7dc3422687eed4f47b1448b2.content: (2023b) use a much larger and diverse set of training tasks compared to both BC-Zero and Gato.
child_5fc7a59a7dc3422687eed4f47b1448b2.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_b98e0241cfcf42c18da434c84e9b2653.content:
In particular, RT-1 uses a transformer architecture, and is trained on as many as 130k human-recorded trajectories
collected over 13 robots and over 17 months.
child_b98e0241cfcf42c18da434c84e9b2653.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_f68a4c06e7bb4f6ca0b6054945672c77.content:
RT-1 learns to process a history of camera images and a natural language
instruction, and feeds the resulting sequence of high-dimensional tokens to a transformer, trained using a classification
loss on a discretized actions space consisting of six different 256-bins, one for each joint of a 6-dof robotic arm.
child_f68a4c06e7bb4f6ca0b6054945672c77.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_451a88b9d4534d2482291077fddf40aa.content:
In a follow-up work, the same group of authors propose a modified method to learn generalist models, leveraging (1)
a more powerful architecture and (2) scaling up the dataset used (Brohan et al., 2023a, RT-2).
child_451a88b9d4534d2482291077fddf40aa.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_6cda4a2dcd5a47b9806b839cdaf58625.content: (2023a) propose inheriting internet-scale semantic knowledge from large-scal
child_6cda4a2dcd5a47b9806b839cdaf58625.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_da1a94a300b94a6ca743077b6a9fe980.content:
(2023a) propose inheriting internet-scale semantic knowledge from large-scale multi-modal datasets to learn a single,
unified model for robotics control.
child_da1a94a300b94a6ca743077b6a9fe980.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_7bd74d8b3c314e529b9e5d6eebc50530.content:
Such a model, termed Vision-Language-Action (VLA) in the original RT-2 paper,
effectively casts robot control as a language-modeling problem, and in particular as a Visual Question-Answering
(VQ&A) task, in which the output token space used to represent textual tokens is shared with the 8-bits tokens used

58

child_0cfecef720c945cd9d7a1a49b7a088fa.content: (B) Generalist models are also becoming increasingly smaller and easier to run on limited hardware.
child_0cfecef720c945cd9d7a1a49b7a088fa.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_18e32acd4d42444dbc4e460d0bc4a8f4.content: to represent the 256 (28) actuation levels of a 6-dof robot.
child_18e32acd4d42444dbc4e460d0bc4a8f4.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_847f9268edb442b7a47448b5fc93cad1.content: In their work, Brohan et al.
child_847f9268edb442b7a47448b5fc93cad1.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_ce1bec831fc942d89aa7dc65eb404aeb.content: In their work, Brohan et al.
child_ce1bec831fc942d89aa7dc65eb404aeb.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_30d06d8d6d8b4af19c08b9a2709fd656.content:
(2023a) propose co-fine-tuning
large-scale VLMs such as PaLIX (Chen et al., 2023) or PaLM-E (Driess et al., 2023) on a mix of (1) web and (2)
robotics data, complementing VQ&A training with robotics-specific signal, and learning to directly output robot
actions in a shared token space for visual and language inputs.
child_30d06d8d6d8b4af19c08b9a2709fd656.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_0fe4646f4f0e411699d1f9859a2adaeb.content:
In their work, the authors claim using large models
trained on internet-scale data as backbones for VLAs allows models to tap into the rich semantic knowledge embedded
in the VLM’s parameters, interpreting instructions and unseen objects by connecting them to concepts acquired while
pre-training.
child_0fe4646f4f0e411699d1f9859a2adaeb.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_86cff814360d47d1ba7d4606b271c12f.content:
(2023a) show that while RT-2 has never been explicitly trained to repurpose
tools for a hammering task, it can still combine its semantic understanding of images, so that when asked which
object between (1) a piece of paper, (2) a pair of headphones or (3) a rock may be used instead o
child_86cff814360d47d1ba7d4606b271c12f.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_985cc4ece0524d549a8b43fe75219aea.content:
ch
object between (1) a piece of paper, (2) a pair of headphones or (3) a rock may be used instead of a hammer, it
correctly answers (3).
child_985cc4ece0524d549a8b43fe75219aea.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_b840a4c00b53493d82874bfd8164e6d8.content:
Traditionally, research efforts revolved around not only training models, but also proposing datasets for the community,
a costly and time-consuming process.
child_b840a4c00b53493d82874bfd8164e6d8.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_cec7d1dcdc8a4ef4aec66772ebe20844.content:
Due to the aforementioned embodiment gap, the data used in research efforts in
robot learning have traditionally proved rather fragmented, tailored to the specific task considered by the specific group
of researchers who collected it, which ultimately hindered integration.
child_cec7d1dcdc8a4ef4aec66772ebe20844.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_9bf4b8602b2d4f60a5e37df7382c200e.content:
The Open X-Embodiment project (O’Neill et al.,
2025) was a landmark collaboration effort to address data fragmentation, by curating the aggregation of 60 existing
robotics datasets from 22 different robot embodiments and 21 institutions across the world, and resulted in a total 1.4M
of cross-embodiments, cross-tasks, openly-available trajectories.
child_9bf4b8602b2d4f60a5e37df7382c200e.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_1a611c6f1206407cb29fb0fe46025679.content:
Besides the contribution of an aggregate, large scale
dataset, O’Neill et al.
child_1a611c6f1206407cb29fb0fe46025679.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_ae668592e7ff4a6fb9c45b807f1ced51.content:
Besides the contribution of an aggregate, large scale
dataset, O’Neill et al.
child_ae668592e7ff4a6fb9c45b807f1ced51.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_0e77b7ccfa754b0197e2cb764648f607.content:
(2025) also demonstrated significant positive transfer across tasks and embodiments, showing
that a single model trained on multi-embodiment data can outperform specialist models trained on their respective
single-embodiment datasets.
child_0e77b7ccfa754b0197e2cb764648f607.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_d4c54dcd5f304b1a90867fab86b04947.content:
The Distributed Robot Interaction Dataset (DROID) (Khazatsky et al., 2025) represents
another significant step towards addressing the problem of scarse and disaggregated data in robot learning, providing
a unique dataset consisting of 75k+ human demonstrations collected in realistic (in-the-wild) manipulation settings,
providing another cornerstone for building general-purpose robot policies.
child_d4c54dcd5f304b1a90867fab86b04947.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_914a32efc5d140bd891f7c13277f1f42.content:
Recently, foundational datasets curated
through large, centralized efforts, are increasingly complemented by decentralized, community-driven contributions of
robotics data.
child_914a32efc5d140bd891f7c13277f1f42.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_35f04e28ced1434dbd54faafd23174d9.content: Software libraries like lerobot have been instrumental in enabling decentralized collection of lar
child_35f04e28ced1434dbd54faafd23174d9.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_c1dc5dde74e143f7a521a1fe7a0b54d4.content:
Software libraries like lerobot have been instrumental in enabling decentralized collection of large
amounts of data, providing the infrastructure for researchers and practitioners to easily contribute trajectories from a
wide range of embodiments, democratizing data access via distributed collection.
child_c1dc5dde74e143f7a521a1fe7a0b54d4.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_bc453512db354b77a32f747ed0f64cd3.content:
Despite these advancements, the success of large, proprietary models like RT-1 and RT-2, highlighted a growing
accessibility gap in robotics research, as training and deploying large-scale robotics foundation models requires
computational resources simply unattainable for most research institutions.
child_bc453512db354b77a32f747ed0f64cd3.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_5c95b434a03045e19c68f860e2671757.content:
The OpenVLA project (Kim et al.,
2024) emerged in direct contrast to traditionally closed-source efforts to develop VLAs. In particular, Kim et al.
child_5c95b434a03045e19c68f860e2671757.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_45a2c16bc5e64c6db26f55f947988445.content:
(2024) trained OpenVLA by exclusively leveraging openly available data (970k+ trajectories from the Open-X
dataset), and openly shared their training recipes alongside the model weights.
child_45a2c16bc5e64c6db26f55f947988445.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_03a2a4b2c09a4f3abca6776f9818ed08.content:
Architecturally, OpenVLA integrates
a pre-trained vision en
child_03a2a4b2c09a4f3abca6776f9818ed08.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_20f6a24298e14258acae7a98123bbb5a.content: ing recipes alongside the model weights.
child_20f6a24298e14258acae7a98123bbb5a.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_c2beff6412954bd991648a282c6d6500.content:
Architecturally, OpenVLA integrates
a pre-trained vision encoder to project visual tokens into the embedding space of the Llama2-7B (Touvron et al.,
2023) language-model backbone.
child_c2beff6412954bd991648a282c6d6500.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_ea2d785ddaad4633b52e2226a7764980.content:
The language model backbone is then used to predict discrete action tokens over
256 activation levels.
child_ea2d785ddaad4633b52e2226a7764980.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_828f4733983645d2b7347915b30b9c34.content:
Figure 36 shows the current trends in robot learning in terms of size and nature of the robotics datasets contributed,
together with the size and accessibility of the available models.
child_828f4733983645d2b7347915b30b9c34.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_a5f9d90adfd3401993d2d8fe6f65e71e.content:
As datasets collected via centralized, cross-institutions
cooperation of increasing size are made available for the research community, decentralized datasets collected by
individual researchers and practitioners also gained traction, closing the gap with academic benchmarks thanks to

59



community-contributed datasets.
child_a5f9d90adfd3401993d2d8fe6f65e71e.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_df1c84fa11e944aebf7a5d290456ed7d.content:
Further, models used across tasks and embodiments are increasingly becoming much
more compute-efficient, and as a result the models’ size has been consistently reduci
child_df1c84fa11e944aebf7a5d290456ed7d.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_d98d95996a424420b7d03fe7edc67b1c.content:
becoming much
more compute-efficient, and as a result the models’ size has been consistently reducing over time, with consequent
gains for autonomous robots in real-world, resource-constrained environments.
child_d98d95996a424420b7d03fe7edc67b1c.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_102a50490e274668aa6e8917c3446ee4.content:
5.2 VLAs
Modern recipes to train large scale VLAs extend early efforts to learn foundation models from large amounts of data via
BC, introducing significant advancements concerning both architectural and procedural aspects.
child_102a50490e274668aa6e8917c3446ee4.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_ccae5d572b3f4c98bf79d91a67a7abaa.content:
From an architectural
perspective, modern VLAs such as π0 (Black et al., 2024) leverage a unified transformer model for efficiency of
computation, while maintaining specialized sub-components within the model for visual perception and action
prediction, enabling cross-task performance via language conditioning.
child_ccae5d572b3f4c98bf79d91a67a7abaa.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_051374027324488eaa1436437fc06ed9.content:
Crucially, modern VLAs includingπ0 (Black
et al., 2024) and SmolVLA (Shukor et al., 2025) adopt unified transformer models employing disjoint set of weights
(experts) for both compute-efficient visual-semantic understanding as well as control.
child_051374027324488eaa1436437fc06ed9.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_905175b5b68c4649b7863bde36696576.content:
ts
(experts) for both compute-efficient visual-semantic understanding as well as control.
child_905175b5b68c4649b7863bde36696576.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_5c02e0de52d74eba8e1f9d3f8620bc9d.content:
Procedurally, VLAs complement
advanced Vision-Language Model (VLM) backbones with action-specific modules (1) adopting mid-sized action experts
to model continuous actions distributions p(at:t+Ha |ot)—avoiding discrete action tokens entirely—and (2) relying
on action chunking (Zhao et al., 2023, Section 4) as a strategy to reduce error compounding when predicting multiple
actions learning from inherently non-i.i.d. data, such as demonstration data.
child_5c02e0de52d74eba8e1f9d3f8620bc9d.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_ad93be179b42451ba1a0822c2be35f2a.content: These architectural and procedural innovations present three benefits over task-specific methods.
child_ad93be179b42451ba1a0822c2be35f2a.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_40421185bae84121b41823a5286e1fb1.content:
First, developing
architectures that exploit internet-scale pre-trained backbones allows to fully capitalize on the vast world knowledge
and skills state-of-the-art VLMs exhibit, preventig models from needing to learn visual, linguistic and semantic
concepts from scratch.
child_40421185bae84121b41823a5286e1fb1.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_4190cbca3a34472c8483caceecb36db9.content: Second, using generative models for continuous action distributions allows to learn ri
child_4190cbca3a34472c8483caceecb36db9.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_81ceb57cc7ec46c089d387e6bfd66f25.content:
Second, using generative models for continuous action distributions allows to learn rich,
multimodal data distributions, a much more likely scenario in the big-data regime which is typically tackled while
developing generalist policies.
child_81ceb57cc7ec46c089d387e6bfd66f25.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_9e5d64803a8d450383b10c2e497bba9b.content:
Further, introducing separate components for perception and action planning enable
using Mixture of Experts (MoE) architectures (Fedus et al., 2022), which are often more efficient to run—a key
feature for models deployed in real-world scenarios.
child_9e5d64803a8d450383b10c2e497bba9b.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_9a11c8e04fd642508712d5c2b6c58df6.content:
This new paradigm has been at the core of some of the most
capable generalist policies developed to date, capable to few-shot adapt to novel tasks and to perform highly dexterous
manipulation tasks ranging from end-to-end folding laundry to bussing tables (Black et al., 2024).
child_9a11c8e04fd642508712d5c2b6c58df6.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_699f9a72b704480c8d2b381470739d57.content:
5.2.1 VLMs for VLAs
VLMs are designed to handle both visual and textual modalities, most commonly by taking both images and text as
inputs, generating text conditioned on the visual context.
child_699f9a72b704480c8d2b381470739d57.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_a8cd0251fa51415a937902b545d9685e.content: Recent advances in VLMs have bee
child_a8cd0251fa51415a937902b545d9685e.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_7b1ac7bcc74e47ecbdab5bc5523e8e00.content:
text as
inputs, generating text conditioned on the visual context.
child_7b1ac7bcc74e47ecbdab5bc5523e8e00.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_2f4362c6f7e146e390e0ed3c0881ef11.content:
Recent advances in VLMs have been driven by the success
of LLMs, with many approaches building upon pretrained LLMs and adopting similar training paradigms to the
ones used in language modeling.
child_2f4362c6f7e146e390e0ed3c0881ef11.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_695e8f2ab6e54c36b5f6831024252b1d.content:
Typically, VLMs (Alayrac et al., 2022; Laurençon et al., 2024; Lin et al., 2024) are
constructed by integrating a pretrained vision encoder (Radford et al., 2021; Zhai et al., 2023; Fini et al., 2024) with
a pretrained LLM (Grattafiori et al., 2024; Jiang et al., 2023).
child_695e8f2ab6e54c36b5f6831024252b1d.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_58059e20e4604439a686dff17990aa6b.content:
Training then proceeds in multiple multimodal stages,
beginning with a large-scale pretraining on datasets containing image-text pairs (Schuhmann et al., 2022; Byeon et al.,
2022) and interleaved vision-language corpora (Laurençon et al., 2023; Zhu et al., 2023), all followed by a supervised
fine-tuning stage on instruction-tuning datasets (Liu et al., 2023; Tong et al., 2024; Laurençon et al., 2024).
child_58059e20e4604439a686dff17990aa6b.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_622f89d6e640479e8db657fedae52082.content:
The
inherent multimodal nature of VLMs enables them to jointl
child_622f89d6e640479e8db657fedae52082.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_9637af9b1b594f7f91eeb3d35be1a25c.content:
The
inherent multimodal nature of VLMs enables them to jointly reason over vision and language.
child_9637af9b1b594f7f91eeb3d35be1a25c.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_9c4670959185494eaa67c8fdc417ea61.content:
Pre-training on vast
internet-scale datasets allows these models to associate visual patterns with textual descriptions, thereby acquiring a
rich semantic understanding of the world—knowledge about objects, their properties, and relationships—without
explicit supervision for each concept.
child_9c4670959185494eaa67c8fdc417ea61.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_d06701fb08734f78a161f2be71114842.content:
In turn, integrating VLMs as the perceptual backbone for VLAs allows the
latter to inherit rich, contextual world knowledge from the VLM, sidestepping the need to re-learn visual and semantic
representations.
child_d06701fb08734f78a161f2be71114842.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_f4090e518db14e8695033fb450d82187.content:
In principle, this also allows the robot to ground high-level natural language instructions in its visual
context, and possibly recognize objects by connecting them to the pre-trained concepts absorbed during pre-training,
improving on the possibility to generalize to novel scenarios.
child_f4090e518db14e8695033fb450d82187.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_a8e795bd55914e81a7b519f852f030d4.content: Recently, compute efficiency has also become a central focus in multi-modal rese
child_a8e795bd55914e81a7b519f852f030d4.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_16e12c2d32414908a9a59af516f42510.content: Recently, compute efficiency has also become a central focus in multi-modal research.
child_16e12c2d32414908a9a59af516f42510.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_1129360b4bf94cd480cf4b71f3113138.content:
Several works aim to reduce
training costs by using smaller, more diverse datasets (Liu et al., 2023; Dai et al., 2023; Bai et al., 2025; Zhu et al.,
2024; Tong et al., 2024), training smaller-scale models (Marafioti et al., 2025; Korrapati, 2024; Yao et al., 2024), or by
adapting pretrained unimodal models by tuning only a small subset of parameters (Shukor et al., 2023; Vallaeys et al.,
2024; Mañas et al., 2023; Koh et al., 2023; Tsimpoukelli et al., 2021; Li et al., 2023).
child_1129360b4bf94cd480cf4b71f3113138.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_bcc02073aee1417bbff65015477ca68b.content:
While the majority of VLM
research focuses on image and text modalities, recent work has also demonstrated that similar techniques can be
extended to integrate additional modalities, such as video and audio (Wang et al., 2025; Liu et al., 2024; Zhang et al.,
2025; Kong et al., 2024)—a particularly promising direction of research for robotics applications, where multiple
sensor modalities can be integrated effe
child_bcc02073aee1417bbff65015477ca68b.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_9f8db68400fe496c9d05dc3f1c5c6142.content:
ction of research for robotics applications, where multiple
sensor modalities can be integrated effectively.
child_9f8db68400fe496c9d05dc3f1c5c6142.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_af4478d7ba7946b983ad45c6d65368bc.content:
This trend towards efficiency is paramount for robotics applications,
where policies must operate under the stringent constraints of real-world deployment.
child_af4478d7ba7946b983ad45c6d65368bc.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_b8ba5b08e40b4848ac7a29c33bf1a12f.content:
60

child_3391530d0aab485894317cecfab0bb61.content:
Vision and language tokens are routed to a VLM backbone which
is prevented from attending robot proprioperceptive states and action tokens, which are instead routed to a smaller subset
of weights within the architecture referred to as "action expert".
child_3391530d0aab485894317cecfab0bb61.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_e04b79fa7c67448aa4539b66d85fad1b.content:
The architecture is trained with Flow Matching on 10M+
trajectories from a mixture of closed and openly available datasets.
child_e04b79fa7c67448aa4539b66d85fad1b.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_87222be59b3f46178e6ab0580ca3f63d.content:
5.3 π0

π0 (Black et al., 2024) introduce a VLA consisting of a MoE architecture consisting of (1) a pre-trained VLM backbone
(Gemma 2.6B (Team et al., 2024)) and (2) a dedicated action expert used to generate continuous actions via flow
matching.
child_87222be59b3f46178e6ab0580ca3f63d.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_ee5ca009752446878932fb35de405ae6.content: Images and language are embedded with PaliG
child_ee5ca009752446878932fb35de405ae6.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_0bb0c9c7e15641a49d8594787b6e0bc7.content:
t used to generate continuous actions via flow
matching.
child_0bb0c9c7e15641a49d8594787b6e0bc7.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_f58c8ddda6ff477ca7856a3e0b791c36.content:
Images and language are embedded with PaliGemma, a VLM merging independently encoded visual and
textual features deep in the network (late-fusion), while proprioceptive state and actions chunks are routed to a
smaller action expert, initialized from scratch.
child_f58c8ddda6ff477ca7856a3e0b791c36.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_9858f3e28b3f4a578f48c8d797af27bf.content:
The two separate experts communicate via self-attention layers, but
maintain disjoint weights to obtain query, key and values matrices at each layer, maintaining specialization while
efficiently allocating computation.
child_9858f3e28b3f4a578f48c8d797af27bf.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_f332bdb0aac54a6096e303ad1c015887.content: Concretely, π0 is a single, unified transformer with two disjoint sets of weights ϕ, θ.
child_f332bdb0aac54a6096e303ad1c015887.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_08d73f4612d04978b93260a69ecc85de.content:
A larger VLM backbone fϕ
initialized from Gemma 2.6B processes multiple image frames obtained from multiple cameras points [{It}nt=1], as
well as a language instruction [ℓt] used to describe the task considered.
child_08d73f4612d04978b93260a69ecc85de.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_5aa8ed95147c4468b04b1bdde2ec79ea.content:
Concurrently, a 300M-parameter action expert
based on a similar transformer architecture is used to process both the robot proprioperceptive state qt and an action
c
child_5aa8ed95147c4468b04b1bdde2ec79ea.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_e8fc540cc909451ca5756b11302f732e.content:
ransformer architecture is used to process both the robot proprioperceptive state qt and an action
chunk at:t+H (Figure 37).
child_e8fc540cc909451ca5756b11302f732e.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_0677786a630a4d7c8d644614485a27e9.content:
The different expert networks operate separately in processing the respective inputs and

a

turn them into query, key and value matrices, and only share information between each other via self-attention layers.

The outputs from the VLM backbone are disregarded, while the vector field regressed by the action expert is used to
iteratively refine the action process.

Blockwise causal masking effectively prevents the pre-trained perception-language
tokens from attending to robotics-tokens, likely out of distribution for VLM backbones traditionally trained on large

child_ded7ddf6bb0b4f1e810e344e04f5ca3b.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_ee94f440de0d44e89f5d2643d70c1862.content:
Crucially, because communication is obstructed between image-language
tokens, proprioperceptive tokens and action tokens, one can cache keys and values across denoising steps at runtime
time, incuring in a reduced computational footprint and faster inference.
child_ee94f440de0d44e89f5d2643d70c1862.title: ROBOT LEARNING

Flow matching (Lipman et al., 2023, Section4.1.3) can be seen as a continuous time, deterministic generalization
of diffusion processes, and has proven effective in modeling highly complex multi-modal distributions, including
those over images and video.
child_1cc2c466cb57434798d605032ab609ea.title: ROBOT LEARNING

child_c9e589e1fb7245b9b3faf96195d7adb7.content:
In turn, the application of flow matching to large-scale datasets of multiple human
behaviors across tasks and embodiments appears rather consequential, particularly considering how it can enable
faster inference via a limited number of denoising steps at test time—as few as 10, in π0.
child_c9e589e1fb7245b9b3faf96195d7adb7.title: ROBOT LEARNING

t

do also offer an intuition behind this finding: high-quality demonstrations of a given task

In turn, robot trained on high-quality data exclusively with BC may as well be entirely incapable to recover

Conversely, large scale collections of human demonstrations are typically much more diverse (if anything,
for their sheer scale), and typically contain rich and diverse information, which may prove suboptimal for any given

SmolVLA is a compact MoE model trained with flow

trained with flow
