Figure 4.2 A Simple Taxonomy of Data in Data Mining.
child_231aa3ae7d4f46dfbbb86d20247355e9.title: unit2ii

child_22b920b36f0d411e81fc0c66999cebaa.content:
•	Data	 mining	 tools	 are	 readily	 combined	 with	 spreadsheets	 and	 other	 software	
development tools.
child_22b920b36f0d411e81fc0c66999cebaa.title: unit2ii

child_68e936360b8d472bab69e4d17faa2009.content:
Thus, the mined data can be analyzed and deployed quickly 
and easily.
child_68e936360b8d472bab69e4d17faa2009.title: unit2ii

child_0b0a0346ef7c4b979de5b308a24d44b7.content:
•	Because	of	the	large	amounts	of	data	and	massive	search	efforts,	it	is	sometimes	
necessary to use parallel processing for data mining.
child_0b0a0346ef7c4b979de5b308a24d44b7.title: unit2ii

child_312d7d7132ec4e2b8b5564e0d40c89db.content:
A company that effectively leverages data mining tools and technologies can acquire 
and maintain a strategic competitive advantage.
child_312d7d7132ec4e2b8b5564e0d40c89db.title: unit2ii

child_4e9279dbdab04b25b77332f32980bb0d.content:
Data mining offers organizations an indis-
pensable decision-enhancing environment to exploit new opportunities by transforming 
data into a strategic weapon.
child_4e9279dbdab04b25b77332f32980bb0d.title: unit2ii

child_220f435ae2c0450f81137d49b0801586.content:
See Nemati and Barko (2001) for a more detailed discussion 
on the strategic benefits of data mining.
child_220f435ae2c0450f81137d49b0801586.title: unit2ii

child_b1f176c30f434c728c131b84095dc5b4.content:
r a more detailed discussion 
on the strategic benefits of data mining.
child_b1f176c30f434c728c131b84095dc5b4.title: unit2ii

child_2047cc2e30b34469addc90eb067a94a3.content:
M04_SHAR4877_03_PIE_C04.indd   177 1/23/14   10:01 AM178	 Chapter 	4	 •	 Data	Mining
•	nominal data  contain measurements of simple codes assigned to objects as labels, 
which are not measurements.
child_2047cc2e30b34469addc90eb067a94a3.title: unit2ii

child_50f43f7871664b4bae7f80b75cf7a82f.content:
For example, the variable marital status can be generally 
 categorized as (1) single, (2) married, and (3) divorced.
child_50f43f7871664b4bae7f80b75cf7a82f.title: unit2ii

child_9bf3c6d47df7486dac4c960a7d6c29c1.content:
Nominal data can be represented 
with	binomial	values	having	two	possible	values	(e.g.,	yes/no,	true/false,	good/bad),	or	
multinomial	values	having	three	or	more	possible	values	(e.g.,	brown/green/blue,	white/	
black/Latino/Asian,	single/married/divorced).
child_9bf3c6d47df7486dac4c960a7d6c29c1.title: unit2ii

child_01d8c724fc4b487e8d7ea9bb8baeefd6.content:
•	Ordinal data contain codes assigned to objects or events as labels that also represent 
the rank order among them.
child_01d8c724fc4b487e8d7ea9bb8baeefd6.title: unit2ii

child_8d74408c0c104e22bd77ffce3ed6cfc5.content:
For example, the variable credit score  can be generally 
 categorized as (1) low, (2) medium, or (3) high.
child_8d74408c0c104e22bd77ffce3ed6cfc5.title: unit2ii

child_4c131276d8b248f683d4242a77f33339.content:
Similar ordered relationships can be seen 
in variables such as age group (i.e., child, young, middle-aged, elderly) and educatio
child_4c131276d8b248f683d4242a77f33339.title: unit2ii

child_5348233bf6364402b679169d3ffbf11c.content:
can be seen 
in variables such as age group (i.e., child, young, middle-aged, elderly) and educational 
level (i.e., high school, college, graduate school).
child_5348233bf6364402b679169d3ffbf11c.title: unit2ii

child_00074693fcc746f6894d031c0292d444.content:
Some data mining algorithms, such as 
ordinal multiple logistic regression,  take into account this additional rank-order informa -
tion to build a better classification model.
child_00074693fcc746f6894d031c0292d444.title: unit2ii

child_9fe023209e5a444d982bcdc2d18a271c.content: •	numeric data represent the numeric values of specific variables.
child_9fe023209e5a444d982bcdc2d18a271c.title: unit2ii

child_dc76da2ed426428c8e49afbbeb9db6fe.content:
Examples of numerically 
valued variables include age, number of children, total household income (in U.S. dol -
lars), travel distance (in miles), and temperature (in Fahrenheit degrees).
child_dc76da2ed426428c8e49afbbeb9db6fe.title: unit2ii

child_4ba0db3ed3874c91b722ab50307b85e3.content:
Numeric  values 
representing a variable can be integer (taking only whole numbers) or real (taking also 
the fractional number).
child_4ba0db3ed3874c91b722ab50307b85e3.title: unit2ii

child_4a3277017e1c4712bed2e7c79d81ddfc.content:
The numeric data may also be called continuous data,  implying 
that the variable contains continuous measures on a specific scale that allows insertion 
of interim values.
child_4a3277017e1c4712bed2e7c79d81ddfc.title: unit2ii

child_1951cfe085234a0f9ff89e1d695a0c93.content:
Unlike a discrete variable, which represents finite, countable data, a 
continuous variable represents sca
child_1951cfe085234a0f9ff89e1d695a0c93.title: unit2ii

child_b2dbbab6ecce4587843c27cf5462a9a7.content:
a discrete variable, which represents finite, countable data, a 
continuous variable represents scalable measurements, and it is possible for the data to 
contain an infinite number of fractional values.
child_b2dbbab6ecce4587843c27cf5462a9a7.title: unit2ii

child_d2498c5e36dd4d3eb2b46a3a3947a401.content: •	interval data are variables that can be measured on interval scales.
child_d2498c5e36dd4d3eb2b46a3a3947a401.title: unit2ii

child_895a3722eadb48d2bf323cdc1e489fb5.content:
A common example of 
interval scale measurement is temperature on the Celsius scale.
child_895a3722eadb48d2bf323cdc1e489fb5.title: unit2ii

child_7adf9739686b4cd9a0c984624bb425e4.content:
In this particular scale, the unit 
of	measurement	is	1/100	of	the	difference	between	the	melting	temperature	and	the		boiling	
temperature of water in atmospheric pressure; that is, there is not an absolute zero value.
child_7adf9739686b4cd9a0c984624bb425e4.title: unit2ii

child_af63cca5e73b4450a05efb2eee56b701.content:
•	ratio data include measurement variables commonly found in the physical sciences and 
engineering.
child_af63cca5e73b4450a05efb2eee56b701.title: unit2ii

child_e349ff7b274a4897a421ccc21555d78c.content:
Mass, length, time, plane angle, energy, and electric charge are examples of 
physical measures that are ratio scales.
child_e349ff7b274a4897a421ccc21555d78c.title: unit2ii

child_530757c558e24fcfaf809134a2b6adc0.content:
The scale type takes its name from the fact that 
measurement is the estimation of the ratio between a magnitude of a continuous quantity 
and a unit magnitude of the same kind.
child_530757c558e24fcfaf809134a2b6adc0.title: unit2ii

child_d337125afaea4727851145e309e0a9b1.content:
n a magnitude of a continuous quantity 
and a unit magnitude of the same kind.
child_d337125afaea4727851145e309e0a9b1.title: unit2ii

child_c3abbfc4b03a4e3383d92c1dd2204f2a.content:
Informally, the distinguishing feature of a ratio 
scale is the possession of a nonarbitrary zero value.
child_c3abbfc4b03a4e3383d92c1dd2204f2a.title: unit2ii

child_83dc3e981cf44b118689ad04ddc6afdd.content:
For example, the Kelvin temperature 
scale has a nonarbitrary zero point of absolute zero, which is equal to –273.15 degrees 
Celsius.
child_83dc3e981cf44b118689ad04ddc6afdd.title: unit2ii

child_9bbeaf3fdae4458cadaa8cfc55e829f8.content:
This zero point is nonarbitrary because the particles that comprise matter at this 
temperature have zero kinetic energy.
child_9bbeaf3fdae4458cadaa8cfc55e829f8.title: unit2ii

child_ca92d9ebcbf84e338a9da7f50df10ab2.content:
Other data types, including textual, spatial, imagery, and voice, need to be converted 
into some form of categorical or numeric representation before they can be processed by data 
 mining algorithms.
child_ca92d9ebcbf84e338a9da7f50df10ab2.title: unit2ii

child_c5455f0c0d164c85a2ed76e02b479fa0.content: Data can also be classified as static or dynamic (i.e., temporal or time series).
child_c5455f0c0d164c85a2ed76e02b479fa0.title: unit2ii

child_7c994fe66d8f470a87db0f59993e65e4.content:
Some data mining methods and algorithms are very selective about the type of data that 
they can handle.
child_7c994fe66d8f470a87db0f59993e65e4.title: unit2ii

child_c6fedd361ce045ccb77ad0ada4855ffa.content:
Providing them with incompatible data types may lead to incorrect models 
or (more often) halt the model development process.
child_c6fedd361ce045ccb77ad0ada4855ffa.title: unit2ii

child_58e2e364d4664a18a86f4c311750a99d.content:
For example, some data mining meth -
ods nee
child_58e2e364d4664a18a86f4c311750a99d.title: unit2ii

child_7be11b937c64484c84c9113d8a2288e8.content:
ls 
or (more often) halt the model development process.
child_7be11b937c64484c84c9113d8a2288e8.title: unit2ii

child_dd6e9ed8b3ef47969be42c89bdc0769a.content:
For example, some data mining meth -
ods need all of the variables (both input as well as output) represented as numerically valued 
variables (e.g., neural networks, support vector machines, logistic regression).
child_dd6e9ed8b3ef47969be42c89bdc0769a.title: unit2ii

child_53a29bc1f6b747cda749cb64919d38cc.content:
The nominal or 
ordinal variables are converted into numeric representations using some type of 1-of-N pseudo 
variables (e.g., a categorical variable with three unique values can be transformed into three 
pseudo variables with binary values—1 or 0).
child_53a29bc1f6b747cda749cb64919d38cc.title: unit2ii

child_dc635ffea3c24fbba666f8b3c46b1f4e.content:
Because this process may increase the number 
of variables, one should be cautious about the effect of such representations, especially for the 
categorical variables that have large numbers of unique values.
child_dc635ffea3c24fbba666f8b3c46b1f4e.title: unit2ii

child_73dffd8629334c3d931bb5e33e75f002.content:
Similarly, some data mining methods, such as ID3 (a classic decision tree algorithm) and 
rough sets (a relatively new rule induction algorithm), need all of the variables represented as 
categorically valued variables.
child_73dffd8629334c3d931bb5e33e75f002.title: unit2ii

child_6063880b70f347bf9e1ec89415947c08.content: Early versions of these methods required the user
child_6063880b70f347bf9e1ec89415947c08.title: unit2ii

child_66bce920635645c8bd8a46e7bfa46e04.content:
es represented as 
categorically valued variables.
child_66bce920635645c8bd8a46e7bfa46e04.title: unit2ii

child_a1700326c995442f8b0bf08df5e87891.content:
Early versions of these methods required the user to discretize 
numeric variables into categorical representations before they could be processed by the algo -
rithm.
child_a1700326c995442f8b0bf08df5e87891.title: unit2ii

child_3e37f22a5b85491dbecf34ef0e747c85.content:
The good news is that most implementations of these algorithms in widely available 
software tools accept a mix of numeric and nominal variables and internally make the necessary 
conversions before processing the data.
child_3e37f22a5b85491dbecf34ef0e747c85.title: unit2ii

child_ab0cbf0c44a8411db161f2a4259f4028.content:
M04_SHAR4877_03_PIE_C04.indd   178 1/23/14   10:01 AM	 Chapter	4	 •	 Data	Mining 179
How Data Mining Works
Using existing and relevant data, data mining builds models to identify patterns among 
the attributes presented in the data set.
child_ab0cbf0c44a8411db161f2a4259f4028.title: unit2ii

child_4dcf7ffdcdaf4acc95f8e2aadd20638a.content:
Models are the mathematical representations 
(simple	linear	relationships	and/or	complex	highly	nonlinear	relationships)	that	identify	
the patterns among the attributes of the objects (e.g., customers) described in the data set.
child_4dcf7ffdcdaf4acc95f8e2aadd20638a.title: unit2ii

child_499ee0d13beb461c802b548c835ea39b.content:
Some of these patterns are explanatory (explaining the interrelationships and affinities 
amo
child_499ee0d13beb461c802b548c835ea39b.title: unit2ii

child_239600214b964f2f8595b455e2542a9a.content:
Some of these patterns are explanatory (explaining the interrelationships and affinities 
among the attributes), whereas others are predictive (foretelling future values of certain 
attributes).
child_239600214b964f2f8595b455e2542a9a.title: unit2ii

child_47a729c46bb844e0b356778cfd764a0e.content:
In general, data mining seeks to identify four major types of patterns:
 1.
child_47a729c46bb844e0b356778cfd764a0e.title: unit2ii

child_d4ec17d36232432db9d28721f6d15e21.content:
Associations find the commonly co-occurring groupings of things, such as beer and 
diapers going together in market-basket analysis.
child_d4ec17d36232432db9d28721f6d15e21.title: unit2ii

child_29a2c81efb2e4c9fb555da1e9bcf65f9.content:
Predictions tell the nature of future occurrences of certain events based on what has 
happened in the past, such as predicting the winner of the Super Bowl or forecast-
ing the absolute temperature of a particular day.
child_29a2c81efb2e4c9fb555da1e9bcf65f9.title: unit2ii

child_c500b38f8c934d819fd979d719ee6e84.content:
Application Case 4.2
Harnessing Analytics to Combat Crime: Predictive Analytics Helps Memphis Police Department 
Pinpoint Crime and Focus Police Resources
When Larry Godwin took over as director of the 
Memphis Police Department (MPD) in 2004, crime 
across the metro area was surging, and city  leaders 
were growing impatient.
child_c500b38f8c934d819fd979d719ee6e84.title: unit2ii

child_f23fd4be9fef4d4dadf3843524f88b26.content:
“The mayor told me I want 
this crim
child_f23fd4be9fef4d4dadf3843524f88b26.title: unit2ii

child_2b03e74b2242496085d251ea7d7ed3a8.content:
ro area was surging, and city  leaders 
were growing impatient.
child_2b03e74b2242496085d251ea7d7ed3a8.title: unit2ii

child_b12f85a91cff42018355d52f49829fba.content:
“The mayor told me I want 
this crime problem fixed,” recalls Godwin, a 38-year 
veteran of the MPD.
child_b12f85a91cff42018355d52f49829fba.title: unit2ii

child_49abf031fca64f6fa193563e319c3072.content:
But the new director under -
stood that a business-as-usual approach to crime 
fighting would no longer be good enough.
child_49abf031fca64f6fa193563e319c3072.title: unit2ii

child_873fbeccc5c54edc8777a161adfb3f48.content:
Early 
on in his tenure, Godwin convened a  meeting of 
top law enforcement experts to formulate a fresh 
 strategy to turn the tide in the city’s crime war.
child_873fbeccc5c54edc8777a161adfb3f48.title: unit2ii

child_ca7d64ac7ac74fa5bbf72d8da7365055.content:
Among the participants in this mini-summit was 
Dr. Richard Janikowski, a professor of criminology at 
the University of Memphis, who specialized in using 
predictive analytics to better understand patterns.
child_ca7d64ac7ac74fa5bbf72d8da7365055.title: unit2ii

child_844372538577490e83c90354cb7b7af6.content:
fighting crime with analytics
Janikowski proposed the idea of mining MPD’s 
crime data banks to help zero in on where and 
when criminals were hitting hardest and then “focus 
police resources intelligently by putting them in the 
right place, on the right day, at the right time.” By 
doing so, he said, “you’ll either deter criminal activ-
ity or
child_844372538577490e83c90354cb7b7af6.title: unit2ii

child_edae165c5f584be9be9be19bc6c0df04.content:
he right day, at the right time.” By 
doing so, he said, “you’ll either deter criminal activ-
ity or you’re going to catch people.” The idea made 
sense to Godwin and in short order the MPD and 
the University of Memphis—along with Project Safe 
Neighborhoods—teamed up in a pilot program that 
later became known as Operation Blue CRUSH, or 
Crime Reduction Utilizing Statistical History.
child_edae165c5f584be9be9be19bc6c0df04.title: unit2ii

child_0c516d949e6942cdbbdf116678f43854.content: The data-driven pilot was wildly successful.
child_0c516d949e6942cdbbdf116678f43854.title: unit2ii

child_e07e68ff4d5c4e25b55697e60ef8fc7f.content:
During one 2-hour operation, officers arrested more 
criminals than they normally apprehended over an 
entire weekend.
child_e07e68ff4d5c4e25b55697e60ef8fc7f.title: unit2ii

child_fa47a79e54f3427586a6923226e6e200.content:
But for Blue CRUSH to be success-
ful on a citywide scale, the MPD would need to align 
its resources and operations to take full advantage 
of the power of predictive analytics.
child_fa47a79e54f3427586a6923226e6e200.title: unit2ii

child_6d28858f6bbd49c283d18678b91b1cb1.content:
If done right, 
a citywide rollout of Blue CRUSH had the potential 
to save money through efficient deployments—a big 
plus in a city facing serious budget pressures—even 
as the intelligence-based approach would help drive 
down overall crime rates.
child_6d28858f6bbd49c283d18678b91b1cb1.title: unit2ii

child_4096d6fa2c794e78a6cbdfa6f1d30cd2.content:
even 
as the intelligence-based approach would help drive 
down overall crime rates.
child_4096d6fa2c794e78a6cbdfa6f1d30cd2.title: unit2ii

child_2f3dfdec337f4f4a97772e2185b5bb45.content:
Shortly after, all precincts 
embraced Blue CRUSH, and predictive analytics has 
become one of the most potent weapons in MPD’s 
crime-fighting arsenal.
child_2f3dfdec337f4f4a97772e2185b5bb45.title: unit2ii

child_bd3eb8d82cd5494f84f64b0defe8a134.content:
At the heart of the system is a 
versatile statistical analysis tool—IBM SPSS Modeler—
that enables officers to unlock the intelligence hid -
den in the department’s huge digital library of crime 
records and police reports going back nearly a decade.
child_bd3eb8d82cd5494f84f64b0defe8a134.title: unit2ii

child_19842cddc7804a14a22ea47e67ddf0cd.content:
safer streets
All indications are that Blue CRUSH and its 
 intelligence-driven crime-fighting techniques are 
putting a serious dent in Memphis-area crime.
child_19842cddc7804a14a22ea47e67ddf0cd.title: unit2ii

child_172e20b3141b4d4fbaa048be455876be.content:
Since 
the program was launched, the number of Part One 
crimes—a category of serious offenses including 
homicide, rape, aggravated assault, auto theft, and 
larceny—has plummeted, dropping 27 percent from 
(Continued )
M04_SHAR4877_03_PIE_C04.indd   179 1/23/14   10:01 AM180	 Chapter 	4	 •	 Data	Mining
Application Case 4.2 (Continued)
2006 to 2010.
child_172e20b3141b4d4fbaa048be455876be.title: unit2ii

child_5fff59bddb854ce2b6f8e88359c765dd.content:
79 1/23/14   10:01 AM180	 Chapter 	4	 •	 Data	Mining
Application Case 4.2 (Continued)
2006 to 2010.
child_5fff59bddb854ce2b6f8e88359c765dd.title: unit2ii

child_fee765decf4f4e2a825fb6120272bf56.content:
Intelligent positioning of resources has 
been a major factor in the decline, helping to deter 
criminal activity by having more officers patrolling 
the right area at the right time on the right day.
child_fee765decf4f4e2a825fb6120272bf56.title: unit2ii

child_fbfdcfd6b11c410698c8f96554f48784.content:
More intelligent deployments also lead to 
faster reaction time, since officers are likely to be 
better positioned to respond to an unfolding crime.
child_fbfdcfd6b11c410698c8f96554f48784.title: unit2ii

child_c579b194cc734651952bc7cf520d8a40.content:
In addition, MPD’s organized crime units are using 
data from the predictive analytics solution to run 
special details that lead to successful multi-agency 
drug busts and other criminal roundups.
child_c579b194cc734651952bc7cf520d8a40.title: unit2ii

child_199ac2f584554c87abc54478dcb36cdd.content:
Not sur -
prisingly, arrest rates have been steadily improving 
across the Memphis area, which has a population of 
680,000.
child_199ac2f584554c87abc54478dcb36cdd.title: unit2ii

child_1af7124092e84a2181e91acf50b016f7.content:
Today, the MPD is continuing to explore new 
ways to exploit statistical analysis in its crime- fighting 
mission.
child_1af7124092e84a2181e91acf50b016f7.title: unit2ii

child_fc3824432df24ed3b2cb4413d8f342f6.content:
Of course, predictive analytics and data 
mining is just one part of MPD’s overall strategy for 
keeping Memph
child_fc3824432df24ed3b2cb4413d8f342f6.title: unit2ii

child_de89832c1b1a40f28d2675aeaa7e1ece.content:
predictive analytics and data 
mining is just one part of MPD’s overall strategy for 
keeping Memphis residents safe.
child_de89832c1b1a40f28d2675aeaa7e1ece.title: unit2ii

child_fda5a21b6b8944679f8c4172df6d9b1e.content:
Effective liaisons 
with community groups and businesses, strong part-
nerships with regional and federal law enforcement 
agencies, and intelligent organizational and opera -
tional structures all play a part in  continuing MPD’s 
success story.
child_fda5a21b6b8944679f8c4172df6d9b1e.title: unit2ii

child_fd70812ec161488d818cd34aad3e7c2d.content:
“At the end of the day, everybody 
wants to reduce crime,” says Godwin.
child_fd70812ec161488d818cd34aad3e7c2d.title: unit2ii

child_1b4661bb46a542e390bf60a8d363a53d.content:
“Everybody 
wants a safe community because without it, you 
don’t have economic growth, you don’t have 
anything.”
Questions for Discussion
 1.
child_1b4661bb46a542e390bf60a8d363a53d.title: unit2ii

child_384ab45e9de3478ba280b431e8422498.content:
How did the Memphis Police Department used 
data mining to better combat crime?
child_384ab45e9de3478ba280b431e8422498.title: unit2ii

child_e9eeebfdb73747aaa310ff08903a8023.content:
What were the challenges, the proposed solu -
tion, and the obtained results?
child_e9eeebfdb73747aaa310ff08903a8023.title: unit2ii

child_bfb0de07a7ac44f1bbfa3f1b315f5d4d.content:
Clusters identify natural groupings of things based on their known characteristics, 
such as assigning customers in different segments based on thei
child_bfb0de07a7ac44f1bbfa3f1b315f5d4d.title: unit2ii

child_dd4b1b1da4c54d49a448a5206a6da22a.content:
sed on their known characteristics, 
such as assigning customers in different segments based on their demographics and 
past purchase behaviors.
child_dd4b1b1da4c54d49a448a5206a6da22a.title: unit2ii

child_91b54898d6454d3d9384b5b6b2cfc5d9.content:
Sequential relationships discover time-ordered events, such as predicting that an 
existing banking customer who already has a checking account will open a savings 
account followed by an investment account within a year.
child_91b54898d6454d3d9384b5b6b2cfc5d9.title: unit2ii

child_800ce92b88b740fa8f1da309725b56d0.content:
These types of patterns have been manually extracted from data by humans for 
centuries, but the increasing volume of data in modern times has created a need for more 
automatic approaches.
child_800ce92b88b740fa8f1da309725b56d0.title: unit2ii

child_b1a4483dc83a4f6cbacd5c708dcecd9e.content:
As data sets have grown in size and complexity, direct manual 
data analysis has increasingly been augmented with indirect, automatic data processing 
tools that use sophisticated methodologies, methods, and algorithms.
child_b1a4483dc83a4f6cbacd5c708dcecd9e.title: unit2ii

child_5dd52d87f81d4f9cb9a4b2c07130488e.content:
The manifestation 
of such evolution of automated and semiautomated means of processing large data sets is 
now commonly referred to as data mining.
child_5dd52d87f81d4f9cb9a4b2c07130488e.title: unit2ii

child_23e9599a62ce448db93919b888b49ef2.content: Generally speaking, data mining tasks can be classified into three mai
child_23e9599a62ce448db93919b888b49ef2.title: unit2ii

child_f71a85454d5c46fdada0fef66c0a5a72.content: y referred to as data mining.
child_f71a85454d5c46fdada0fef66c0a5a72.title: unit2ii

child_a8b1f96ec5f54c889d1d5d3a5fc0df77.content:
Generally speaking, data mining tasks can be classified into three main catego -
ries: prediction, association, and clustering.
child_a8b1f96ec5f54c889d1d5d3a5fc0df77.title: unit2ii

child_ce2b582bae4249c38b4791f4f5719dc2.content:
Based on the way in which the patterns are 
extracted from the historical data, the learning algorithms of data mining methods can 
be classified as either supervised or unsupervised.
child_ce2b582bae4249c38b4791f4f5719dc2.title: unit2ii

child_9a9b65f3fdef4e0ba8e22fcfa34112e6.content:
With supervised learning algorithms, 
the training data includes both the descriptive attributes (i.e., independent variables or 
decision variables) as well as the class attribute (i.e., output variable or result variable).
child_9a9b65f3fdef4e0ba8e22fcfa34112e6.title: unit2ii

child_26a487ac957447ceaa4733fdd63174bd.content:
In 
contrast, with unsupervised learning the training data includes only the descriptive attri -
butes.
child_26a487ac957447ceaa4733fdd63174bd.title: unit2ii

child_f6532794a6964cdf95c16576c650a4f3.content:
Figure 4.3 shows a simple taxonomy for data mining tasks, along with the learning 
methods, and popular algorithms for each of the data mining tasks.
child_f6532794a6964cdf95c16576c650a4f3.title: unit2ii

child_d8aa242cb048427ba79a4f451688da6b.content: preDiCtion prediction is commonly referred to as the act of telling about the future.
child_d8aa242cb048427ba79a4f451688da6b.title: unit2ii

child_72ad205267284b8d8c5d09d4b536709a.content:
It 
differs from simple guessing by taking into account the experiences, opinions, and other
child_72ad205267284b8d8c5d09d4b536709a.title: unit2ii

child_5a61fd8a4d2b48348dfa3448d381a620.content:
It 
differs from simple guessing by taking into account the experiences, opinions, and other 
relevant information in conducting the task of foretelling.
child_5a61fd8a4d2b48348dfa3448d381a620.title: unit2ii

child_2ee75a097c974f3a806d1d27c9d78645.content:
A term that is commonly associ-
ated with prediction is forecasting.
child_2ee75a097c974f3a806d1d27c9d78645.title: unit2ii

child_8b66f4670aab48be9e2f7c51a67d4c7b.content:
Even though many believe that these two terms are 
M04_SHAR4877_03_PIE_C04.indd   180 1/23/14   10:01 AM	 Chapter	4	 •	 Data	Mining 181
synonymous, there is a subtle but critical difference between the two.
child_8b66f4670aab48be9e2f7c51a67d4c7b.title: unit2ii

child_8f1d129dc83e48b89680706b1dfe9d34.content:
Whereas prediction 
is largely experience and opinion based, forecasting is data and model based.
child_8f1d129dc83e48b89680706b1dfe9d34.title: unit2ii

child_a43d7966832d4fa08d0f5a74b87884cb.content:
That is, in 
order of increasing reliability, one might list the relevant terms as guessing, predicting, 
and forecasting, respectively.
child_a43d7966832d4fa08d0f5a74b87884cb.title: unit2ii

child_ff5d681d3ba84fee90a9680c028cf6da.content:
In data mining terminology, prediction and forecasting are 
used synonymously, and the term prediction is used as the common representation of the 
act.
child_ff5d681d3ba84fee90a9680c028cf6da.title: unit2ii

child_1796d33c9d6546c68a2e16b024ea7082.content:
Depending on the nature of what is being predicted, prediction can be named more 
specifically as classification (where the predicted thing, such as tomorrow’s forecast, is a
child_1796d33c9d6546c68a2e16b024ea7082.title: unit2ii

child_1fc4c14e359341d0973b03647992f3ab.content:
more 
specifically as classification (where the predicted thing, such as tomorrow’s forecast, is a 
class label such as “rainy” or “sunny”) or regression (where the predicted thing, such as 
tomorrow’s temperature, is a real number, such as “65°F”).
child_1fc4c14e359341d0973b03647992f3ab.title: unit2ii

child_be96becd049c414b9e231360c76e1853.content:
ClassiFiCation classification, or supervised induction, is perhaps the most common 
of all data mining tasks.
child_be96becd049c414b9e231360c76e1853.title: unit2ii

child_5d012bd09526482886aeaad710c08cb9.content:
The objective of classification is to analyze the historical data 
stored in a database and automatically generate a model that can predict future behavior.
child_5d012bd09526482886aeaad710c08cb9.title: unit2ii

child_3b571aaa100344d38793ed71dd219198.content:
This induced model consists of generalizations over the records of a training data set, 
which help distinguish predefined classes.
child_3b571aaa100344d38793ed71dd219198.title: unit2ii

child_2e32b5f9366749698f7789f997f0e654.content:
The hope is that the model can then be used 
to predict the classes of other unclassified records and, more important, to accurately 
predict actual future events.
child_2e32b5f9366749698f7789f997f0e654.title: unit2ii

child_ea5ce5eb12614a91b0f1df85f1561b7f.content:
Common classification tools include neural networks and decision trees (from 
machine learning), logistic regression and discriminant analysis (from traditional  statistics), 
and emerg
child_ea5ce5eb12614a91b0f1df85f1561b7f.title: unit2ii

child_a8f0d06f08594ed7bb9cff9205986ab3.content:
learning), logistic regression and discriminant analysis (from traditional  statistics), 
and emerging tools such as rough sets, support vector machines, and genetic algorithms.
child_a8f0d06f08594ed7bb9cff9205986ab3.title: unit2ii

child_36a6f914b74d44b1b00a521d6a65555d.content:
Statistics-based classification techniques (e.g., logistic regression and  discriminant  analysis) 
have received their share of criticism—that they make unrealistic assumptions about

thm, FP-Growth technique

Figure 4.3 A Simple Taxonomy for Data Mining Tasks.
child_516ba1bc3d954e95a56ae4ebfdb2db6f.title: unit2ii

child_87c5c818505044a5a3a38c8052d86f84.content:
M04_SHAR4877_03_PIE_C04.indd   181 1/23/14   10:01 AM182	 Chapter 	4	 •	 Data	Mining
the data, such as independence and normality—which limit their use in  classification-type 
data mining projects.
child_87c5c818505044a5a3a38c8052d86f84.title: unit2ii

child_c140c09b08dd4b31b472ee95f6f34201.content:
Neural networks involve the development of mathematical structures (somewhat 
resembling the biological neural networks in the human brain) that have the capability 
to learn from past experiences presented in the form of well-structured data sets.
child_c140c09b08dd4b31b472ee95f6f34201.title: unit2ii

child_0ff79625e4914f8ebcd61692398e0d2c.content:
They 
tend to be more effective when the number of variables involved is rather large and the 
relationships among them are complex and imprecise.
child_0ff79625e4914f8ebcd61692398e0d2c.title: unit2ii

child_2020d1074c6a40798cb90eff60a3b7e4.content:
Neural networks have disadvan -
tages as well as advantages.
child_2020d1074c6a40798cb90eff60a3b7e4.title: unit2ii

child_ebd04ed2635c40efafd97a7535a7d0e6.content:
For example, it is usually very difficult to provide a good 
rationale for the predictions made by a neural network.
child_ebd04ed2635c40efafd97a7535a7d0e6.title: unit2ii

child_711ee1e5dff948aabd82f7b2aa18fea5.content:
Also, neural networks tend to 
need considerable training.
child_711ee1e5dff948aabd82f7b2aa18fea5.title: unit2ii

child_0e5456ebad1b44bab3505ff1f6c3a8a9.content:
Also, neural networks tend to 
need considerable training.
child_0e5456ebad1b44bab3505ff1f6c3a8a9.title: unit2ii

child_e3099f33318841889ff091db7084fdea.content:
Unfortunately, the time needed for training tends to increase 
exponentially as the volume of data increases, and, in general, neural networks cannot be 
trained on very large databases.
child_e3099f33318841889ff091db7084fdea.title: unit2ii

child_9138295990084123a9959922b33e1372.content:
These and other factors have limited the applicability of 
neural networks in data-rich domains.
child_9138295990084123a9959922b33e1372.title: unit2ii

child_4942dd1ca6ae461f8a8e5d4ee2545518.content:
Decision trees classify data into a finite number of classes based on the values of 
the input variables.
child_4942dd1ca6ae461f8a8e5d4ee2545518.title: unit2ii

child_33f397a2b38441b886be701a40db141e.content:
Decision trees are essentially a hierarchy of if-then statements and are 
thus significantly faster than neural networks.
child_33f397a2b38441b886be701a40db141e.title: unit2ii

child_e09306a548c141b39087622f4b906073.content:
They are most appropriate for  categorical 
and interval data.
child_e09306a548c141b39087622f4b906073.title: unit2ii

child_3762f82081114b418c69062bb5b6e812.content:
Therefore, incorporating continuous variables into a  decision tree 
framework requires discretization; that is, converting continuous valued numerical vari -
ables to ranges and categories.
child_3762f82081114b418c69062bb5b6e812.title: unit2ii

child_a196f9b9fd264acb8ca35ef4192a5c20.content: A related category of classification tools is rule induction.
child_a196f9b9fd264acb8ca35ef4192a5c20.title: unit2ii

child_fd78d02a12eb4cb79451e3b78bd9d9ce.content:
Unlike with a decision 
tree, with rule induction the if-then statements are induced from the
child_fd78d02a12eb4cb79451e3b78bd9d9ce.title: unit2ii

child_5513bae6031a46cdbcc756079bf964ac.content:
Unlike with a decision 
tree, with rule induction the if-then statements are induced from the training data directly, 
and they need not be hierarchical in nature.
child_5513bae6031a46cdbcc756079bf964ac.title: unit2ii

child_682d5ce7c9574540ba049a19fac38cd1.content:
Other, more recent techniques such as SVM, 
rough sets, and genetic algorithms are gradually finding their way into the arsenal of clas-
sification algorithms.
child_682d5ce7c9574540ba049a19fac38cd1.title: unit2ii

child_3d1c2a97810c44e5b6c7ed90443cd3c5.content:
Clustering clustering partitions a collection of things (e.g., objects, events, etc., 
presented in a structured data set) into segments (or natural groupings) whose mem -
bers share similar characteristics.
child_3d1c2a97810c44e5b6c7ed90443cd3c5.title: unit2ii

child_64538bc4613140a7a055bfb3bf8f9d67.content:
Unlike in classification, in clustering the class labels are 
unknown.
child_64538bc4613140a7a055bfb3bf8f9d67.title: unit2ii

child_35c712e8a5a2427a91197f462fac278f.content:
As the selected algorithm goes through the data set, identifying the common -
alities of things based on their characteristics, the clusters are established.
child_35c712e8a5a2427a91197f462fac278f.title: unit2ii

child_18ea589c70644f158eb1baf557a5e218.content:
Because the 
clusters are determined using a heuristic-type algorithm, and because different algorithms 
may end up with different sets of clusters for the same data set, before the results of 
 clustering techniques are put to actua
child_18ea589c70644f158eb1baf557a5e218.title: unit2ii

child_ce9a8f72fca342a9a9903435af310478.content:
ts of clusters for the same data set, before the results of 
 clustering techniques are put to actual use it may be necessary for an expert to inter -
pret, and potentially modify, the suggested clusters.
child_ce9a8f72fca342a9a9903435af310478.title: unit2ii

child_0fec48784db940b7bd88d058fbc70659.content:
After reasonable clusters have been 
 identified, they can be used to classify and interpret new data.
child_0fec48784db940b7bd88d058fbc70659.title: unit2ii

child_66d6417508464a7493e16874964d5947.content: Not surprisingly, clustering techniques include optimization.
child_66d6417508464a7493e16874964d5947.title: unit2ii

child_0394101f7fa6446e97307714b145e469.content:
The goal of clustering 
is to create groups so that the members within each group have maximum similarity and 
the members across groups have minimum similarity.
child_0394101f7fa6446e97307714b145e469.title: unit2ii

child_5029018675ba4e83a114a4df44bd119f.content:
The most commonly used cluster -
ing techniques include k-means (from statistics) and self-organizing maps (from machine 
learning), which is a unique neural network architecture developed by Kohonen (1982).
child_5029018675ba4e83a114a4df44bd119f.title: unit2ii

child_3c2081029c164f71998623bcc5e51b7f.content:
Firms often effectively use their data mining systems to perform market segmenta -
tion with cluster analysis.
child_3c2081029c164f71998623bcc5e51b7f.title: unit2ii

child_4b47b8a2938441d0b3319d7b0de2f645.content:
Cluster analysis is a means of identifying classes of items so that 
items in a cluster have more in common with each other than with items in other
child_4b47b8a2938441d0b3319d7b0de2f645.title: unit2ii

child_a31a6b3f6e1e43b480d28bfe3b92082a.content:
s of items so that 
items in a cluster have more in common with each other than with items in other clusters.
child_a31a6b3f6e1e43b480d28bfe3b92082a.title: unit2ii

child_e99b8cda00a9443fbc2a08248a1417bb.content:
It can be used in segmenting customers and directing appropriate marketing products to 
the segments at the right time in the right format at the right price.
child_e99b8cda00a9443fbc2a08248a1417bb.title: unit2ii

child_c576b836b29d4f889b6c0103d7be7bb8.content:
Cluster analysis is also 
used to identify natural groupings of events or objects so that a common set of character-
istics of these groups can be identified to describe them.
child_c576b836b29d4f889b6c0103d7be7bb8.title: unit2ii

child_97ca101f97194adeb36323703d28d883.content:
assoCiations associations, or association rule learning in data mining,  is a popu -
lar and well-researched technique for discovering interesting relationships among vari -
ables in large databases.
child_97ca101f97194adeb36323703d28d883.title: unit2ii

child_d2e4b46ad417431282f5d96ed6708fd1.content:
Thanks to automated data-gathering technologies such as bar 
code scanners, the use of association rules for discovering regularities among products 
M04_SHAR4877_03_PIE_C04.indd   182 1/23/14   10:01 AM	 Chapter	4	 •	 Data	Mining 183
in large-scale transactions recorded by point-of-sale systems in supermarkets has become 
a common knowledge-discovery
child_d2e4b46ad417431282f5d96ed6708fd1.title: unit2ii

child_188a3bd411f44d41a85b34b76edf329e.content:
sactions recorded by point-of-sale systems in supermarkets has become 
a common knowledge-discovery task in the retail industry.
child_188a3bd411f44d41a85b34b76edf329e.title: unit2ii

child_f619ae48e9f5424fba2e2afd6c2f9be6.content:
In the context of the retail 
industry, association rule mining is often called market-basket analysis.
child_f619ae48e9f5424fba2e2afd6c2f9be6.title: unit2ii

child_66b675c7a1524573b7be9e804e897617.content:
Two commonly used derivatives of association rule mining are link analysis and 
sequence mining .
child_66b675c7a1524573b7be9e804e897617.title: unit2ii

child_819fcff930a3452895dfefffa415ce6a.content:
With link analysis, the linkage among many objects of  interest is 
 discovered automatically, such as the link between Web pages and referential  relationships 
among groups of academic publication authors.
child_819fcff930a3452895dfefffa415ce6a.title: unit2ii

child_c152036dc1c94113b65ef141cff843bf.content:
With sequence mining, relationships 
are examined in terms of their order of occurrence to identify associations over time.
child_c152036dc1c94113b65ef141cff843bf.title: unit2ii

child_2505b0f8662042299ac5baa5b0be71ee.content:
Algorithms used in association rule mining include the popular Apriori (where frequent 
itemsets are identified) and FP-Growth, OneR, ZeroR, and Eclat.
child_2505b0f8662042299ac5baa5b0be71ee.title: unit2ii

child_b7525d34662c42b0977bfad612962cb2.content:
Visualization anD tiMe-series ForeCasting Two techniques often associated with 
data mining are visualization and time-series forecasting.
child_b7525d34662c42b0977bfad612962cb2.title: unit2ii

child_e7df5d33ef4b43c799650641738d8599.content:
Visualization can be used in 
conjunction wit
child_e7df5d33ef4b43c799650641738d8599.title: unit2ii

child_4502fd87f28f4f78b59c9d5bf7a15417.content: mining are visualization and time-series forecasting.
child_4502fd87f28f4f78b59c9d5bf7a15417.title: unit2ii

child_5263a315390e4c9fab86d55350e3ff17.content:
Visualization can be used in 
conjunction with other data mining techniques to gain a clearer understanding of under-
lying relationships.
child_5263a315390e4c9fab86d55350e3ff17.title: unit2ii

child_c0895318346048108bf62859d8040a8b.content:
As the importance of visualization has increased in recent years, a 
new term, visual analytics, has emerged.
child_c0895318346048108bf62859d8040a8b.title: unit2ii

child_a2c0533809fb49f699f112a032f860b8.content:
The idea is to combine analytics and visualiza-
tion in a single environment for easier and faster knowledge creation.
child_a2c0533809fb49f699f112a032f860b8.title: unit2ii

child_7965273e77d540808f3198b6eb61a626.content:
Visual analytics is 
covered in detail in Chapter 3.
child_7965273e77d540808f3198b6eb61a626.title: unit2ii

child_3d64a4a6c7674106be62ae05c01148f1.content:
In time-series forecasting, the data consists of values of 
the same variable that is captured and stored over time in regular intervals.
child_3d64a4a6c7674106be62ae05c01148f1.title: unit2ii

child_3d0887ae9a0f41a5899f785299787e34.content:
These data 
are then used to develop forecasting models to extrapolate the future values of the same 
variable.
child_3d0887ae9a0f41a5899f785299787e34.title: unit2ii

child_0c0b5c81a6c0430481a418148ba6eadf.content:
Data Mining Versus statistics
Data mining and statistics have a lot in common.
child_0c0b5c81a6c0430481a418148ba6eadf.title: unit2ii

child_13616df0eb7144c885d4ee11c67f9776.content:
They both look for relationships within 
data.
child_13616df0eb7144c885d4ee11c67f9776.title: unit2ii

child_7640df94fbaa496787c5873dfc87b141.content:
Most people call statistics the “foundation of data mining.” The main difference 
between the two is that statistics starts with a well-defined prop
child_7640df94fbaa496787c5873dfc87b141.title: unit2ii

child_72201297f87c44f5b789652af0cf3bf4.content:
ata mining.” The main difference 
between the two is that statistics starts with a well-defined proposition and hypothesis 
while data mining starts with a loosely defined discovery statement.
child_72201297f87c44f5b789652af0cf3bf4.title: unit2ii

child_574fc9f4025943b6ae44b294a731c796.content:
Statistics collects 
sample data (i.e., primary data) to test the hypothesis, while data mining and analytics 
use all of the existing data (i.e., often observational, secondary data) to discover novel 
patterns and relationships.
child_574fc9f4025943b6ae44b294a731c796.title: unit2ii

child_a0f5db1c9ef049d8a3aa91d4b95bbdad.content: Another difference comes from the size of data that they use.
child_a0f5db1c9ef049d8a3aa91d4b95bbdad.title: unit2ii

child_53c01ac47ab942f987d267511f696d58.content:
Data mining looks for data sets that are as “big” as possible while statistics looks for the 
right	size	of	data	(if	the	data	is	larger	than	what	is	needed/required	for	the	statistical	
analysis, a sample of the data is used).
child_53c01ac47ab942f987d267511f696d58.title: unit2ii

child_161bd05161f84b1d8a61dbef87f24873.content:
The meaning of “large data” is rather different 
between statistics and data mining.
child_161bd05161f84b1d8a61dbef87f24873.title: unit2ii

child_3c7988f793c841d4a9a5d88f28a05118.content:
While a few hundred to a thousand data points are 
large enough to a statistician, several million to a few billion data points are considered 
large for data mining studies.
child_3c7988f793c841d4a9a5d88f28a05118.title: unit2ii

child_0886199d00c24da9996739864699fd1e.content:
a few billion data points are considered 
large for data mining studies.
child_0886199d00c24da9996739864699fd1e.title: unit2ii

child_5c3eb7ff0b824eb88abf7715ece43d13.content:
Why are there many different names and definitions for data 
mining?
child_5c3eb7ff0b824eb88abf7715ece43d13.title: unit2ii

child_e404b9497a2e46388ee91647d00998be.content: What recent factors have increased the popularity of data mining?
child_e404b9497a2e46388ee91647d00998be.title: unit2ii

child_b8cabfb62bad42149710e842112b53d6.content: Is data mining a new discipline?
child_b8cabfb62bad42149710e842112b53d6.title: unit2ii

child_75e6955ac19b41b1947cec5d9f13639a.content: What are some major data mining methods and algorithms?
child_75e6955ac19b41b1947cec5d9f13639a.title: unit2ii

child_2ced6c3ae0674e82842ef84d8dfc49a5.content: What are the key differences between the major data mining methods?
child_2ced6c3ae0674e82842ef84d8dfc49a5.title: unit2ii

child_d00a6e01ea4247b2beff3b432d7b1856.content:
4.3 Data Mining appliCations
Data mining has become a popular tool in addressing many complex businesses prob -
lems and opportunities.
child_d00a6e01ea4247b2beff3b432d7b1856.title: unit2ii

child_b29f5a0fc3f04cc3b28f89815ad957e6.content:
It has been proven to be very successful and helpful in many 
areas, some of which are shown by the following representative examples.
child_b29f5a0fc3f04cc3b28f89815ad957e6.title: unit2ii

child_3a4acb6694374b6698de1059c483c169.content:
The goal of 
M04_SHAR4877_03_PIE_C04.indd   183 1/23/14   10:01 AM184	 Chapter 	4	 •	 Data	Mining
many of these business data mining applications is to solve a pressing problem or to 
explore an emerging business opportunity in order to create a sustainable competitive 
advantage.
child_3a4acb6694374b6698de1059c483c169.title: unit2ii

child_45a6cfa509d34787bebfe240976f3fbe.content:
explore an emerging business opportunity in order to create a sustainable competitive 
advantage.
child_45a6cfa509d34787bebfe240976f3fbe.title: unit2ii

child_c51ca00e1dcc4f7e8635bf0c181a5924.content:
Customer relationship management (CRM) 
is the extension of traditional marketing.
child_c51ca00e1dcc4f7e8635bf0c181a5924.title: unit2ii

child_e9be8acf50a34b788dfd73f80c9dd5a3.content:
The goal of CRM is to create one-on-one 
 relationships with customers by developing an intimate understanding of their needs 
and wants.
child_e9be8acf50a34b788dfd73f80c9dd5a3.title: unit2ii

child_a08f9a6119cd4a36a8e49a1c63025a34.content:
As businesses build relationships with their customers over time through 
a variety of interactions (e.g., product inquiries, sales, service requests,  warranty calls, 
product reviews, social media connections), they accumulate  tremendous amounts 
of data.
child_a08f9a6119cd4a36a8e49a1c63025a34.title: unit2ii

child_bd28842d7e0a47999997f11b75f8e797.content:
When combined with demographic and socioeconomic attributes, this 
	information-rich	data	can	be	used	to	(1)	identify	most	likely	responders/buyers	of	new	
products/services	(i.e.,	customer	profiling);	(2)		understand	the	root	causes	of	customer	
attrition in order to improve customer retention (i.e., churn analysis); (3)   discover 
 time-variant associations between products and se
child_bd28842d7e0a47999997f11b75f8e797.title: unit2ii

child_51857a064d78461cb898b1091929b92b.content:
retention (i.e., churn analysis); (3)   discover 
 time-variant associations between products and services to maximize sales and 
 customer value; and (4) identify the most profitable customers and their preferential 
needs to strengthen relationships and to maximize sales.
child_51857a064d78461cb898b1091929b92b.title: unit2ii

child_aa36b149b614484ba8128fdb5d2f8c5c.content:
Data mining can help banks with the following: (1) automating the 
loan application process by accurately predicting the most probable defaulters; 
(2) detecting fraudulent credit card and online-banking transactions; (3) identifying 
ways to maximize customer value by selling them products and services that they 
are most likely to buy; and (4) optimizing the cash return by accurately forecasting 
the cash flow on banking entities (e.g., ATM machines, banking branches).
child_aa36b149b614484ba8128fdb5d2f8c5c.title: unit2ii

child_3c0f3bd9c6c6438baf08200ed86ced6e.content:
In the retailing industry, data mining can be used to 
(1) predict accurate sales volumes at specific retail locations in order to determine 
correct inventory levels; (2) identify sales relationships between d
child_3c0f3bd9c6c6438baf08200ed86ced6e.title: unit2ii

child_a1c4865d0c97465e8fe83ca40885aeec.content:
ocations in order to determine 
correct inventory levels; (2) identify sales relationships between different products 
(with market-basket analysis) to improve the store layout and optimize sales promo-
tions; (3) forecast consumption levels of different product types (based on seasonal 
and environmental conditions) to optimize logistics and, hence, maximize sales; and 
(4) discover interesting patterns in the movement of products (especially for the 
products that have a limited shelf life because they are prone to expiration, perish-
ability, and contamination) in a supply chain by analyzing sensory and RFID data.
child_a1c4865d0c97465e8fe83ca40885aeec.title: unit2ii

child_68b9083276e146e0bc8cd25765b03e83.content:
Manufacturers can use data mining to 
(1)  predict machinery failures before they occur through the use of sensory data 
(enabling what is called condition-based maintenance ); (2) identify anomalies 
and commonalities in production systems to optimize manufacturing capacity; and 
(3) discover novel patterns to identify and improve product
child_68b9083276e146e0bc8cd25765b03e83.title: unit2ii

child_f59179d7be9e4d818d46ac3f6b62a172.content:
o optimize manufacturing capacity; and 
(3) discover novel patterns to identify and improve product quality.
child_f59179d7be9e4d818d46ac3f6b62a172.title: unit2ii

child_20c60a6a797843ff81cca48324c46d01.content:
Brokers and traders use data mining to 
(1) predict when and how much certain bond prices will change; (2) forecast the 
range and direction of stock fluctuations; (3) assess the effect of particular issues 
and events on overall market movements; and (4) identify and prevent fraudulent 
activities in securities trading.
child_20c60a6a797843ff81cca48324c46d01.title: unit2ii

child_379adb78200948f2a62ad3512ba9fe38.content:
The insurance industry uses data mining techniques to (1)  forecast 
claim amounts for property and medical coverage costs for better business 
 planning;  (2) determine optimal rate plans based on the analysis of claims and 
 customer data; (3) predict which customers are more likely to buy new policies 
with special features; and (4) identify and prevent incorrect claim payments and 
fraudulent activities.
child_379adb78200948f2a62ad3512ba9fe38.title: unit2ii

child_78c083aa0a8c472cad14369ce4060902.content:
Data mining can be used to (1) predict disk 
drive failures well before
child_78c083aa0a8c472cad14369ce4060902.title: unit2ii

child_fc16955b3bb743289d69dc498773d27f.content:
Data mining can be used to (1) predict disk 
drive failures well before they actually occur; (2) identify and filter unwanted Web 
content and e-mail messages; (3) detect and prevent computer network  security 
bridges; and (4) identify potentially unsecure software products.
child_fc16955b3bb743289d69dc498773d27f.title: unit2ii

child_9d0ce0019ed84ded9e0780c67b6696be.content:
M04_SHAR4877_03_PIE_C04.indd   184 1/23/14   10:01 AM	 Chapter	4	 •	 Data	Mining 185
•	Government and defense.
child_9d0ce0019ed84ded9e0780c67b6696be.title: unit2ii

child_e79e08c0e8c14657b22b4d5a773ac6b7.content:
Data mining also has a number of military 
 applications.
child_e79e08c0e8c14657b22b4d5a773ac6b7.title: unit2ii

child_1231bcd68adf4fc4881ab9c44c180294.content:
It can be used to (1) forecast the cost of moving military personnel and 
equipment; (2) predict an adversary’s moves and, hence, develop more  successful 
strategies for military engagements; (3) predict resource consumption for better 
planning and budgeting; and (4) identify classes of unique experiences, strategies, 
and lessons learned from military operations for better knowledge sharing through-
out the organization.
child_1231bcd68adf4fc4881ab9c44c180294.title: unit2ii

child_016756291eb249199ac18c251fd67c4f.content: •	Travel industry (airlines, hotels/resorts, rental car companies).
child_016756291eb249199ac18c251fd67c4f.title: unit2ii

child_5efe328515d2463b82d44fafb7c40a4e.content: •	Travel industry (airlines, hotels/resorts, rental car companies).
child_5efe328515d2463b82d44fafb7c40a4e.title: unit2ii

child_18179cc01053466f9da5b62041c282a3.content:
Data 
 mining has a variety of uses in the travel industry.
child_18179cc01053466f9da5b62041c282a3.title: unit2ii

child_e0c35253d37f4f58a2d7059f282165b0.content:
It is successfully used to (1)  predict 
sales	of	different	services	(seat	types	in	airplanes,	room	types	in	hotels/resorts,	car	
types in rental car companies) in order to optimally price services to maximize 
revenues as a function of time-varying transactions (commonly referred to as yield 
management); (2) forecast demand at different locations to better allocate limited 
organizational resources; (3) identify the most profitable customers and provide 
them with personalized services to maintain their repeat business; and (4) retain 
valuable employees by identifying and acting on the root causes for attrition.
child_e0c35253d37f4f58a2d7059f282165b0.title: unit2ii

child_b72e6e26078042f79a70c28fd9ccb291.content: Data mining has a number of healthcare applications.
child_b72e6e26078042f79a70c28fd9ccb291.title: unit2ii

child_859ae3336abd4e68860b55da7dc04f20.content:
It can be used 
to (1) identify people without health insurance and the factors underlying this unde-
sired phenomenon; (2) identify novel cost–benefit relationships between diff
child_859ae3336abd4e68860b55da7dc04f20.title: unit2ii

child_2274df2a577e424fa71f993e3b577c28.content:
s underlying this unde-
sired phenomenon; (2) identify novel cost–benefit relationships between different 
treatments to develop more effective strategies; (3) forecast the level and the time of 
demand at different service locations to optimally allocate organizational resources; 
and (4) understand the underlying reasons for customer and employee attrition.
child_2274df2a577e424fa71f993e3b577c28.title: unit2ii

child_40a97017bbac40439842e604b4f4a9a9.content:
Use of data mining in medicine should be viewed as an invaluable 
complement to traditional medical research, which is mainly clinical and biolog -
ical in nature.
child_40a97017bbac40439842e604b4f4a9a9.title: unit2ii

child_37590a6e8b4948f6af3f417a8668465d.content:
Data mining analyses can (1) identify novel patterns to improve 
survivability of patients with cancer; (2) predict success rates of organ transplan -
tation patients to develop better donor-organ matching policies; (3) identify the 
functions of  different genes in the human chromosome (known as genomics); and 
(4)  discover the relationships between symptoms and illnesses (as well as illnesses 
and successful treatments) to help medical professionals make
child_37590a6e8b4948f6af3f417a8668465d.title: unit2ii

child_d3002fad12984aa9acc010e501283efc.content:
and illnesses (as well as illnesses 
and successful treatments) to help medical professionals make informed and correct 
decisions in a timely manner.
child_d3002fad12984aa9acc010e501283efc.title: unit2ii

child_647522e0d5664c0195ec087041ade44b.content:
Data mining is successfully used by the  entertainment 
industry to (1) analyze viewer data to decide what programs to show during 
prime time and how to maximize returns by knowing where to insert advertise -
ments; (2)  predict the financial success of movies before they are produced to 
make investment decisions and to optimize the returns; (3) forecast the demand at 
 different  locations and different times to better schedule entertainment events and 
to  optimally allocate resources; and (4) develop optimal pricing policies to maxi -
mize revenues.
child_647522e0d5664c0195ec087041ade44b.title: unit2ii

child_0d0d675051254948bfaf25aeffb2a8b2.content:
Data mining has a number of 
homeland security and law enforcement applications.
child_0d0d675051254948bfaf25aeffb2a8b2.title: unit2ii

child_814e2653528346bda4eb4f0baca7bfb9.content:
Data mining is often used to 
(1) identify patterns of terrorist behaviors (see Application Case 4.3 for an example 
of the use of data mi
child_814e2653528346bda4eb4f0baca7bfb9.title: unit2ii

child_3c850f3dd3ef4a38af48095a5a20fd51.content:
tify patterns of terrorist behaviors (see Application Case 4.3 for an example 
of the use of data mining to track funding of terrorists’ activities); (2) discover crime 
patterns (e.g., locations, timings, criminal behaviors, and other related attributes) 
to help solve criminal cases in a timely manner; (3) predict and eliminate potential 
biological and chemical attacks to the nation’s critical infrastructure by analyzing 
special-purpose sensory data; and (4) identify and stop malicious attacks on critical 
information infrastructures (often called information warfare).
child_3c850f3dd3ef4a38af48095a5a20fd51.title: unit2ii

child_d44d7c86dc6342c4a6b6abbc724b95ab.content:
Data mining was used to improve the performance of National Basketball 
Association (NBA) teams in the United States.
child_d44d7c86dc6342c4a6b6abbc724b95ab.title: unit2ii

child_1ded5b2ac8214e97aa996804d020d205.content:
Major League Baseball teams are 
into predictive analytics and data mining to optimally utilize their limited resources 
for a winning season (see Moneyball article in Chapter 1).
child_1ded5b2ac8214e97aa996804d020d205.title: unit2ii

child_174fb2cb91784685a433584e42257eeb.content:
In fact, most, if not all,  
M04_SHAR4877_03_PIE_C04.indd   185 1/23/14   10:01 AM186	 Chapter 	4	 •	 Data	Minin
child_174fb2cb91784685a433584e42257eeb.title: unit2ii

child_d789c95a9c914de68faee871b89e3b54.content:
t, if not all,  
M04_SHAR4877_03_PIE_C04.indd   185 1/23/14   10:01 AM186	 Chapter 	4	 •	 Data	Mining
professional sports nowadays employ data crunchers and use data mining to increase 
their chances of winning.
child_d789c95a9c914de68faee871b89e3b54.title: unit2ii

child_1eb2937fbf85470888b67e023faa572e.content:
Data mining applications are not limited to professional 
sports.
child_1eb2937fbf85470888b67e023faa572e.title: unit2ii

child_ba6f12e8cfcd4db187ca0f56050814ee.content: In a recently published article, Delen at al.
child_ba6f12e8cfcd4db187ca0f56050814ee.title: unit2ii

child_928942cb1f124a3596efad3d0688b458.content:
(2012) developed  models to 
predict NCAA Bowl Game outcomes using a wide range of variables about the two 
opposing teams’ previous games statistics.
child_928942cb1f124a3596efad3d0688b458.title: unit2ii

child_59526065c0e34fb4bfebb87e2504b026.content:
Wright (2012) used a variety of predictors 
for examination of the NCAA men’s basketball championship bracket (a.k.a. March 
Madness).
child_59526065c0e34fb4bfebb87e2504b026.title: unit2ii

child_4582175cc200413d8f8c75329bdd0993.content: What are the major application areas for data mining?
child_4582175cc200413d8f8c75329bdd0993.title: unit2ii

child_66349b7541004dc9aa8d9ef8a8137667.content:

teristics of these applications.
child_66349b7541004dc9aa8d9ef8a8137667.title: unit2ii

child_fe35c02fe7304baca8d3a9429242e38b.content: What do you think is the most prominent application area for data mining?
child_fe35c02fe7304baca8d3a9429242e38b.title: unit2ii

child_76b5e7a64c084c5689b7787e44c3eb28.content: Can you think of other application areas for data mining not discussed in this section?
child_76b5e7a64c084c5689b7787e44c3eb28.title: unit2ii

child_169abfcd1dfc4ec290e5f795bab3ce24.content: Can you think of other application areas for data mining not discussed in this section?

child_7c8d8110bacc405abdec32128a862f01.content:
Application Case 4.3
A Mine on Terrorist Funding
The terrorist attack on the World Trade Center on 
September 11, 2001, underlined the importance 
of open source intelligence.
child_7c8d8110bacc405abdec32128a862f01.title: unit2ii

child_bd4f96a0370e4586b65754826723954e.content:
The USA PATRIOT 
Act and the creation of the U.S. Department of 
Homeland Security (DHS) heralded the potential 
application of information technology and data 
mining  techniques to detect money laundering and 
other forms of terrorist financing.
child_bd4f96a0370e4586b65754826723954e.title: unit2ii

child_1dffd58bfe264e81be9b5b239c0758f8.content:
Law enforcement 
agencies have been focusing on money laundering 
activities via normal transactions through banks and 
other  financial service organizations.
child_1dffd58bfe264e81be9b5b239c0758f8.title: unit2ii

child_0ce6aea369ae4663b3962f646ba28695.content:
Law enforcement agencies are now  focusing 
on international trade pricing as a terrorism  funding 
tool.
child_0ce6aea369ae4663b3962f646ba28695.title: unit2ii

child_ea7aa920eaab48d09baf3fb249284c65.content:
International trade has been used by money 
launderers to move money silently out of a  country 
without attracting government attention.
child_ea7aa920eaab48d09baf3fb249284c65.title: unit2ii

child_956596af810b4dabaa8679883aeebc52.content:
This  transfer 
is achieved by overvaluing imports and underval
child_956596af810b4dabaa8679883aeebc52.title: unit2ii

child_b5067bf995c742eba1f9e179565ce14c.content:
This  transfer 
is achieved by overvaluing imports and undervalu -
ing exports.
child_b5067bf995c742eba1f9e179565ce14c.title: unit2ii

child_2cfeac3bea604a32ba6bf9d6c4121323.content:
For example, a  domestic importer 
and foreign exporter could form a  partnership 
and  overvalue imports, thereby  transferring money 
from the home country, resulting in crimes related 
to  customs fraud, income tax evasion, and money 
 laundering.
child_2cfeac3bea604a32ba6bf9d6c4121323.title: unit2ii

child_9c7852cb956944248bbedf9fb5b076ab.content:
The foreign exporter could be a  member 
of a terrorist organization.
child_9c7852cb956944248bbedf9fb5b076ab.title: unit2ii

child_533d4c9f91da48d79797fa9504d74ca5.content:
Data mining techniques focus on analysis of 
data on import and export transactions from the 
U.S.  Department of Commerce and commerce-
related entities.
child_533d4c9f91da48d79797fa9504d74ca5.title: unit2ii

child_095538f6fcb44a95ab3ab81f13395473.content:
Import prices that exceed the upper 
quartile import prices and export prices that are 
lower than the lower quartile export prices are 
tracked.
child_095538f6fcb44a95ab3ab81f13395473.title: unit2ii

child_2f8a29860d7c4797bdacc0ff22e1ad6d.content:
The focus is on abnormal transfer prices 
between  corporations that may result in shifting 
 taxable income and taxes out of the United States.
child_2f8a29860d7c4797bdacc0ff22e1ad6d.title: unit2ii

child_9aa41fa598664f08ab07bc28cc726c62.content:
An observed price  deviation may be related to 
income	tax	avoidance/evasion,	money	laundering,	or	
 terrorist  fin
child_9aa41fa598664f08ab07bc28cc726c62.title: unit2ii

child_253b651b3f57458585635e0712a79682.content:
ce  deviation may be related to 
income	tax	avoidance/evasion,	money	laundering,	or	
 terrorist  financing.
child_253b651b3f57458585635e0712a79682.title: unit2ii

child_b0a2ca080e9945618757cafdbde1fd51.content:
The observed price  deviation may 
also be due to an error in the U.S. trade database.
child_b0a2ca080e9945618757cafdbde1fd51.title: unit2ii

child_c920be1de757448aab7669982db457c0.content:
Data mining will result in efficient evaluation 
of data, which, in turn, will aid in the fight against 
terrorism.
child_c920be1de757448aab7669982db457c0.title: unit2ii

child_a86a0b12d21a4fbba9b4ea36700ba84d.content:
The application of information technology 
and data mining techniques to financial transactions 
can contribute to better intelligence information.
child_a86a0b12d21a4fbba9b4ea36700ba84d.title: unit2ii

child_3521943ac9954786a7fec85d8148a291.content: How can data mining be used to fight terrorism?

what is covered in this short application case.

child_99d6ee63bbc948d2a8b2410c634bec7c.content:
M04_SHAR4877_03_PIE_C04.indd   186 1/23/14   10:01 AM	 Chapter	4	 •	 Data	Mining 187
4.4 Data Mining proCess
In order to systematically carry out data mining projects, a general process is usually fol-
lowed.
child_99d6ee63bbc948d2a8b2410c634bec7c.title: unit2ii

child_c6af8ccc92404b1caa940df49bdae0fd.content:
Based on best practices, data mining researchers and practitioners have proposed 
several processes (workflows or simple step-by-step approaches) to maximize the chances 
of success in conducting data mining projects.
child_c6af8ccc92404b1caa940df49bdae0fd.title: unit2ii

child_9cb362c8ac2f4e459b14d2990e6afbb1.content:
These efforts have led to several standardized 
processes, some of which (a few of the most popular ones) are described in this section.
child_9cb362c8ac2f4e459b14d2990e6afbb1.title: unit2ii

child_1f608aebc070441b9f2c30f9496b05c6.content:
One such standardized process, arguably the most popular one, Cross-Industry 
Standard Process for Data Mining— crisp-dm—was proposed in the mid-1990s by a 
European consortium of companies to serve as a nonproprietary standard methodology 
for data mining (CRISP-DM, 2013).
child_1f608aebc070441b9f2c30f9496b05c6.title: unit2ii

child_7bca7c2899c5460e8516a42cf9fc7c75.content:
nonproprietary standard methodology 
for data mining (CRISP-DM, 2013).
child_7bca7c2899c5460e8516a42cf9fc7c75.title: unit2ii

child_17cb2fc77a724fd988294472df3e03fc.content:
Figure 4.4 illustrates this proposed process, which is a 
sequence of six steps that starts with a good understanding of the business and the need for 
the data mining project (i.e., the application domain) and ends with the deployment of the 
solution that satisfied the specific business need.
child_17cb2fc77a724fd988294472df3e03fc.title: unit2ii

child_758530ff1bb54c94a4ec051e4451eaea.content:
Even though these steps are sequential in 
nature, there is usually a great deal of backtracking.
child_758530ff1bb54c94a4ec051e4451eaea.title: unit2ii

child_f4740ef07fd94d9ab1317a27929ef431.content:
Because the data mining is driven by 
experience	and	experimentation,	depending	on	the	problem	situation	and	the	knowledge/
experience of the analyst, the whole process can be very iterative (i.e., one should expect 
to go back and forth through the steps quite a few times) and time-consuming.
child_f4740ef07fd94d9ab1317a27929ef431.title: unit2ii

child_f86123d259ef4c66ad441f5fd344933b.content:
Because 
later steps are built on the outcomes of the former ones, one should pay extra attention to 
the earlier steps in order not to put the whole study on an incorrect path from the onset.
child_f86123d259ef4c66ad441f5fd344933b.title: unit2ii

child_79aa0ccaae464df1b0850769f2038704.content:
step 1: Business understanding
The key element
child_79aa0ccaae464df1b0850769f2038704.title: unit2ii

child_cb7d89aca8de4944ae2aba6467577cb7.content: the whole study on an incorrect path from the onset.
child_cb7d89aca8de4944ae2aba6467577cb7.title: unit2ii

child_e3fbccdd379e4767b3c576f1b1cfb064.content:
step 1: Business understanding
The key element of any data mining study is to know what the study is for.
child_e3fbccdd379e4767b3c576f1b1cfb064.title: unit2ii

child_87a374852eec4bdfbe294b0d9b5ecf8f.content:
Answering 
such a question begins with a thorough understanding of the managerial need for new 
knowledge and an explicit specification of the business objective regarding the study to

Figure 4.4 The Six-Step CRISP-DM Data Mining Process.
child_87a374852eec4bdfbe294b0d9b5ecf8f.title: unit2ii

child_d3a7c8a0fae741c7aac46af2f67d7bfd.content:
M04_SHAR4877_03_PIE_C04.indd   187 1/23/14   10:01 AM188	 Chapter 	4	 •	 Data	Mining
be conducted.
child_d3a7c8a0fae741c7aac46af2f67d7bfd.title: unit2ii

child_3684146b91b042a49e755210435f9f30.content:
Specific goals such as “What are the common characteristics of the  customers 
we have lost to our competitors recently?” or “What are typical profiles of our customers, 
and how much value does each of them provide to us?” are needed.
child_3684146b91b042a49e755210435f9f30.title: unit2ii

child_95ddb8be1b444200875e42a926adaa73.content:
Then a project plan for 
finding such knowledge is developed that specifies the people responsible for collecting the 
data, analyzin
child_95ddb8be1b444200875e42a926adaa73.title: unit2ii

child_22d343a683334270aecb65ef1385eccc.content:
such knowledge is developed that specifies the people responsible for collecting the 
data, analyzing the data, and reporting the findings.
child_22d343a683334270aecb65ef1385eccc.title: unit2ii

child_a78bb65461d74e1ab1dea2806cd1ddd6.content:
At this early stage, a budget to support 
the study should also be established, at least at a high level with rough numbers.
child_a78bb65461d74e1ab1dea2806cd1ddd6.title: unit2ii

child_85c743c04be74c17abd1340db8b56ffa.content:
step 2: Data understanding
A data mining study is specific to addressing a well-defined business task, and  different 
business tasks require different sets of data.
child_85c743c04be74c17abd1340db8b56ffa.title: unit2ii

child_1192fa2a97424b2a8df3c2af4d1da4b0.content:
Following the business understanding, the 
main activity of the data mining process is to identify the relevant data from many  available 
databases.
child_1192fa2a97424b2a8df3c2af4d1da4b0.title: unit2ii

child_e2f24592d12d49a38e4e70bee0a8f9c3.content:
Some key points must be considered in the data identification and selection 
phase.
child_e2f24592d12d49a38e4e70bee0a8f9c3.title: unit2ii

child_043ad70912484c1991ec91852f67f502.content:
First and foremost, the analyst should be clear and concise about the description 
of the data mining task so that the most relevant data can be identified.
child_043ad70912484c1991ec91852f67f502.title: unit2ii

child_733f23cd17874190b24174db99952731.content:
For example, a 
retail data mining project may seek to identify spending behaviors of female shoppers 
who purchase seasonal clothes based on their demographics, credit card tran
child_733f23cd17874190b24174db99952731.title: unit2ii

child_fbc476ce92224ed5a7db0460503460d3.content:
iors of female shoppers 
who purchase seasonal clothes based on their demographics, credit card transactions, 
and socioeconomic attributes.
child_fbc476ce92224ed5a7db0460503460d3.title: unit2ii

child_ac5cfbe900f6438da89752a8405f6903.content:
Furthermore, the analyst should build an intimate under -
standing of the data sources (e.g., where the relevant data are stored and in what form; 
what the process of collecting the data is—automated versus manual; who the collectors 
of the data are and how often the data are updated) and the variables (e.g., What are the 
most	relevant	variables?
child_ac5cfbe900f6438da89752a8405f6903.title: unit2ii

child_46b85f31cc1d4be399d72d262a0287a6.content: Are	there	any	synonymous	and/or	homonymous	variables?
child_46b85f31cc1d4be399d72d262a0287a6.title: unit2ii

child_4920a383e9894f5a856da8f50fca24fd.content:
Are	
the variables independent of each other—do they stand as a complete information source 
without overlapping or conflicting information?).
child_4920a383e9894f5a856da8f50fca24fd.title: unit2ii

child_6eb0298264f446388a89267c919221e9.content:
In order to better understand the data, the analyst often uses a variety of  statistical 
and graphical techniques, such as simple statistical summaries of each variable (e.g., for 
numeric	variables	the	average,	minimum/maximum,	median,	and	standard	deviation	are	
among the calculated measures, whereas for c
child_6eb0298264f446388a89267c919221e9.title: unit2ii

child_66f04b1233444b6998ce8e8b3b6d2c6f.content:
e,	minimum/maximum,	median,	and	standard	deviation	are	
among the calculated measures, whereas for categorical variables the mode and  frequency 
tables are calculated), correlation analysis, scatterplots, histograms, and box plots.
child_66f04b1233444b6998ce8e8b3b6d2c6f.title: unit2ii

child_0c239da0ccbe4c089eca229bda0c98d2.content:
A care-
ful identification and selection of data sources and the most relevant variables can make it 
easier for data mining algorithms to quickly discover useful knowledge patterns.
child_0c239da0ccbe4c089eca229bda0c98d2.title: unit2ii

child_92307f949d664ac697154ed33b9d5149.content: Data sources for data selection can vary.
child_92307f949d664ac697154ed33b9d5149.title: unit2ii

child_380262b406db4a47940488706c8c57ca.content:
Normally, data sources for business appli-
cations include demographic data (such as income, education, number of households, 
and age), sociographic data (such as hobby, club membership, and entertainment), trans-
actional data (sales record, credit card spending, issued checks), and so on.
child_380262b406db4a47940488706c8c57ca.title: unit2ii

child_62aeb216fba440a0aaf7f6473c288079.content: Data can be categorized as quantitative and qualitative.
child_62aeb216fba440a0aaf7f6473c288079.title: unit2ii

child_4c9dd862238f40ae8f79202e25c772c8.content:
Quantitative data is measured 
using numeric values.
child_4c9dd862238f40ae8f79202e25c772c8.title: unit2ii

child_d770070288f44b279e535d4d26b8db9b.content:
It can be discrete (such as integers) or continuous (such as real num-
bers).
child_d770070288f44b279e535d4d26b8db9b.title: unit2ii

child_e8a30439cac945448b23390354d45dec.content: Qualitative data, also known as categorical data, contains bo
child_e8a30439cac945448b23390354d45dec.title: unit2ii

child_7d46960ad245467cb00c54869ff93079.content:
r continuous (such as real num-
bers).
child_7d46960ad245467cb00c54869ff93079.title: unit2ii

child_4645610ca34942cc9775892f9ced9083.content:
Qualitative data, also known as categorical data, contains both nominal and ordinal 
data.
child_4645610ca34942cc9775892f9ced9083.title: unit2ii

child_9042b9192e9840ef9f33543957c4330d.content:
Nominal data has finite nonordered values (e.g., gender data, which has two values: 
male and female).
child_9042b9192e9840ef9f33543957c4330d.title: unit2ii

child_b8cc3be5e3eb40a5a989c47f58b7a706.content: Ordinal data has finite ordered values.
child_b8cc3be5e3eb40a5a989c47f58b7a706.title: unit2ii

child_893d9f47d7b44d8a9cd821abb82e18c5.content:
For example, customer credit rat-
ings are considered ordinal data because the ratings can be excellent, fair, and bad.
child_893d9f47d7b44d8a9cd821abb82e18c5.title: unit2ii

child_1cf04699df6d406e8196512aebe821a0.content:
Quantitative data can be readily represented by some sort of probability distri -
bution.
child_1cf04699df6d406e8196512aebe821a0.title: unit2ii

child_0823c341491046fe86bdb28f34d6fe31.content: A probability distribution describes how the data is dispersed and shaped.
child_0823c341491046fe86bdb28f34d6fe31.title: unit2ii

child_7437760195d742a78abff09a325b7368.content:
For 
instance, normally distributed data is symmetric and is commonly referred to as being 
a bell-shaped curve.
child_7437760195d742a78abff09a325b7368.title: unit2ii

child_3607d56200d54908a1b00fb87e1489c4.content:
Qualitative data may be coded to numbers and then described by 
frequency distributions.
child_3607d56200d54908a1b00fb87e1489c4.title: unit2ii

child_92b4b9f1603448f4bbd676341096e6c7.content:
Once the relevant data are selected according to the data mining 
business objective, data preprocessing should be pursued.
child_92b4b9f1603448f4bbd676341096e6c7.title: unit2ii

child_9156b15ad0ed4956a13f5337b515c436.content:
step 3: Data preparation
The purpose of data preparation (more commonly called data preprocessing) is to take the 
d
child_9156b15ad0ed4956a13f5337b515c436.title: unit2ii

child_21cd33237fa843afbb2d3af9fd02bcb4.content:
paration
The purpose of data preparation (more commonly called data preprocessing) is to take the 
data identified in the previous step and prepare it for analysis by data mining  methods.
child_21cd33237fa843afbb2d3af9fd02bcb4.title: unit2ii

child_9c98c40ac2d942b7b98cd4df3e6e4d34.content:
Compared to the other steps in CRISP-DM, data preprocessing consumes the most time 
M04_SHAR4877_03_PIE_C04.indd   188 1/23/14   10:01 AM	 Chapter	4	 •	 Data	Mining 189
and effort; most believe that this step accounts for roughly 80 percent of the total time 
spent on a data mining project.
child_9c98c40ac2d942b7b98cd4df3e6e4d34.title: unit2ii

child_056dc2bad21d4f7a92e618428e6e4487.content:
The reason for such an enormous effort spent on this step 
is the fact that real-world data is generally incomplete (lacking attribute values, lacking 
certain attributes of interest, or containing only aggregate data), noisy (containing errors or 
outliers), and inconsistent (containing discrepancies in codes or names).
child_056dc2bad21d4f7a92e618428e6e4487.title: unit2ii

child_4203a2284c6549bdac1389beef27dc8e.content:
Figure 4.5 shows 
the four main steps needed to convert the raw real-world data into minable data sets.
child_4203a2284c6549bdac1389beef27dc8e.title: unit2ii

child_237b765d50124679b4a0366b5a0ffcb8.content:
In the first phase of data preprocessing, the relevant data is collected from the identi-
f
child_237b765d50124679b4a0366b5a0ffcb8.title: unit2ii

child_6d87f588695b45bea5f37f8d39df194f.content:
In the first phase of data preprocessing, the relevant data is collected from the identi-
fied sources (accomplished in the previous step—Data Understanding—of the CRISP-DM 
process), the necessary records and variables are selected (based on an intimate under -
standing of the data the unnecessary sections are filtered out), and the records coming 
from multiple data sources are integrated (again, using the intimate understanding of the 
data, the synonyms and homonyms are to be handled properly).
child_6d87f588695b45bea5f37f8d39df194f.title: unit2ii

child_90d3b3d50c134a548806109a848a8a25.content:
In the second phase of data preprocessing, the data is cleaned (this step is also 
known as data scrubbing).
child_90d3b3d50c134a548806109a848a8a25.title: unit2ii

child_d08c3dbacb234770b24e08eb6a49f1ce.content:
In this step, the values in the data set are identified and dealt 
with.
child_d08c3dbacb234770b24e08eb6a49f1ce.title: unit2ii

child_da935387ed8d4f6ba1660315098928f6.content:
In some cases, missing values are an anomaly in the data set, in which case they 
need to be imputed (filled with a most probable value) or ignored; in other cases, the 
missing values are a natural part of the data set (e.g., the household income field is often 
left unanswered by people who are in the
child_da935387ed8d4f6ba1660315098928f6.title: unit2ii

child_f34e36fc5d26467ebf1423e4b46dc9c4.content:
f the data set (e.g., the household income field is often 
left unanswered by people who are in the top income tier).
child_f34e36fc5d26467ebf1423e4b46dc9c4.title: unit2ii

child_17eaf24dbf1d455eb81fd6b038b98242.content:
In this step, the analyst 
should also identify noisy values in the data (i.e., the outliers) and smooth them out.
child_17eaf24dbf1d455eb81fd6b038b98242.title: unit2ii

child_2ac91cb9d91044beae44c9b1057d31d1.content:
Additionally, inconsistencies (unusual values within a variable) in the data should be 
handled	using	domain	knowledge	and/or	expert	opinion.
child_2ac91cb9d91044beae44c9b1057d31d1.title: unit2ii

child_754286e76fbd47448796a14d5c8de57b.content: In the third phase of data preprocessing, the data is transformed for better  processing.
child_754286e76fbd47448796a14d5c8de57b.title: unit2ii

child_d093c6f12a904354b2350dc4960e51e6.content:
For instance, in many cases the data is normalized between a certain minimum and maxi-
mum for all variables in order to mitigate the potential bias of one variable (having large 
numeric values, such as for household income) dominating other variables (such as number 
Data Consolidation

• Discretize/aggregate d
child_d093c6f12a904354b2350dc4960e51e6.title: unit2ii

child_84e9585a1bdf4192b3da55fd325097ff.content:
values
• Reduce noise in data
• Eliminate inconsistencies
• Normalize data
