• Reduce number of variables
• Reduce number of cases
• Balance skewed data
Figure 4.5 Data Preprocessing Steps.
child_84e9585a1bdf4192b3da55fd325097ff.title: unit2ii

child_d4a075d6088646a6a5896ff26d6ff535.content:
M04_SHAR4877_03_PIE_C04.indd   189 1/23/14   10:01 AM190	 Chapter 	4	 •	 Data	Mining
of dependents or years in service, which may potentially be more important) having smaller 
values.
child_d4a075d6088646a6a5896ff26d6ff535.title: unit2ii

child_c40abfc934eb47b488db8459947b5cda.content: Another	transformation	that	takes	place	is	discretization	and/or	aggregation.
child_c40abfc934eb47b488db8459947b5cda.title: unit2ii

child_d12ffc7ff7d44f7086e06a69237e21a6.content:
In	some	
cases, the numeric variables are converted to categorical values (e.g., low, medium, high); 
in other cases a nominal variable’s unique value range is reduced to a smaller set using 
concept hierarchies (e.g., as opposed to using the individual states with 50 different values, 
one may choose to use several regions for a variable that shows location) in order to have 
a data set that is more amenable to computer processing.
child_d12ffc7ff7d44f7086e06a69237e21a6.title: unit2ii

child_f83755593d7f49c88565684a0a80f8aa.content:
Still, in other cases one might 
choose to create new va
child_f83755593d7f49c88565684a0a80f8aa.title: unit2ii

child_c06aaa294ff74c90a5e9dac3dc801b87.content: at is more amenable to computer processing.
child_c06aaa294ff74c90a5e9dac3dc801b87.title: unit2ii

child_4f909f0bd07c41938f44d0580d8c9fbd.content:
Still, in other cases one might 
choose to create new variables based on the existing ones in order to magnify the informa-
tion found in a collection of variables in the data set.
child_4f909f0bd07c41938f44d0580d8c9fbd.title: unit2ii

child_08bc54301eaf47ec98c6af04a5d8c55c.content:
For instance, in an organ transplan-
tation data set one might choose to use a single variable showing the blood-type match  
(1: match, 0: no-match) as opposed to separate multinominal values for the blood type of 
both the donor and the recipient.
child_08bc54301eaf47ec98c6af04a5d8c55c.title: unit2ii

child_775e833b12f14f409109882deb4f8e1c.content:
Such simplification may increase the information content 
while reducing the complexity of the relationships in the data.
child_775e833b12f14f409109882deb4f8e1c.title: unit2ii

child_a9af5a75d5344177b247b5f4c4a17117.content: The final phase of data preprocessing is data reduction.
child_a9af5a75d5344177b247b5f4c4a17117.title: unit2ii

child_359509e71c3844968ef5d683f277e796.content:
Even though data miners like 
to have large data sets, too much data is also a problem.
child_359509e71c3844968ef5d683f277e796.title: unit2ii

child_36466dca517b41b09768b541f1513e37.content:
In the simplest sense, one can 
visualize the data commonly used in data mining projects as a flat file consisting of two 
dimensions:	variables	(the	number	of	columns)	and	cases/records	(the	number	of	rows).
child_36466dca517b41b09768b541f1513e37.title: unit2ii

child_5b0cd3d4923243a69cf57cadcaaa71bc.content:
In	
some cases (e.g., image processing and genome
child_5b0cd3d4923243a69cf57cadcaaa71bc.title: unit2ii

child_05c1619417f946138eba5c693c628858.content: f	columns)	and	cases/records	(the	number	of	rows).
child_05c1619417f946138eba5c693c628858.title: unit2ii

child_71ab67f2fa5f4d4eb91202f4216a86d1.content:
In	
some cases (e.g., image processing and genome projects with complex microarray data), 
the number of variables can be rather large, and the analyst must reduce the number down 
to a manageable size.
child_71ab67f2fa5f4d4eb91202f4216a86d1.title: unit2ii

child_fc7229d5f50c4210a16dcf8cea972d67.content:
Because the variables are treated as different dimensions that describe 
the phenomenon from different perspectives, in data mining this process is commonly 
called dimensional reduction.
child_fc7229d5f50c4210a16dcf8cea972d67.title: unit2ii

child_2269d100a3d441859805b51dfd3c9f0a.content:
Even though there is not a single best way to accomplish this 
task, one can use the findings from previously published literature; consult domain experts; 
run appropriate statistical tests (e.g., principal component analysis or independent compo-
nent analysis); and, more preferably, use a combination of these techniques to successfully 
reduce the dimensions in the data into a more manageable and most relevant subset.
child_2269d100a3d441859805b51dfd3c9f0a.title: unit2ii

child_5f8b8f8c1952442ab66a25466c356c01.content:
With respect to the other dimension (i.e., the number of cases), some data sets may 
include millions or billions of records.
child_5f8b8f8c1952442ab66a25466c356c01.title: unit2ii

child_750eae42664048b0ab7dcbdccc518883.content:
on (i.e., the number of cases), some data sets may 
include millions or billions of records.
child_750eae42664048b0ab7dcbdccc518883.title: unit2ii

child_2fe3f81a5ab645d78e634227b79f5163.content:
Even though computing power is increasing expo-
nentially, processing such a large number of records may not be practical or feasible.
child_2fe3f81a5ab645d78e634227b79f5163.title: unit2ii

child_e469363c62ab49a98e4f068f576e6d0c.content:
In such 
cases, one may need to sample a subset of the data for analysis.
child_e469363c62ab49a98e4f068f576e6d0c.title: unit2ii

child_48584c76efa44136ac1a5b589f24642f.content:
The underlying assumption 
of sampling is that the subset of the data will contain all relevant patterns of the complete 
data set.
child_48584c76efa44136ac1a5b589f24642f.title: unit2ii

child_25c61873f3da432a9047b22f992a7de7.content:
In a homogenous data set, such an assumption may hold well, but real-world data 
is hardly ever homogenous.
child_25c61873f3da432a9047b22f992a7de7.title: unit2ii

child_af8631ac6cd94ae1940ed9d0ffa7be77.content:
The analyst should be extremely careful in selecting a subset of 
the data that reflects the essence of the complete data set and is not specific to a subgroup 
or subcategory.
child_af8631ac6cd94ae1940ed9d0ffa7be77.title: unit2ii

child_e67d71e73b1c48548bb17abe6ca0254a.content:
The data is usually sorted on some variable, and taking a section of the 
data from the top or bottom may lead to a biased data set on specific values of the indexed 
variable; therefore, one should always try to randomly select the records on the sample 
set.
child_e67d71e73b1c48548bb17abe6ca0254a.title: unit2ii

child_d0c555a9fea84970a80b397df87ebf7d.content:
efore, one should always try to randomly select the records on the sample 
set.
child_d0c555a9fea84970a80b397df87ebf7d.title: unit2ii

child_c5f4d229b3734aef8e8c59a40db9c719.content:
For skewed data, straightforward random sampling may not be sufficient, and stratified 
sampling (a proportional representation of different subgroups in the data is represented in 
the sample data set) may be required.
child_c5f4d229b3734aef8e8c59a40db9c719.title: unit2ii

child_6dc5b7794e1f4b8c8bb17c97c2b09604.content:
Speaking of skewed data: It is a good practice to bal-
ance the highly skewed data by either oversampling the less represented or undersampling 
the more represented classes.
child_6dc5b7794e1f4b8c8bb17c97c2b09604.title: unit2ii

child_109e3a8a04194f81bd730fe356580425.content:
Research has shown that balanced data sets tend to produce 
 better prediction models than unbalanced ones (Wilson and Sharda, 1994).
child_109e3a8a04194f81bd730fe356580425.title: unit2ii

child_a1eed2f6e30b484a859bc4bcba08fa35.content:
The essence of data preprocessing is summarized in Table 4.1, which maps the main 
phases (along with their problem descriptions) to a representative list of tasks and algorithms.
child_a1eed2f6e30b484a859bc4bcba08fa35.title: unit2ii

child_cc10a09180714c1a9c774d9d8d8238d5.content:
step 4: Model Building
In this step, various modeling techniques are selected and applied to an already pre -
pared data set in order to address the specific business need.
child_cc10a09180714c1a9c774d9d8d8238d5.title: unit2ii

child_9966ee95507d416fbbcc329259c7737b.content: ared data set in order to address the specific business need.
child_9966ee95507d416fbbcc329259c7737b.title: unit2ii

child_e3aee0df0cbe4b649718127b51fd5a99.content:
The model-building step 
also encompasses the assessment and comparative analysis of the various models built.
child_e3aee0df0cbe4b649718127b51fd5a99.title: unit2ii

child_07ec2ff167544879af118a70b95f9a7c.content:
Because there is not a universally known best method or algorithm for a data mining task, 
M04_SHAR4877_03_PIE_C04.indd   190 1/23/14   10:01 AM	 Chapter	4	 •	 Data	Mining 191
taBle 4.1 A Summary of Data Preprocessing Tasks and Potential Methods
Main Task Subtasks Popular Methods
Data consolidation Access and collect the data SQL queries, software agents, Web 
services.
child_07ec2ff167544879af118a70b95f9a7c.title: unit2ii

child_a10a3369bfbc406bbdb4b2ad66011039.content:
Select and filter the data Domain expertise, SQL queries, statistical 
tests.
child_a10a3369bfbc406bbdb4b2ad66011039.title: unit2ii

child_313202574f88447fb7495990ddd84558.content:
Integrate and unify the 
data
SQL queries, domain expertise, ontology-
driven data mapping.
child_313202574f88447fb7495990ddd84558.title: unit2ii

child_e7020086e8db4f78af68e30372c7dfd3.content:
Data cleaning Handle missing values in 
the data
Fill in missing values (imputations) with 
most appropriate values (mean, median, 
min/max, mode, etc.); recode the  missing 
values with a constant such as “ML”; 
 remove the record of the missing value; do 
nothing.
child_e7020086e8db4f78af68e30372c7dfd3.title: unit2ii

child_a739e8a7490746e29962539d695a123f.title: unit2ii

child_64fca45219b241cca92079513747f451.content:
Identify and reduce noise in 
the data
Identify the outliers in data with simple 
statistical techniques (such as averages 
and standard deviations) or with cluster 
analysis; once identified, either remove the 
outliers or smooth them by using binning, 
regression, or simple averages.
child_64fca45219b241cca92079513747f451.title: unit2ii

child_5e58b617555840e982879d58ef4c2373.content:
Find and eliminate errone-
ous data
Identify the erroneous values in data (other 
than outliers), such as odd values, incon-
sistent class labels, odd distributions; once 
identified, use domain expertise to correct 
the values or remove the records holding 
the erroneous values.
child_5e58b617555840e982879d58ef4c2373.title: unit2ii

child_e44bf7727e644acea117aece470da7a1.content:
Data transformation Normalize the data Reduce the range of values in each numer-
ically valued variable to a standard range 
(e.g., 0 to 1 or –1 to +1) by using a variety 
of normalization or scaling techniques.
child_e44bf7727e644acea117aece470da7a1.title: unit2ii

child_96c79717f58448b8a6309c39db4f889f.content:
Discretize or aggregate the 
data
If needed, convert the numeric variables 
into discrete representations using range- 
or frequency-bas
child_96c79717f58448b8a6309c39db4f889f.title: unit2ii

child_1e055a95c0094f9481c99ba8b6c03f60.content:
needed, convert the numeric variables 
into discrete representations using range- 
or frequency-based binning techniques; 
for categorical variables, reduce the num-
ber of values by applying proper concept 
hierarchies.
child_1e055a95c0094f9481c99ba8b6c03f60.title: unit2ii

child_2642827ad5b34d918c5b7d55cd74e837.content:
Construct new attributes Derive new and more informative vari-
ables from the existing ones using a wide 
range of mathematical functions (as 
simple as addition and multiplication or as 
complex as a hybrid combination of log 
transformations).
child_2642827ad5b34d918c5b7d55cd74e837.title: unit2ii

child_46ab0f4242c945f1a6fc8565366ab483.content:
Data reduction Reduce number of 
attributes
Principal component analysis, independent 
component analysis, Chi-square testing, 
correlation analysis, and decision tree 
induction.
child_46ab0f4242c945f1a6fc8565366ab483.title: unit2ii

child_30449471a631476e8615a8174acd6927.content:
Reduce number of records Random sampling, stratified sampling, 
expert–knowledge-driven purposeful 
sampling.
child_30449471a631476e8615a8174acd6927.title: unit2ii

child_15899b370224482592b66ee7c9694f67.content:
Balance skewed data Oversample the less represented or under-
sample the more represented classes.
child_15899b370224482592b66ee7c9694f67.title: unit2ii

child_097f244f5dd143aa9639f458c84862b7.content:
M04_SHAR4877_03_PIE_C04.indd   191 1/23/14   10:01 AM192	 Chapter 	4	 •	 Data	Mining
one should use a variety of viable model types along with
child_097f244f5dd143aa9639f458c84862b7.title: unit2ii

child_e1db6e5cd1254ac6bf42c00ffea0e3c9.content:
10:01 AM192	 Chapter 	4	 •	 Data	Mining
one should use a variety of viable model types along with a well-defined experimenta -
tion and assessment strategy to identify the “best” method for a given purpose.
child_e1db6e5cd1254ac6bf42c00ffea0e3c9.title: unit2ii

child_5a2f1073fe364d4ea23bd37d457e2faa.content:
Even for 
a single method or algorithm, a number of parameters need to be calibrated to obtain 
optimal results.
child_5a2f1073fe364d4ea23bd37d457e2faa.title: unit2ii

child_8f9c0a869a3e428799dbc42b5777e393.content:
Some methods may have specific requirements on the way that the data 
is to be formatted; thus, stepping back to the data preparation step is often necessary.
child_8f9c0a869a3e428799dbc42b5777e393.title: unit2ii

child_d1722a9e652448de8f3dc16ccbbc7810.content:
Application Case 4.4 presents a research study where a number of model types are devel-
oped and compared to each other.
child_d1722a9e652448de8f3dc16ccbbc7810.title: unit2ii

child_d9abfe5c29ea4f71b447ef4a12db146e.content:
Depending on the business need, the data mining task can be of a prediction (either 
classification or regression), an association, or a clustering type.
child_d9abfe5c29ea4f71b447ef4a12db146e.title: unit2ii

child_7418d0208aa244429272dc9380bfba49.content:
Each of these data mining 
tasks can use a variety of data mining methods and algorithms.
child_7418d0208aa244429272dc9380bfba49.title: unit2ii

child_45d2ead391d143b086c82d01d94e14fb.content:
Some of these data mining 
methods were explained earlier in this chapter, and some of the most popular algorithms, 
including decision trees for classif
child_45d2ead391d143b086c82d01d94e14fb.title: unit2ii

child_4975747a7d874f7bbf5c57e1636abd77.content:
lier in this chapter, and some of the most popular algorithms, 
including decision trees for classification, k-means for clustering, and the Apriori algo -
rithm for association rule mining, are described later in this chapter.
child_4975747a7d874f7bbf5c57e1636abd77.title: unit2ii

child_1500f206f9844b009402d58599234521.content:
step 5: testing and evaluation
In step 5, the developed models are assessed and evaluated for their accuracy and gen -
erality.
child_1500f206f9844b009402d58599234521.title: unit2ii

child_6418be68dfcc4b51966cc521deb96bf1.content:
This step assesses the degree to which the selected model (or models) meets the 
business objectives and, if so, to what extent (i.e., do more models need to be developed 
and assessed).
child_6418be68dfcc4b51966cc521deb96bf1.title: unit2ii

child_d410768479664ad086920e7b92211c3c.content:
Another option is to test the developed model(s) in a real-world scenario 
if time and budget constraints permit.
child_d410768479664ad086920e7b92211c3c.title: unit2ii

child_f9474b21e5de4ddd94f5dc4e3b5472dc.content:
Even though the outcome of the developed models 
is expected to relate to the original business objectives, other findings that are not nec -
essarily related to the original business objectives but that might also unveil additional 
information or hints for future directions often are discovered.
child_f9474b21e5de4ddd94f5dc4e3b5472dc.title: unit2ii

child_4ec4b8f577134cdf8eb813ea136c73a5.content: The testing and evaluation step is a critica
child_4ec4b8f577134cdf8eb813ea136c73a5.title: unit2ii

child_c34c2bfc928a4f6186066c7c3af53375.content: on or hints for future directions often are discovered.
child_c34c2bfc928a4f6186066c7c3af53375.title: unit2ii

child_eff741b73ae243a0addfbf0c16bf8c8f.content: The testing and evaluation step is a critical and challenging task.
child_eff741b73ae243a0addfbf0c16bf8c8f.title: unit2ii

child_8512d1a6beef47478524cfbe8e73ea21.content:
No value is added by 
the data mining task until the business value obtained from discovered knowledge patterns 
is identified and recognized.
child_8512d1a6beef47478524cfbe8e73ea21.title: unit2ii

child_0c55913cf40540e0acd5947b15498eb8.content:
Determining the business value from discovered knowledge 
patterns is somewhat similar to playing with puzzles.
child_0c55913cf40540e0acd5947b15498eb8.title: unit2ii

child_acc10ed1198b43d5b63adab0ee1d1851.content:
The extracted knowledge patterns 
are pieces of the puzzle that need to be put together in the context of the specific business 
purpose.
child_acc10ed1198b43d5b63adab0ee1d1851.title: unit2ii

child_59f25dedfae441a0b29471053900a759.content:
The success of this identification operation depends on the interaction among 
data analysts, business analysts, and decision makers (such as business managers).
child_59f25dedfae441a0b29471053900a759.title: unit2ii

child_560cfa8842d94c7bb35cc9fc06516f5b.content:
Because 
data analysts may not have the full understanding of the data mining objectives and what 
they mean to the business and the business analysts and decision makers may not have 
the technical knowledge to interpret the results of sophisticated mathematical solutions, 
interaction among them is necessary.
child_560cfa8842d94c7bb35cc9fc06516f5b.title: unit2ii

child_801e6c7b0fdf48e7b1cb4a5988d8117c.content:
the results of sophisticated mathematical solutions, 
interaction among them is necessary.
child_801e6c7b0fdf48e7b1cb4a5988d8117c.title: unit2ii

child_64b6e862049f4f9b97097b5bfd3fd025.content:
In order to properly interpret knowledge patterns, it is 
often necessary to use a variety of tabulation and visualization techniques (e.g., pivot tables, 
cross-tabulation of findings, pie charts, histograms, box plots, scatterplots).
child_64b6e862049f4f9b97097b5bfd3fd025.title: unit2ii

child_ba20fcb2402048bf8e5bf45a254892a7.content:
step 6: Deployment
Development and assessment of the models is not the end of the data mining project.
child_ba20fcb2402048bf8e5bf45a254892a7.title: unit2ii

child_5755cd05927b4e2b887730bcb5ced04d.content:
Even if 
the purpose of the model is to have a simple exploration of the data, the knowledge gained 
from such exploration will need to be organized and presented in a way that the end user 
can understand and benefit from.
child_5755cd05927b4e2b887730bcb5ced04d.title: unit2ii

child_a594a8502d924e03b994bac5aebb8a7b.content:
Depending on the requirements, the deployment phase 
can be as simple as generating a report or as complex as implementing a repeatable data 
mining process across the enterprise.
child_a594a8502d924e03b994bac5aebb8a7b.title: unit2ii

child_061bd65337d04f458d7fd900e6be2ac2.content:
In many cases, it is the customer, not the data analyst, 
who carries out the deployment steps.
child_061bd65337d04f458d7fd900e6be2ac2.title: unit2ii

child_373c9f67c2aa41198e1871bb836c3f64.content:
However, even if the analyst will not carry out the 
deployment effor
child_373c9f67c2aa41198e1871bb836c3f64.title: unit2ii

child_03741f860c4c455d9cb0cb82929c3f5a.content:
However, even if the analyst will not carry out the 
deployment effort, it is important for the customer to understand up front what actions need 
to be carried out in order to actually make use of the created models.
child_03741f860c4c455d9cb0cb82929c3f5a.title: unit2ii

child_cdc72b5142b3484ab29688fd2af03719.content:
The deployment step may also include maintenance activities for the deployed 
 models.
child_cdc72b5142b3484ab29688fd2af03719.title: unit2ii

child_fc399b298ab6410b98bb0c924a4dea95.content:
Because everything about the business is constantly changing, the data that reflect 
the business activities also are changing.
child_fc399b298ab6410b98bb0c924a4dea95.title: unit2ii

child_71fa8cb15f1d438d876e9c953fc56e8d.content:
Over time, the models (and the patterns  embedded 
within them) built on the old data may become obsolete, irrelevant, or misleading.
child_71fa8cb15f1d438d876e9c953fc56e8d.title: unit2ii

child_4b8971bd19304bd2a477503ed4d63d72.content:
M04_SHAR4877_03_PIE_C04.indd   192 1/23/14   10:01 AM	 Chapter	4	 •	 Data	Mining 193
Therefore,  monitoring and maintenance of the models are important if the data mining 
results are to become a part of the day-to-day business and its environment.
child_4b8971bd19304bd2a477503ed4d63d72.title: unit2ii

child_cbde7a39e85a4f83812398461a931ed9.content:
A careful 
 preparation of a  maintenance strategy helps to avoid unnecessarily long periods of  incorrect 
usage of data mining results.
child_cbde7a39e85a4f83812398461a931ed9.title: unit2ii

child_3e4f745fb4174ace951371e9f477d48d.content:
elps to avoid unnecessarily long periods of  incorrect 
usage of data mining results.
child_3e4f745fb4174ace951371e9f477d48d.title: unit2ii

child_73170b78ac374e2ea61e80f10d477506.content:
In order to monitor the deployment of the data mining result(s), 
the project needs a detailed plan on the monitoring process, which may not be a trivial task 
for complex data mining models.
child_73170b78ac374e2ea61e80f10d477506.title: unit2ii

child_dfb4a14ce48147a1b0ea41ee6f3fa135.content:
Application Case 4.4
Data Mining in Cancer Research
According to the American Cancer Society, half of 
all men and one-third of all women in the United 
States will develop cancer during their lifetimes; 
approximately 1.5 million new cancer cases will 
be  diagnosed in 2013.
child_dfb4a14ce48147a1b0ea41ee6f3fa135.title: unit2ii

child_d73eeb0b2142459cad9a91647d94a37f.content:
Cancer is the second most 
 common cause of death in the United States and in 
the world, exceeded only by cardiovascular disease.
child_d73eeb0b2142459cad9a91647d94a37f.title: unit2ii

child_2114b3e9ef66432684b90b847426c876.content:
This year, over 500,000 Americans are expected to 
die of  cancer—more than 1,300 people a day—
accounting for nearly 1 of every 4 deaths.
child_2114b3e9ef66432684b90b847426c876.title: unit2ii

child_fc19437a0c7a4f71b5c87281909b9066.content:
Cancer is a group of diseases generally char -
acterized by uncontrolled growth and spread of 
abnormal	cells.
child_fc19437a0c7a4f71b5c87281909b9066.title: unit2ii

child_bea8bb34d74249a8acfa11cdb7b542c2.content:
If	the	growth	and/or	spread	are	not	
controlled, it can result
child_bea8bb34d74249a8acfa11cdb7b542c2.title: unit2ii

child_48b99e6c748a43dd9dedd41ec9b1a161.content:
rowth and spread of 
abnormal	cells.
child_48b99e6c748a43dd9dedd41ec9b1a161.title: unit2ii

child_d72f96c392ab41d48aba2683fa4797c2.content:
If	the	growth	and/or	spread	are	not	
controlled, it can result in death.
child_d72f96c392ab41d48aba2683fa4797c2.title: unit2ii

child_2d6fc2e81fc34f1eac05ea0d6e43ef93.content:
Even though the 
exact reasons are not known, cancer is believed to 
be caused by both external factors (e.g., tobacco, 
infectious organisms, chemicals, and radiation) and 
internal factors (e.g., inherited mutations, hormones, 
immune conditions, and mutations that occur from 
metabolism).
child_2d6fc2e81fc34f1eac05ea0d6e43ef93.title: unit2ii

child_1e33504231824341bf1718492d9843e5.content:
These causal factors may act together 
or in sequence to initiate or promote carcinogenesis.
child_1e33504231824341bf1718492d9843e5.title: unit2ii

child_5477927c91e449678486841d0e5f0e49.content:
Cancer is treated with surgery, radiation, chemo -
therapy, hormone therapy, biological therapy, and 
targeted therapy.
child_5477927c91e449678486841d0e5f0e49.title: unit2ii

child_026d9c362b5441b69e6babab2952866f.content:
Survival statistics vary greatly by 
cancer type and stage at diagnosis.
child_026d9c362b5441b69e6babab2952866f.title: unit2ii

child_9fea098a370e4b3aaee8de607f4e740e.content:
The 5-year relative survival rate for all can -
cers is improving, and decline in cancer mortality 
has reached 20 percent in 2013, translating into the 
avoidance of about 1.2 million deaths from cancer 
since 1991.
child_9fea098a370e4b3aaee8de607f4e740e.title: unit2ii

child_9adc13003d4f4af49a8ed1da5dfc611a.content:
That’s more than 400 lives saved per 
day! The improvement in survival reflects progress 
in
child_9adc13003d4f4af49a8ed1da5dfc611a.title: unit2ii

child_3d41a33383844bf18cc8e6063f9a5fbf.content:
That’s more than 400 lives saved per 
day! The improvement in survival reflects progress 
in diagnosing certain cancers at an earlier stage and 
improvements in treatment.
child_3d41a33383844bf18cc8e6063f9a5fbf.title: unit2ii

child_a5561a2a3e4c4d62b2a1fd7111c23b11.content:
Further improvements 
are needed to prevent and treat cancer.
child_a5561a2a3e4c4d62b2a1fd7111c23b11.title: unit2ii

child_ae5d29d084024d08a428bd7ac0f5cf31.content:
Even though cancer research has traditionally 
been clinical and biological in nature, in recent years 
data-driven analytic studies have become a common 
complement.
child_ae5d29d084024d08a428bd7ac0f5cf31.title: unit2ii

child_e34037c783bd4007898f606e14463f1e.content:
In medical domains where data- and 
analytics-driven research have been applied suc -
cessfully, novel research directions have been iden -
tified to further advance the clinical and biologi -
cal studies.
child_e34037c783bd4007898f606e14463f1e.title: unit2ii

child_e0d213be7c314dc2b923b5d24b6faf0a.content:
Using various types of data, including 
molecular, clinical, literature-based, and clinical-
trial data, along with suitable data mining tools and 
techniques, researchers have been able to identify 
novel patterns, paving the road toward a cancer-free 
society.
child_e0d213be7c314dc2b923b5d24b6faf0a.title: unit2ii

child_2ca3f3ce95544d5e95c69985c191419b.content:
In one study, Delen (2009) used three  popular 
data mining techniques (decision trees, artificial  neural 
networks, and s
child_2ca3f3ce95544d5e95c69985c191419b.title: unit2ii

child_da059ce0bf194c9ba23b385eab96f6ad.content:
09) used three  popular 
data mining techniques (decision trees, artificial  neural 
networks, and support vector machines) in conjunc-
tion with logistic regression to develop  prediction 
models for prostate cancer  survivability.
child_da059ce0bf194c9ba23b385eab96f6ad.title: unit2ii

child_379c99278f524d52bfa3b0e447140bf8.content:
The data set 
contained around 120,000 records and 77 variables.
child_379c99278f524d52bfa3b0e447140bf8.title: unit2ii

child_eac7a56e39874cf6b4aeabf8eef5eb22.content:
A k-fold cross-validation  methodology was used in 
model building, evaluation, and  comparison.
child_eac7a56e39874cf6b4aeabf8eef5eb22.title: unit2ii

child_f9df63bff3474ecf987b839824bb5956.content:
The 
results showed that support  vector models are the 
most accurate predictor (with a test set  accuracy 
of 92.85%) for this domain, followed by artificial 
 neural networks and decision trees.
child_f9df63bff3474ecf987b839824bb5956.title: unit2ii

child_d65d6978140d4d1bbb30e23f9d6213cf.content:
Furthermore, 
using a sensitivity–analysis-based  evaluation method, 
the study also revealed novel patterns related to 
 prognostic factors of prostate cancer.
child_d65d6978140d4d1bbb30e23f9d6213cf.title: unit2ii

child_a4b15b9f1b8648dcb496fac8816694b2.content: In a related study, Delen et al.
child_a4b15b9f1b8648dcb496fac8816694b2.title: unit2ii

child_30a9c3b56e434f04a74d3a593c856c3c.content:
(2004) used 
two data mining algorithms (artificial neural net -
works and decision trees) and logistic regression to 
develop prediction models for breast cancer survival 
using a large data set (more than 200,0
child_30a9c3b56e434f04a74d3a593c856c3c.title: unit2ii

child_1029103401604e898588f07b2771b76c.content:
on to 
develop prediction models for breast cancer survival 
using a large data set (more than 200,000 cases).
child_1029103401604e898588f07b2771b76c.title: unit2ii

child_aa20a491bd49447899c785ef540b32bb.content:
Using a 10-fold cross-validation method to mea -
sure the unbiased estimate of the prediction models 
for performance comparison purposes, the results 
indicated that the decision tree (C5 algorithm) was 
the best predictor, with 93.6 percent accuracy on 
the holdout sample (which was the best prediction 
accuracy reported in the literature); followed by 
(Continued )
M04_SHAR4877_03_PIE_C04.indd   193 1/23/14   10:01 AM194	 Chapter 	4	 •	 Data	Mining
Application Case 4.4 (Continued)
artificial neural networks, with 91.2 percent accu -
racy; and logistic regression, with 89.2 percent accu-
racy.
child_aa20a491bd49447899c785ef540b32bb.title: unit2ii

child_b2c3f4a6ae744baea2cf8b5314dbd92e.content:
Further analysis of prediction models revealed 
 prioritized importance of the prognostic factors, 
which can then be used as basis for further clinical 
and biological research studies.
child_b2c3f4a6ae744baea2cf8b5314dbd92e.title: unit2ii

child_b1b2f2fd4f4346abb1034d1fc00ce569.content:
These examples (among many others in the 
medical literature) show that advanced data min -
ing te
child_b1b2f2fd4f4346abb1034d1fc00ce569.title: unit2ii

child_89491020a5c347029ec1d2e2368377e7.content:
These examples (among many others in the 
medical literature) show that advanced data min -
ing techniques can be used to develop models 
that  possess a high degree of predictive as well as 
explanatory power.
child_89491020a5c347029ec1d2e2368377e7.title: unit2ii

child_5b39a052ffdf45b88198fb81e37b93e3.content:
Although data mining methods 
are capable of extracting patterns and relationships 
hidden deep in large and complex medical data -
bases, without the cooperation and feedback from 
the medical experts their results are not of much 
use.
child_5b39a052ffdf45b88198fb81e37b93e3.title: unit2ii

child_408d336d5f0b410dbb03214ca66843ad.content:
The patterns found via data mining methods 
should be evaluated by medical professionals who 
have years of experience in the problem domain 
to decide whether they are logical, actionable, and 
novel to warrant new research directions.
child_408d336d5f0b410dbb03214ca66843ad.title: unit2ii

child_a5c653ef113a472fa012eec32b358bc5.content:
In short, 
data mining is not meant to replace medical pro -
fessionals and researchers, but to complement 
their invaluable efforts to provide data-driven new 
research directions and to ultimately save more 
human lives.
child_a5c653ef113a472fa012eec32b358bc5.title: unit2ii

child_f3545eb7ef6e4e688a02e0897edb72aa.content:
How can data mining be used for ultimately cur-
ing illnesse
child_f3545eb7ef6e4e688a02e0897edb72aa.title: unit2ii

child_18cad92df9214d63b010f6084ca67a46.content:
How can data mining be used for ultimately cur-
ing illnesses like cancer?
child_18cad92df9214d63b010f6084ca67a46.title: unit2ii

child_67e7d70a575244f7b8e9dd9673ac767e.content:
What do you think are the promises and major 
challenges for data miners in contributing to 
medical and biological research endeavors?
child_67e7d70a575244f7b8e9dd9673ac767e.title: unit2ii

child_0f2955c81c1e4bee9789d98e5cf56edb.content:
Delen, “Analysis of Cancer Data: A Data Mining 
Approach,” Expert Systems, Vol.
child_0f2955c81c1e4bee9789d98e5cf56edb.title: unit2ii

child_e4919af2f1884212bc6ea2efb1e6d65e.content:
Huang, “Toward Breast 
Cancer Survivability Prediction Models Through Improving Training 
Space,” Expert Systems with Applications, 2009, in press; D.
child_e4919af2f1884212bc6ea2efb1e6d65e.title: unit2ii

child_3d06e6151bd44fd8ab55a9dbfd423246.content:
Kadam, “Predicting Breast Cancer Survivability: A 
Comparison of Three Data Mining Methods,” Artificial Intelligence 
in Medicine, Vol.
child_3d06e6151bd44fd8ab55a9dbfd423246.title: unit2ii

child_19cefa4a5f394ea9a6ee67fc0af9e1f5.content:
other Data Mining standardized processes and Methodologies
In order to be applied successfully, a data mining study must be viewed as a process 
that follows a standardized methodology rather than as a set of automated software tools 
and te
child_19cefa4a5f394ea9a6ee67fc0af9e1f5.title: unit2ii

child_4b95d9e2cb2a42959af46d9772866897.content:
ss 
that follows a standardized methodology rather than as a set of automated software tools 
and techniques.
child_4b95d9e2cb2a42959af46d9772866897.title: unit2ii

child_89251c2b50504edf8fa15d085fad51af.content:
In addition to CRISP-DM, there is another well-known methodology 
developed by the SAS Institute, called SEMMA (2009).
child_89251c2b50504edf8fa15d085fad51af.title: unit2ii

child_28b37e00ffa744a9a1ce0f8e1f0aa82f.content:
The acronym semma stands for 
“sample, explore, modify, model, and assess.”
Beginning with a statistically representative sample of the data, SEMMA makes it 
easy to apply exploratory statistical and visualization techniques, select and transform 
the most significant predictive variables, model the variables to predict outcomes, and 
confirm a model’s accuracy.
child_28b37e00ffa744a9a1ce0f8e1f0aa82f.title: unit2ii

child_56c81c4a6ad749f59f11394d0201e28b.content:
A pictorial representation of SEMMA is given in Figure 4.6.
By assessing the outcome of each stage in the SEMMA process, the model devel -
oper can determine how to model new questions raised by the previous results, and 
thus proceed back to the exploration phase for additional refinement of the data; that 
is, as with CRISP-DM, SEMMA is driven by a highly iterative experimentation cycle.
child_56c81c4a6ad749f59f11394d0201e28b.title: unit2ii

child_d8440d441bf347ca9c45822d606e2151.content:
at 
is, as with CRISP-DM, SEMMA is driven by a highly iterative experimentation cycle.
child_d8440d441bf347ca9c45822d606e2151.title: unit2ii

child_eb542b4fcca94819a33c26e98f242640.content:
The 
main difference between CRISP-DM and SEMMA is that CRISP-DM takes a more compre-
hensive approach—including understanding of the business and the relevant data—to 
data mining projects, whereas SEMMA implicitly assumes that the data mining project’s 
goals and objectives along with the appropriate data sources have been identified and 
understood.
child_eb542b4fcca94819a33c26e98f242640.title: unit2ii

child_4fd935273ba24c618e68ba6a3446222e.content:
Some practitioners commonly use the term knowledge discovery in databases 
(kdd) as a synonym for data mining.
child_4fd935273ba24c618e68ba6a3446222e.title: unit2ii

child_8c88b961ab4e47ab916fda441a4cda5a.content:
(1996) defined knowledge discovery 
in databases as a process of using data mining methods to find useful information and 
patterns in the data, as opposed to data mining, which involves using algorithms to iden-
tify patterns in data derived through the KDD process.
child_8c88b961ab4e47ab916fda441a4cda5a.title: unit2ii

child_c9b0643a256f441585edfd5ad78d3a99.content:
KDD is a comprehensive process 
M04_SHAR4877_03_PIE_C04.indd   194 1/23/14   10:02 AM	 Chapter	4	 •	 Data	Mining 195
that encompasses data mining.
child_c9b0643a256f441585edfd5ad78d3a99.title: unit2ii

child_640f16b513f14124880792a648a056f4.content:
4 1/23/14   10:02 AM	 Chapter	4	 •	 Data	Mining 195
that encompasses data mining.
child_640f16b513f14124880792a648a056f4.title: unit2ii

child_0d8312074ded4c2990c0cb2728d9d28f.content:
The input to the KDD process consists of organizational 
data.
child_0d8312074ded4c2990c0cb2728d9d28f.title: unit2ii

child_29218a37ef80487bb992d1b7189019bc.content:
The enterprise data warehouse enables KDD to be implemented efficiently because 
it provides a single source for data to be mined.
child_29218a37ef80487bb992d1b7189019bc.title: unit2ii

child_665fed6a8e7d447990a226a16176a041.content:
Dunham (2003) summarized the KDD 
process as consisting of the following steps: data selection, data preprocessing, data trans-
formation,	data	mining,	and	interpretation/evaluation.
child_665fed6a8e7d447990a226a16176a041.title: unit2ii

child_f79f2d38145f45358b8da540e4b9a01d.content:

for the question, “What main methodology are you using for data mining?” (conducted by

child_cb22a30e8e5648d1968b9b42e25447b5.content: What are the major data mining processes?
child_cb22a30e8e5648d1968b9b42e25447b5.title: unit2ii

child_8c6c064a369b43b289dd9d3589fb95ea.content:
Why do you think the early phases (understanding of the business and  understanding 
of the data) take the longest in data mining projects?
child_8c6c064a369b43b289dd9d3589fb95ea.title: unit2ii

child_e280a39f5abf4558a9bc34147cb95704.content: List and briefly define the phases in the CRISP-DM process.
child_e280a39f5abf4558a9bc34147cb95704.title: unit2ii

child_41e55455982b45a48cd9fcfbacde0a6a.content: What are the main data preprocessing steps?
child_41e55455982b45a48cd9fcfbacde0a6a.title: unit2ii

child_8de7c81672494260972fa23a4b234567.content:
Briefly describe each step and provide 
relevant examples.
child_8de7c81672494260972fa23a4b234567.title: unit2ii

child_215aa7b0a2ce42e591ada19f9e55f4cc.content: How does CRISP-DM differ from SEMMA?

child_6410b31a38b645cf83ba0b6acdb260ce.content:
4.5 Data Mining MetHoDs
A variety of methods are available for performing data mining studies, including classi -
fication, regression, clustering, and association.
child_6410b31a38b645cf83ba0b6acdb260ce.title: unit2ii

child_015dc81e4d47455d9d482c8cd7e63cc0.content:
ing data mining studies, including classi -
fication, regression, clustering, and association.
child_015dc81e4d47455d9d482c8cd7e63cc0.title: unit2ii

child_dd5ded27d5e647a7b3da6f06f214e50a.content:
Most data mining software tools employ 
more than one technique (or algorithm) for each of these methods.
child_dd5ded27d5e647a7b3da6f06f214e50a.title: unit2ii

child_069e8a9377ed42caaf0459f36f043879.content:
This section describes 
the most popular data mining methods and explains their representative techniques.
child_069e8a9377ed42caaf0459f36f043879.title: unit2ii

child_c38b567f630e4775840db5189e74f227.content:
Classification
Classification is perhaps the most frequently used data mining method for real-world 
problems.
child_c38b567f630e4775840db5189e74f227.title: unit2ii

child_a155c4e2735541198ad40dbc54dbdc3a.content:
As a popular member of the machine-learning family of techniques, classifica-
tion learns patterns from past data (a set of information—traits, variables, features—on 
characteristics of the previously labeled items, objects, or events) in order to place new 
instances (with unknown labels) into their respective groups or classes.
child_a155c4e2735541198ad40dbc54dbdc3a.title: unit2ii

child_e2efa74facac4b0781f34b68cec4229d.content:
For example, 
one could use classification to predict whether the weather on a particular day will 
be “sunny,” “rainy,” or “cloudy.” Popular classification tasks include credit approval 
(i.e., good or bad credit risk), store location (e.g., good,
child_e2efa74facac4b0781f34b68cec4229d.title: unit2ii

child_d2c1a2a10e9143aa873c3d297b9bef7f.content:
fication tasks include credit approval 
(i.e., good or bad credit risk), store location (e.g., good, moderate, bad), target marketing 
(e.g., likely  customer, no hope), fraud detection (i.e., yes, no), and telecommunication 
(e.g.,	likely	to	turn	to	another	phone	company,	yes/no).
child_d2c1a2a10e9143aa873c3d297b9bef7f.title: unit2ii

child_879b74f157184d1cb489682ffe7aefcd.content:
If	what	is	being	predicted	is	a	
class label (e.g., “sunny,” “rainy,” or “cloudy”) the prediction problem is called a classi -
fication, whereas if it is a numeric value (e.g., temperature such as 68°F), the prediction 
problem is called a regression.
child_879b74f157184d1cb489682ffe7aefcd.title: unit2ii

child_f44a1e4a26484e4684776860d52aa627.content:
Even though clustering (another popular data mining method) can also be used 
to determine groups (or class memberships) of things, there is a significant difference 
between the two.
child_f44a1e4a26484e4684776860d52aa627.title: unit2ii

child_325dafb893ba4f69ace9db0472d46043.content:
Classification learns the function between the characteristics of things 
(i.e., independent variables) and their membership (i.e., output variable) through a super-
vised learning process where both types (input and output) of variables are presented to 
the algorithm; in cluster
child_325dafb893ba4f69ace9db0472d46043.title: unit2ii

child_5f8cdc28a6854d50ad209e647da1091b.content:
process where both types (input and output) of variables are presented to 
the algorithm; in clustering, the membership of the objects is learned through an unsu -
pervised learning process where only the input variables are presented to the algorithm.
child_5f8cdc28a6854d50ad209e647da1091b.title: unit2ii

child_b86e1c9c6eb848b6ba92605b85314aeb.content:
Unlike classification, clustering does not have a supervising (or controlling) mechanism 
that enforces the learning process; instead, clustering algorithms use one or more heuris-
tics (e.g., multidimensional distance measure) to discover natural groupings of objects.
child_b86e1c9c6eb848b6ba92605b85314aeb.title: unit2ii

child_31fda058344d466a8d2437c4905a5556.content:
The most common two-step methodology of classification-type prediction involves 
model	development/training	and	model	testing/deployment.
child_31fda058344d466a8d2437c4905a5556.title: unit2ii

child_30ff6a52b18546a08ea648a8a6ac2358.content:
In	the	model	development	
phase, a collection of input data, including the actual class labels, is used.
child_30ff6a52b18546a08ea648a8a6ac2358.title: unit2ii

child_7dfab424fc8241798df3faf8fa957339.content:
After a model 
has been trained, the model is tested against the holdout sample for accuracy assessment 
and eventually deployed for actual use where it is to predict classes of new data instances 
(where the class label is unknown).
child_7dfab424fc8241798df3faf8fa957339.title: unit2ii

child_8b807189f69946cb878828fdbc3bcad9.content:
actual use where it is to predict classes of new data instances 
(where the class label is unknown).
child_8b807189f69946cb878828fdbc3bcad9.title: unit2ii

child_093ed1cd76cc4d47888b9d03c64de2e9.content:
Several factors are considered in assessing the model, 
including the following:
•	Predictive accuracy.
child_093ed1cd76cc4d47888b9d03c64de2e9.title: unit2ii

child_be02438a48514809ad11b65ea0eb4a4c.content:
The model’s ability to correctly predict the class label of 
new or previously unseen data.
child_be02438a48514809ad11b65ea0eb4a4c.title: unit2ii

child_608eb3ee72e249f7979d44758367943e.content:
Prediction accuracy is the most commonly used 
assessment factor for classification models.
child_608eb3ee72e249f7979d44758367943e.title: unit2ii

child_071ed492fe264edd982a8f7531f01d28.content:
To compute this measure, actual class 
M04_SHAR4877_03_PIE_C04.indd   196 1/23/14   10:02 AM	 Chapter	4	 •	 Data	Mining 197
labels of a test data set are matched against the class labels predicted by the model.
child_071ed492fe264edd982a8f7531f01d28.title: unit2ii

child_f8c373ae4e4d45489eeb098628d991bd.content:
The accuracy can then be computed as the accuracy rate, which is the percent -
age of test data set samples correctly classified by the model (more on this topic is 
 provided later in the chapter).
child_f8c373ae4e4d45489eeb098628d991bd.title: unit2ii

child_cb3830d81f4b4320884a82f9d6d6845d.content:
The computational costs involved in generating and using the model, 
where faster is deemed to be better.
child_cb3830d81f4b4320884a82f9d6d6845d.title: unit2ii

child_f6c6099ff98d4f72ad04359269f3947a.content:
The model’s ability to make reasonably accurate predictions, given 
noi
child_f6c6099ff98d4f72ad04359269f3947a.title: unit2ii

child_5d31a9f0180e48b2ac615de3f4d04865.content:
The model’s ability to make reasonably accurate predictions, given 
noisy data or data with missing and erroneous values.
child_5d31a9f0180e48b2ac615de3f4d04865.title: unit2ii

child_7fc7100986804aa798ae99edef9602dd.content:
The ability to construct a prediction model efficiently given a rather 
large amount of data.
child_7fc7100986804aa798ae99edef9602dd.title: unit2ii

child_6f3afc97bdbf4923864a7f16e95ab858.content:
The level of understanding and insight provided by the model 
(e.g.,	how	and/or	what	the	model	concludes	on	certain	predictions).
child_6f3afc97bdbf4923864a7f16e95ab858.title: unit2ii

child_02ad3f12b0ef446c8804a547d6445caf.content:
estimating the true accuracy of Classification Models
In classification problems, the primary source for accuracy estimation is the confusion 
matrix (also called a classification matrix or a contingency table).
child_02ad3f12b0ef446c8804a547d6445caf.title: unit2ii

child_6571403ee883427d91c13af1a47ff7b7.content:
Figure 4.8 shows a 
confusion matrix for a two-class classification problem.
child_6571403ee883427d91c13af1a47ff7b7.title: unit2ii

child_e0ac281c69244c61be0c25b92a2ff55a.content:
The numbers along the diagonal 
from the upper left to the lower right represent correct decisions, and the numbers out -
side this diagonal represent the errors.
child_e0ac281c69244c61be0c25b92a2ff55a.title: unit2ii

child_cd9a9f2dfc1149d69b8a786476425a1a.content: Table 4.2 provides equations for common accuracy metrics for classification models.
child_cd9a9f2dfc1149d69b8a786476425a1a.title: unit2ii

child_4f9eeeed04fe4485994f8e63d739b315.content: When the classification problem is not binary, the con
child_4f9eeeed04fe4485994f8e63d739b315.title: unit2ii

child_81b170168fd247afbddbbcc9aa46e30d.content: n accuracy metrics for classification models.
child_81b170168fd247afbddbbcc9aa46e30d.title: unit2ii

child_9ae44b67c28e4794bcf41a2e56289a45.content:
When the classification problem is not binary, the confusion matrix gets bigger 
(a square matrix with the size of the unique number of class labels), and accuracy metrics 
become limited to per class accuracy rates and the overall classifier accuracy.
child_9ae44b67c28e4794bcf41a2e56289a45.title: unit2ii

should have in the classifier’s output in the prediction system.
child_633c7cef79dc452f8459c7fe4c3149bf.title: unit2ii

child_ce5e620e6d134b83860ce5808eaacdea.content:
Second, it can be used for 
choosing a classifier from a given set (identifying the “best” classification model among 
the many trained).
child_ce5e620e6d134b83860ce5808eaacdea.title: unit2ii

child_db856f1e75d04f65b91b3db02d0e101c.content:
The following are among the most popular estimation methodologies 
used for classification-type data mining models.
child_db856f1e75d04f65b91b3db02d0e101c.title: unit2ii

child_7003eecb757c4a4fa5b6101fb899b252.content:
siMple split The simple split (or holdout or test sample estimation) partitions the 
data into two mutually exclusive subsets called a training set and a test set (or holdout 
set).
child_7003eecb757c4a4fa5b6101fb899b252.title: unit2ii

child_8088795ba22d461d9410cc0cebcf6811.content:
It is common to designate two-thirds of the data as the training set and the remain -
ing one-third as the test set.
child_8088795ba22d461d9410cc0cebcf6811.title: unit2ii

child_a65f993edaff4262acebcd5d2f2d6633.content:
The training set is used by the inducer (model builder), 
and the built classifier is then tested on the test set.
child_a65f993edaff4262acebcd5d2f2d6633.title: unit2ii

child_367374991ecc4324a3a39a13d1305e39.content:
An exception to this rule occurs 
when the classifier is an artificial neural networ
child_367374991ecc4324a3a39a13d1305e39.title: unit2ii

child_2b5fc06dfb254795b490c9c82392cb4b.content:
An exception to this rule occurs 
when the classifier is an artificial neural network.
child_2b5fc06dfb254795b490c9c82392cb4b.title: unit2ii

child_0c1b1d49980549cca4ed82c864227ee3.content:
In this case, the data is partitioned 
into three mutually exclusive subsets: training, validation, and testing.
child_0c1b1d49980549cca4ed82c864227ee3.title: unit2ii

child_402b2bba2b2a41eaa756991d91307a7d.content:
The validation set 
is used during model building to prevent overfitting.
child_402b2bba2b2a41eaa756991d91307a7d.title: unit2ii

child_1a6a230679a7410d9dc859297484ec0b.content:
Figure 4.9 shows the simple split 
methodology.
child_1a6a230679a7410d9dc859297484ec0b.title: unit2ii

child_f17283cd6a5642f3a57297dd09d1d068.content:
The main criticism of this method is that it makes the assumption that the data in 
the two subsets are of the same kind (i.e., have the exact same properties).
child_f17283cd6a5642f3a57297dd09d1d068.title: unit2ii

child_111ca0e9dc894db796afb1a509193022.content:
Because this 
is a simple random partitioning, in most realistic data sets where the data are skewed on 
the classification variable, such an assumption may not hold true.
child_111ca0e9dc894db796afb1a509193022.title: unit2ii

child_e149b2ff5615402aa1f12aede815886e.content:
In order to improve this

M04_SHAR4877_03_PIE_C04.indd   198 1/23/14   10:02 AM	 Chapter	4	 •	 Data	Mining 199
situation, stratified sampling is suggested, where the strata become the output variable.
child_3436d918801445fc878cf03c35535bf4.title: unit2ii

child_7fa8c53601b144fba976bf7a457517f2.content: Even though this is an improvement over
child_7fa8c53601b144fba976bf7a457517f2.title: unit2ii

child_1a7d6145fd0c423d88abcdfcca276ee9.content: is suggested, where the strata become the output variable.
child_1a7d6145fd0c423d88abcdfcca276ee9.title: unit2ii

child_fa6de7c06e884414abc367b13e7425ef.content:
Even though this is an improvement over the simple split, it still has a bias associated 
from the single random partitioning.
child_fa6de7c06e884414abc367b13e7425ef.title: unit2ii

child_9f89b88c30d84f99ad03e346d30ecf1a.content:
k-FolD Cross-ValiDation In order to minimize the bias associated with the random 
sampling of the training and holdout data samples in comparing the predictive accuracy 
of two or more methods, one can use a methodology called k-fold cross-validation.
child_9f89b88c30d84f99ad03e346d30ecf1a.title: unit2ii

child_ff33212db89644dc8b8d449c7e51b800.content:
In 
k-fold cross-validation, also called rotation estimation, the complete data set is randomly 
split into k mutually exclusive subsets of approximately equal size.
child_ff33212db89644dc8b8d449c7e51b800.title: unit2ii

child_87461a791c0d48dd932a5fa082bd5b88.content:
The classification 
model is trained and tested k times.
child_87461a791c0d48dd932a5fa082bd5b88.title: unit2ii

child_1088d1d8ce7944f6964b2dd504e67d2e.content:
Each time it is trained on all but one fold and then 
tested on the remaining single fold.
child_1088d1d8ce7944f6964b2dd504e67d2e.title: unit2ii

child_7d76a0a0e3784e6e8c98420007f877e0.content:
The cross-validation estimate of the overall accuracy 
of a model is calculated by simply averaging the k individual accuracy measures, as 
shown in the following equation:
CVA = 1
k a
k
i = 1
Ai
where CVA stands for cross-validation accuracy, k
child_7d76a0a0e3784e6e8c98420007f877e0.title: unit2ii

child_5249a433dcc543d6abfa8bddef774642.content:
in the following equation:
CVA = 1
k a
k
i = 1
Ai
where CVA stands for cross-validation accuracy, k is the number of folds used, and A is 
the accuracy measure (e.g., hit-rate, sensitivity, specificity) of each fold.
child_5249a433dcc543d6abfa8bddef774642.title: unit2ii

child_08838c06db79414e8560155354fbb4d5.content:
aDDitional Classi FiCation assessMent Met HoDologies Other popular assess -
ment methodologies include the following:
•	Leave-one-out.
child_08838c06db79414e8560155354fbb4d5.title: unit2ii

child_ec88cf37b5e04fd49961a12457392aca.content:
The leave-one-out method is similar to the k-fold cross-  
validation where the k takes the value of 1; that is, every data point is used for 
testing once on as many models developed as there are number of data points.
child_ec88cf37b5e04fd49961a12457392aca.title: unit2ii

child_a8f7016dfb0044a38cd915925b5cfc15.content:
This is a time-consuming methodology, but sometimes for small data sets it is a 
viable option.
child_a8f7016dfb0044a38cd915925b5cfc15.title: unit2ii

child_b1683afb7f514811b13716970c285d1c.content:
With bootstrapping, a fixed number of instances from the origi-
nal data are sampled (with replacement) for training and the rest of the data set is 
used for testing.
child_b1683afb7f514811b13716970c285d1c.title: unit2ii

child_75c713e6a26d4bdab7a7851b27aef939.content: This process is repeated as many times as desired.
child_75c713e6a26d4bdab7a7851b27aef939.title: unit2ii

child_cbaf12409b2a47909de10dedaff7dca4.content:
Though similar to the leave-one-out methodology, with jackknifing 
the accuracy
child_cbaf12409b2a47909de10dedaff7dca4.title: unit2ii

child_8d4dbe3d1b244e4e98ee0906cafdff46.content:
Though similar to the leave-one-out methodology, with jackknifing 
the accuracy is calculated by leaving one sample out at each iteration of the estima-
tion process.
child_8d4dbe3d1b244e4e98ee0906cafdff46.title: unit2ii

child_b5c5cb68825b4775a85294f755a8f3db.content:
The area under the rOc curve is a graphical 
assessment technique where the true positive rate is plotted on the y-axis and false 
positive rate is plotted on the x-axis.
child_b5c5cb68825b4775a85294f755a8f3db.title: unit2ii

child_c9fd354afd4c447e968683fe008474ad.content:
The area under the ROC curve determines the 
accuracy measure of a classifier: A value of 1 indicates a perfect classifier whereas 
0.5 indicates no better than random chance; in reality, the values would range 
between the two extreme cases.
child_c9fd354afd4c447e968683fe008474ad.title: unit2ii

child_a9e585c6715a488fa84d1e13b5a090d0.content:
For example, in Figure 4.10 A has a better clas -
sification performance than B, while C is not any better than the random chance of 
flipping a coin.
child_a9e585c6715a488fa84d1e13b5a090d0.title: unit2ii

child_410d26315d234e9792b997260223f87d.content:
ClassiFiCation teCHniques A number of techniques (or algorithms) are used for clas-
sification modeling, including the following:
•	Decision tree analysis.
child_410d26315d234e9792b997260223f87d.title: unit2ii

child_4df8768caf8a40eb9e25364fa5b22695.content:
Decision tree analysis (a machine-learning technique) 
is argu
child_4df8768caf8a40eb9e25364fa5b22695.title: unit2ii

child_3c426e64e8d546b8be4a063c3aa845b7.content:
Decision tree analysis (a machine-learning technique) 
is arguably the most popular classification technique in the data mining arena.
child_3c426e64e8d546b8be4a063c3aa845b7.title: unit2ii

child_b10e25d8ba9e45adb9175ee23a63dbb1.content:
A 
detailed description of this technique is given in the following section.
child_b10e25d8ba9e45adb9175ee23a63dbb1.title: unit2ii

child_69958bafa5de4edcb184a040faae6ec8.content:
Statistical techniques were the primary classification 
algorithm for many years until the emergence of machine-learning techniques.
child_69958bafa5de4edcb184a040faae6ec8.title: unit2ii

child_40dae57f81364fcdac86b2601093761b.content:
M04_SHAR4877_03_PIE_C04.indd   199 1/23/14   10:02 AM200	 Chapter 	4	 •	 Data	Mining
Statistical classification techniques include logistic regression and discriminant 
analysis, both of which make the assumptions that the relationships between the 
input and output variables are linear in nature, the data is normally distributed, 
and the variables are not correlated and are independent of each other.
child_40dae57f81364fcdac86b2601093761b.title: unit2ii

child_73e4758cdada4408a492d12e2a705336.content:
The ques -
tionable nature of these assumptions has led to the shift toward machine-learning 
techniques.
child_73e4758cdada4408a492d12e2a705336.title: unit2ii

child_21710c8b48b44fa4b8c5142c32a9db69.content:
These are among the most popular machine-learning 
 techniq
child_21710c8b48b44fa4b8c5142c32a9db69.title: unit2ii

child_72efb82cb96d4dae8608b8631282da86.content:
These are among the most popular machine-learning 
 techniques that can be used for classification-type problems.
child_72efb82cb96d4dae8608b8631282da86.title: unit2ii

child_951553cc2b8344a0a58e3938bb55aeb6.content:
This approach uses historical cases to recognize com -
monalities in order to assign a new case into the most probable category.
child_951553cc2b8344a0a58e3938bb55aeb6.title: unit2ii

child_393ed98f84ea443c9c516eafb6e37351.content:
This approach uses probability theory to build classifi -
cation models based on the past occurrences that are capable of placing a new 
instance into a most probable class (or category).
child_393ed98f84ea443c9c516eafb6e37351.title: unit2ii

child_b51306f87a924ecbbcd2f46d8d4dd197.content:
The use of the analogy of natural evolution to build 
directed-search-based mechanisms to classify data samples.
child_b51306f87a924ecbbcd2f46d8d4dd197.title: unit2ii

child_aeb5be7e8ba54de8a7108fec69c13d49.content:
This method takes into account the partial membership of class labels 
to predefined categories in building models (collection of rules) for  classification 
problems.
child_aeb5be7e8ba54de8a7108fec69c13d49.title: unit2ii

child_9c56f800b411423aafcd0c9e7a73b89c.content:
A complete description of all of these classification techniques is beyond the scope of this 
book; thus, only several of the most popular ones are presented he
child_9c56f800b411423aafcd0c9e7a73b89c.title: unit2ii

child_983fd979e9d74e0897f96fbf574783b6.content:
ques is beyond the scope of this 
book; thus, only several of the most popular ones are presented here.
child_983fd979e9d74e0897f96fbf574783b6.title: unit2ii

child_c19315535f034fb29b79f51f88faaaa0.content:
DeCision trees Before describing the details of decision trees, we need to  discuss 
some simple terminology.
child_c19315535f034fb29b79f51f88faaaa0.title: unit2ii

child_b0421f5e437e4dcb92feac96d20c9e4d.content:
First, decision trees include many input variables that may

child_b0421f5e437e4dcb92feac96d20c9e4d.title: unit2ii

child_86ca13fc1b134fe7b01c6ad4b4821cd9.content:
M04_SHAR4877_03_PIE_C04.indd   200 1/23/14   10:02 AM	 Chapter	4	 •	 Data	Mining 201
have an impact on the classification of different patterns.
child_86ca13fc1b134fe7b01c6ad4b4821cd9.title: unit2ii

child_597abd120a264995af378b3dadc8d287.content:
These input variables are 
 usually called attributes.
child_597abd120a264995af378b3dadc8d287.title: unit2ii

child_48672334b10c4a8891cf70bcfde03f15.content:
For example, if we were to build a model to classify loan risks 
on the basis of just two characteristics—income and a credit rating—these two char -
acteristics would be the attributes and the resulting output would be the class label   
(e.g., low, medium, or high risk).
child_48672334b10c4a8891cf70bcfde03f15.title: unit2ii

child_3d655fdfd35c4b468df7baf00ff95308.content: Second, a tree consists of branches and nodes.
child_3d655fdfd35c4b468df7baf00ff95308.title: unit2ii

child_95ea30e7b616483592fd6fabf6ff7b7c.content: Second, a tree consists of branches and nodes.
child_95ea30e7b616483592fd6fabf6ff7b7c.title: unit2ii

child_4a3dc24ac59e447a94d1a052b145fcf7.content:
A branch 
represents the outcome of a test to classify a pattern (on the basis of a test) using one 
of the attributes.
child_4a3dc24ac59e447a94d1a052b145fcf7.title: unit2ii

child_9d8f8936e0f3467a9809ea0f04246828.content:
A leaf node at the end represents the final class choice for a pattern (a 
chain of branches from the root node to the leaf node, which can be represented as a 
complex if-then statement).
child_9d8f8936e0f3467a9809ea0f04246828.title: unit2ii

child_87d64fc4b59c4ffea9184ff402e7aa17.content:
The basic idea behind a decision tree is that it recursively divides a training set 
until each division consists entirely or primarily of examples from one class.
child_87d64fc4b59c4ffea9184ff402e7aa17.title: unit2ii

child_e0140af801274a08ac4d1210483debe4.content:
Each non -
leaf node of the tree contains a split point, which is a test on one or more attributes and 
determines how the data are to be divided further.
child_e0140af801274a08ac4d1210483debe4.title: unit2ii

child_595c99c145fe43f38bac3376926ba454.content:
Decision tree algorithms, in general, 
build an initial tree from the training data such that each leaf node is pure, and they 
then prune the tree to increase its generalization, and hence, the prediction accuracy 
on test data.
child_595c99c145fe43f38bac3376926ba454.title: unit2ii

child_5dbed9cd509945ea8e94f8dfa81c1fca.content: In the growth phase, the tree is built by recursively divid
child_5dbed9cd509945ea8e94f8dfa81c1fca.title: unit2ii

child_5fce05eea6594b9682fa60c71c2c1488.content:
, the prediction accuracy 
on test data.
child_5fce05eea6594b9682fa60c71c2c1488.title: unit2ii

child_294b40f29d9e44eeb4dea779ef26f022.content:
In the growth phase, the tree is built by recursively dividing the data until each divi-
sion is either pure (i.e., contains members of the same class) or relatively small.
child_294b40f29d9e44eeb4dea779ef26f022.title: unit2ii

child_48b35ccbb501409d88ffd4546f586b83.content:
The basic 
idea is to ask questions whose answers would provide the most information, similar to 
what we may do when playing the game “Twenty Questions.”
The split used to partition the data depends on the type of the attribute used in the 
split.
child_48b35ccbb501409d88ffd4546f586b83.title: unit2ii

child_5c08b5e0a1a94feab2c43de07b337416.content:
For a continuous attribute A, splits are of the form value(A) 6 x, where x is some 
“optimal” split value of A.
child_5c08b5e0a1a94feab2c43de07b337416.title: unit2ii

child_2f48ed16e4b94943b61cab879c6c1929.content:
For example, the split based on income could be “Income  
< 50000.” For the categorical attribute A, splits are of the form value(A) belongs to x, 
where x is a subset of A.
child_2f48ed16e4b94943b61cab879c6c1929.title: unit2ii

child_b0e3adacc824413eaf357fc46ddde1bf.content:
As an example, the split could be on the basis of gender: “Male 
versus Female.”
A general algorithm for building a decision tree is as follows:
 1.
child_b0e3adacc824413eaf357fc46ddde1bf.title: unit2ii

child_09e600f36f98486c82176190a1f427f6.content: Create a root node and assign all of the training data to it.
child_09e600f36f98486c82176190a1f427f6.title: unit2ii

child_5f276547450c460992b9188320aa9327.content: eate a root node and assign all of the training data to it.
child_5f276547450c460992b9188320aa9327.title: unit2ii

child_69fac81d61574909bb6ed331e7a634e2.content: Add a branch to the root node for each value of the split.
child_69fac81d61574909bb6ed331e7a634e2.title: unit2ii

child_0b9ae0890cf9487da5f26230e296545b.content:
Split the data into mutu -
ally exclusive (nonoverlapping) subsets along the lines of the specific split and 
mode to the branches.
child_0b9ae0890cf9487da5f26230e296545b.title: unit2ii

child_51f2b2931ef6450283650fcb1324c8ad.content:
Repeat steps 2 and 3 for each and every leaf node until the stopping criteria is 
reached (e.g., the node is dominated by a single class label).
child_51f2b2931ef6450283650fcb1324c8ad.title: unit2ii

child_dc10c05c79944b138a80400eaf8dbd1f.content: Many different algorithms have been proposed for creating decision trees.
child_dc10c05c79944b138a80400eaf8dbd1f.title: unit2ii

child_27b79dabeed143c8b83f16f6dd52975f.content:
These 
algorithms differ primarily in terms of the way in which they determine the splitting 
attribute (and its split values), the order of splitting the attributes (splitting the same 
attribute only once or many times), the number of splits at each node (binary versus 
ternary), the stopping criteria, and the pruning of the tree (pre- versus postpruning).
child_27b79dabeed143c8b83f16f6dd52975f.title: unit2ii

child_f34328d3ff79461193c9258dd34bb1c5.content:
Some of the most well-known algorithms are ID3 (followed by C4.5 and C5 as the 
improved versions of ID3) from machine
child_f34328d3ff79461193c9258dd34bb1c5.title: unit2ii

child_fdbae1b87ef1493cbab04f2727cf7309.content:
ll-known algorithms are ID3 (followed by C4.5 and C5 as the 
improved versions of ID3) from machine learning, classification and regression trees 
(CART) from statistics, and the chi-squared automatic interaction detector (CHAID) from 
pattern recognition.
child_fdbae1b87ef1493cbab04f2727cf7309.title: unit2ii

child_0d2a669135664426a72cbc3f3d6261ff.content:
When building a decision tree, the goal at each node is to determine the attribute 
and the split point of that attribute that best divides the training records in order to purify 
the class representation at that node.
child_0d2a669135664426a72cbc3f3d6261ff.title: unit2ii

child_ae1007615bd241418541b82585d30840.content:
To evaluate the goodness of the split, some split -
ting indices have been proposed.
child_ae1007615bd241418541b82585d30840.title: unit2ii

child_ddac703186f34ea78357e08dbc998562.content:
Two of the most common ones are the Gini index and 
information gain.
child_ddac703186f34ea78357e08dbc998562.title: unit2ii

child_8aed638b4dc140dca846ac89fd59119e.content:
The Gini index is used in CART and SPRINT (Scalable PaRallelizable 
Induction of Decision Trees) algorithms.
child_8aed638b4dc140dca846ac89fd59119e.title: unit2ii

child_9f0a2d3a946b4521b54f739434e62809.content:
Versions of information gain are used in ID3 
(and its newer versions, C4.5 and C5).
child_9f0a2d3a946b4521b54f739434e62809.title: unit2ii

child_4ec01a0d0b7343eea97647adbb99befa.content:
M04_SHAR4877_03_PIE_C04.indd   201 1/23/14   10:02 AM202	 Chapter 	4	 •	 Data	Mining
The gini index has been used in economics to measure the diversity of a popula-
tion.
child_4ec01a0d0b7343eea97647adbb99befa.title: unit2ii

child_6f7d0702343c41ba96a28ed79305dbe8.content:
ata	Mining
The gini index has been used in economics to measure the diversity of a popula-
tion.
child_6f7d0702343c41ba96a28ed79305dbe8.title: unit2ii

child_3ebb806958be4edc873987da943a0bba.content:
The same concept can be used to determine the purity of a specific class as a result 
of a decision to branch along a particular attribute or variable.
child_3ebb806958be4edc873987da943a0bba.title: unit2ii

child_16a94e26132e4ce7bedbd91d11aa6f29.content:
The best split is the one 
that increases the purity of the sets resulting from a proposed split.
child_16a94e26132e4ce7bedbd91d11aa6f29.title: unit2ii

child_7f9a14faba8a4f1d8275e971f43d2c71.content:
Let us briefly look into 
a simple calculation of Gini index:
If a data set S contains examples from n classes, the Gini index is defined as
gini(S) = 1 - a
n
j = 1
pj
2
where pj is a relative frequency of class j in S.
child_7f9a14faba8a4f1d8275e971f43d2c71.title: unit2ii

child_0d4ba3792a214ae5811024f4caf68c4a.content:
If a data set S is split into two subsets, 
S1 and S2, with sizes N1 and N2, respectively, the Gini index of the split data contains 
examples from n classes, and the Gini index is defined as
ginisplit (S) = N1
N  gini (S1) + N2
N  gini(S2)
The	attribute/split	combination	that	provides	the	smallest	ginisplit(S) is chosen to split 
the node.
child_0d4ba3792a214ae5811024f4caf68c4a.title: unit2ii

child_ed417c5b93e04de1be5749c072bc3233.content:
In such a determination, one should enumerate all possible splitting points for 
each attr
child_ed417c5b93e04de1be5749c072bc3233.title: unit2ii

child_e14a216132454fe5851e035d884f2481.content:
In such a determination, one should enumerate all possible splitting points for 
each attribute.
child_e14a216132454fe5851e035d884f2481.title: unit2ii

child_b60ee6cbe33e4a41bd4b85074cd37b4e.content:
information gain is the splitting mechanism used in ID3, which is perhaps the 
most widely known decision tree algorithm.
child_b60ee6cbe33e4a41bd4b85074cd37b4e.title: unit2ii

child_2f12f513e0fe4882b5bdc3ccd5474b0f.content:
It was developed by Ross Quinlan in 1986, 
and since then he has evolved this algorithm into the C4.5 and C5 algorithms.
child_2f12f513e0fe4882b5bdc3ccd5474b0f.title: unit2ii

child_225ceaaef04642a1976a515ded7acc3c.content:
The basic 
idea behind ID3 (and its variants) is to use a concept called entropy in place of the Gini 
index.
child_225ceaaef04642a1976a515ded7acc3c.title: unit2ii

child_96040d4390e345d99aeea211ed60c37a.content: entropy measures the extent of uncertainty or randomness in a data set.
child_96040d4390e345d99aeea211ed60c37a.title: unit2ii

child_259ce6ce67cd4e17b3948259fb495ea5.content:
If all the 
data in a subset belong to just one class, there is no uncertainty or randomness in that 
data set; so, the entropy is zero.
child_259ce6ce67cd4e17b3948259fb495ea5.title: unit2ii

child_b444afc14a0448f3906171b15b7624ab.content:
The objective of this approach is to build subtrees so that 
the entropy of each final subset is zero (or close to zero).
child_b444afc14a0448f3906171b15b7624ab.title: unit2ii

child_e381b5e73c664811b1d6fe806e3fefc8.content:
Let us also look at the calcula-
tion of the information gain.
child_e381b5e73c664811b1d6fe806e3fefc8.title: unit2ii

child_d409c89a83564f22a8a4ce011ecbdb8a.content: Assume that there are two classes, P (positive) and N (negative).
child_d409c89a83564f22a8a4ce011ecbdb8a.title: unit2ii

child_1b69418f545e43a1a161c06e5431b57d.content:
Let the set of 
examples S contain p counts of class P and n counts of class N.
child_1b69418f545e43a1a161c06e5431b57d.title: unit2ii

child_c731a9a7b3bb442c8b6569a46354575f.content:
Let the set of 
examples S contain p counts of class P and n counts of class N.
child_c731a9a7b3bb442c8b6569a46354575f.title: unit2ii

child_68480e1118734380a33cdb38f3837db8.content:
The amount of informa-
tion needed to decide if an arbitrary example in S belongs to P or N is defined as
I (p, n) = - p
p + n log2 p
p + n - n
p + n log2 n
p + n
Assume that using attribute A, the set S will be partitioned into sets { S1, S2,..., Sv}.
child_68480e1118734380a33cdb38f3837db8.title: unit2ii

child_b46a0ad4cb694d7a8962685de7988128.content:
If Si 
 contains pi examples of P and ni examples of N, the entropy, or the expected information 
needed to classify objects in all subtrees, Si, is
E(A) = a
n
i = 1
 pi + ni
p + n  I(pi, ni)
Then, the information that would be gained by branching on attribute A would be
Gain(A) = I(p, n) - E(A)
These calculations are repeated for each and every attribute, and the one with the 
 highest information gain is selected as the splitting attribute.
child_b46a0ad4cb694d7a8962685de7988128.title: unit2ii

child_3891b50f89ba422784eb5e579626b982.content:
The basic ideas behind 
these  splitting indices are rather similar to each other, but the specific algorithmic details 
vary.
child_3891b50f89ba422784eb5e579626b982.title: unit2ii

child_1e90ac21c7ed49cd9f10be7332747967.content: A detailed definition of ID3 algorithm and its splitting mechanism can be
child_1e90ac21c7ed49cd9f10be7332747967.title: unit2ii

child_f914124ac4ee4637849b1bd1e2113777.content:
A detailed definition of ID3 algorithm and its splitting mechanism can be found in 
Quinlan (1986).
child_f914124ac4ee4637849b1bd1e2113777.title: unit2ii

child_91924e97af6147c095383785a4ba2229.content:
Application Case 4.5 illustrates how significant the gains may be if the right data 
mining techniques are used for a well-defined business problem.
child_91924e97af6147c095383785a4ba2229.title: unit2ii

child_81305201916541d19bcc1d92be562b1a.content:
M04_SHAR4877_03_PIE_C04.indd   202 1/23/14   10:02 AM	 Chapter	4	 •	 Data	Mining 203
Application Case 4.5
2degrees Gets a 1275 Percent Boost in Churn Identification
2degrees is New Zealand’s fastest growing mobile 
telecommunications company.
child_81305201916541d19bcc1d92be562b1a.title: unit2ii

child_1435cda7059942468376d6e8d6a70f4f.content:
In less than 3 years, 
they have transformed the landscape of New 
Zealand’s mobile telecommunications market.
child_1435cda7059942468376d6e8d6a70f4f.title: unit2ii

child_30f803a5f5164b219b5ecdb1630d4fbb.content:
Entering very much as the challenger and battling 
with incumbents entrenched in the market for over 
18 years, 2degrees has won over 580,000 customers 
and has revenues of more than $100 million in just 
their third year of operation.
child_30f803a5f5164b219b5ecdb1630d4fbb.title: unit2ii

child_c10b7ccbaf144c10a269907be8bedad5.content:
situation
2degrees’ information solutions manager, Peter 
McCallum, explains that predictive an
