child_2a5d413e3d9c47ca9459c8a721ad2352.content:
How can data mining help in identifying cus -
tomer churn?
child_2a5d413e3d9c47ca9459c8a721ad2352.title: unit2ii

child_c43a950e583947a6a92aefbe99239510.content:
How do some companies do it 
without using data mining tools and techniques?
child_c43a950e583947a6a92aefbe99239510.title: unit2ii

child_e432f91845f34c07a9e2addc523f007d.content:
Cluster analysis for Data Mining
Cluster analysis is an essential data mining method for classifying items, events, or con -
cepts into common groupings called clusters.
child_e432f91845f34c07a9e2addc523f007d.title: unit2ii

child_c147f0ff4b65442fb13fbd8b5c665211.content:
The method is commonly used in biol -
ogy, medicine, genetics, social network analysis, anthropology, archaeology, astronomy, 
character recognition, and even in MIS development.
child_c147f0ff4b65442fb13fbd8b5c665211.title: unit2ii

child_be28d42ef06a4f0a98a41ee0e6fd62af.content:
As data mining has increased in 
popularity, the underlying techniques have been applied to business, especially to mar -
keting.
child_be28d42ef06a4f0a98a41ee0e6fd62af.title: unit2ii

child_4090d38b714d4354a414f43fbed48f6e.content:
Cluster analysis has been used extensively for fraud detection (both credit card 
and e-commerce fraud) and market segmentation of customers in contemporary CR
child_4090d38b714d4354a414f43fbed48f6e.title: unit2ii

child_da50e22b022748fa855d1736b4782e19.content:
ion (both credit card 
and e-commerce fraud) and market segmentation of customers in contemporary CRM 
systems.
child_da50e22b022748fa855d1736b4782e19.title: unit2ii

child_96b179faca9e42d380a464a2f42143af.content:
More applications in business continue to be developed as the strength of cluster 
analysis is recognized and used.
child_96b179faca9e42d380a464a2f42143af.title: unit2ii

child_80bf25d4b0874283878c112719b55e28.content: Cluster analysis is an exploratory data analysis tool for solving classification problems.
child_80bf25d4b0874283878c112719b55e28.title: unit2ii

child_12aeb3df8ddf4888b4d0210fdc6924ad.content:
The objective is to sort cases (e.g., people, things, events) into groups, or clusters, so that 
the degree of association is strong among members of the same cluster and weak among 
M04_SHAR4877_03_PIE_C04.indd   204 1/23/14   10:02 AM	 Chapter	4	 •	 Data	Mining 205
members of different clusters.
child_12aeb3df8ddf4888b4d0210fdc6924ad.title: unit2ii

child_2b8ca59bfef94fb5ac94c5f3130ad855.content: Each cluster describes the class to which its members belong.
child_2b8ca59bfef94fb5ac94c5f3130ad855.title: unit2ii

child_aaaa0e2effb449659a14a302c35a8f6c.content:
An obvious one-dimensional example of cluster analysis is to establish score ranges into 
which to assign class grades for a college class.
child_aaaa0e2effb449659a14a302c35a8f6c.title: unit2ii

child_e95ae5198de34664b0ada6ee8a127ad7.content:
This is similar to the cluster analysis problem 
that the U.S. Treasury faced when establishing new tax brackets in the 1980s.
child_e95ae5198de34664b0ada6ee8a127ad7.title: unit2ii

child_387320fb0b264320a5dca04c34b806aa.content:
A fictional 
example of clustering occurs in J.
child_387320fb0b264320a5dca04c34b806aa.title: unit2ii

child_fde83a9b7f5c407ea4d9f2f511c87cbe.content: when establishing new tax brackets in the 1980s.
child_fde83a9b7f5c407ea4d9f2f511c87cbe.title: unit2ii

child_ec2ea81b74754528a7350cfed306ddea.content:
A fictional 
example of clustering occurs in J.
child_ec2ea81b74754528a7350cfed306ddea.title: unit2ii

child_b839da5044824246af053c9762a602d9.content:
The Sorting Hat deter-
mines to which House (e.g., dormitory) to assign first-year students at the Hogwarts School.
child_b839da5044824246af053c9762a602d9.title: unit2ii

child_81538a413ecb447cad07798ea414d8b1.content: Another example involves determining how to seat guests at a wedding.
child_81538a413ecb447cad07798ea414d8b1.title: unit2ii

child_373f172501a24197a4ca1d076159bfe7.content:
As far as data min-
ing goes, the importance of cluster analysis is that it may reveal associations and structures 
in data that were not previously apparent but are sensible and useful once found.
child_373f172501a24197a4ca1d076159bfe7.title: unit2ii

child_836719f0a86040588f3eda5d93630b2a.content:
Cluster analysis results may be used to:
•	Identify	a	classification	scheme	(e.g.,	types	of	customers)
•	Suggest	statistical	models	to	describe	populations
•	Indicate	rules	for	assigning	new	cases	to	classes	for	identification,	targeting,	and	
diagnostic purposes
•	Provide	measures	of	definition,	size,	and	change	in	what	were	previously	broad	
concepts
•	Find	typical	cases	to	label	and	represent	classes
•	Decrease	 the	 size	 and	 complexity	 of	 the	 problem	 space	 for	 other	 d
child_836719f0a86040588f3eda5d93630b2a.title: unit2ii

child_250171d7872342f2b6b7ff383d6465c9.content:
and	represent	classes
•	Decrease	 the	 size	 and	 complexity	 of	 the	 problem	 space	 for	 other	 data	 mining	
methods
•	Identify	outliers	in	a	specific	domain	(e.g.,	rare-event	detection)
DeterMining t He optiMal nuMBer o F Clusters  Clustering algorithms usually 
require one to specify the number of clusters to find.
child_250171d7872342f2b6b7ff383d6465c9.title: unit2ii

child_5b6a56449949411e95f29be6984fa2a6.content:
If this number is not known 
from prior knowledge, it should be chosen in some way.
child_5b6a56449949411e95f29be6984fa2a6.title: unit2ii

child_e4f195f4add94c36a0994158cee33360.content:
Unfortunately, there is not an 
 optimal way of calculating what this number is supposed to be.
child_e4f195f4add94c36a0994158cee33360.title: unit2ii

child_7682f5d6489648e3ba63364c03420ee8.content:
Therefore, several dif -
ferent heuristic methods have been proposed.
child_7682f5d6489648e3ba63364c03420ee8.title: unit2ii

child_488df1f079f942bbaf96c35136332f6f.content:
The following are among the most com -
monly referenced ones:
•	Look	at	the	percentage	of	variance	explained	as	a	function	of	the	number	of	clus-
ters; that is, choose a number of clusters so that adding another cluster would not 
give much better modeling of the data.
child_488df1f079f942bbaf96c35136332f6f.title: unit2ii

child_875e026b9f654302b76c6f5546c294c6.content:
Specifically, if one graphs the percentage of 
variance explained by the clusters, there is a point at which the marginal gain will 
drop (giving an angle in
child_875e026b9f654302b76c6f5546c294c6.title: unit2ii

child_9e3c31ee4e9d49f4b86b4910484f06f2.content:
xplained by the clusters, there is a point at which the marginal gain will 
drop (giving an angle in the graph), indicating the number of clusters to be chosen.
child_9e3c31ee4e9d49f4b86b4910484f06f2.title: unit2ii

child_a2cf1bf9a55040239f3912bd069dfaa7.content: •	Set	the	number	of	clusters	to	(n/2)1/2, where n is the number of data points.
child_a2cf1bf9a55040239f3912bd069dfaa7.title: unit2ii

child_1267303e03b043a0adb97c487efa47af.content:
•	Use	the	Akaike	Information	Criterion	(AIC),	which	is	a	measure	of	the	goodness	of	
fit (based on the concept of entropy) to determine the number of clusters.
child_1267303e03b043a0adb97c487efa47af.title: unit2ii

child_6fb5e497276d473494cf7a32d3c611f4.content:
•	Use	 Bayesian	 information	 criterion	 (BIC),	 which	 is	 a	 model-selection	 criterion	
(based on maximum likelihood estimation) to determine the number of clusters.
child_6fb5e497276d473494cf7a32d3c611f4.title: unit2ii

child_fe4f01504eac49cfac7153d65d8fdf09.content:
analysis MetHoDs Cluster analysis may be based on one or more of the following 
general methods:
•	Statistical	 methods	 (including	 both	 hierarchical	 and	 nonhierarchical),	 such	 as	
k-means, k-modes, and so on
•	Neural	networks	(with	the	architecture	called	self-organizing	map,	or	SOM)
•	Fuzzy	logic	(e.g.,	fuzzy	c-means algorithm)
•	Genetic	algorithms
Each of these methods generally works with one of two general method cl
child_fe4f01504eac49cfac7153d65d8fdf09.title: unit2ii

child_4371cca564bb4bbea2844e274539aacc.content:
orithm)
•	Genetic	algorithms
Each of these methods generally works with one of two general method classes:
•	Divisive.
child_4371cca564bb4bbea2844e274539aacc.title: unit2ii

child_ebaf455c98a348a6b5be8b11bb2bfc1b.content: With divisive classes, all items start in one cluster and are broken apart.
child_ebaf455c98a348a6b5be8b11bb2bfc1b.title: unit2ii

child_3b6fe5c95c3849e8bfd3a737f7ab2834.content:
With agglomerative classes, all items start in individual clusters, 
and the clusters are joined together.
child_3b6fe5c95c3849e8bfd3a737f7ab2834.title: unit2ii

child_6e6ed041c3434865af1c9134aa6acdc0.content:
M04_SHAR4877_03_PIE_C04.indd   205 1/23/14   10:02 AM206	 Chapter 	4	 •	 Data	Mining
Most cluster analysis methods involve the use of a distance measure to calculate the 
closeness between pairs of items.
child_6e6ed041c3434865af1c9134aa6acdc0.title: unit2ii

child_db566aef7cca46969bc3ad7c738e4e64.content:
Popular distance measures include Euclidian distance (the 
ordinary distance between two points that one would measure with a ruler) and Manhattan 
distance (also called the rectilinear distance, or taxicab distance, between two points).
child_db566aef7cca46969bc3ad7c738e4e64.title: unit2ii

child_a238eaf5587f4bb4b489005be4ed91a4.content:
Often, 
they are based on true distances that are measured, but this need not be so, as is typically 
the case in IS development.
child_a238eaf5587f4bb4b489005be4ed91a4.title: unit2ii

child_ec77f43673694a5d8906e56f646060e7.content: Weighted averages may be used to establish these distances.
child_ec77f43673694a5d8906e56f646060e7.title: unit2ii

child_91e4b6340a884b7fbd1da1ccd36f39a7.content: For example, in an IS development project, indi
child_91e4b6340a884b7fbd1da1ccd36f39a7.title: unit2ii

child_18d98924d8584420ab450a40b9926a95.content: averages may be used to establish these distances.
child_18d98924d8584420ab450a40b9926a95.title: unit2ii

child_2f471d22bfc345dc8aecf1c6dd0b21dd.content:
For example, in an IS development project, individual modules of the system may be related 
by the similarity between their inputs, outputs, processes, and the specific data used.
child_2f471d22bfc345dc8aecf1c6dd0b21dd.title: unit2ii

child_10adbbaceff240c2a9133ba6e78c3687.content:
These 
factors are then aggregated, pairwise by item, into a single distance measure.
child_10adbbaceff240c2a9133ba6e78c3687.title: unit2ii

child_48541fbd97594c0bb931be7ff6650b76.content:
k-Means Clustering algoritHM The k-means algorithm (where k stands for the prede-
termined number of clusters) is arguably the most referenced clustering algorithm.
child_48541fbd97594c0bb931be7ff6650b76.title: unit2ii

child_135d4b03a10d47dda524598c335756c4.content:
It has its 
roots in traditional statistical analysis.
child_135d4b03a10d47dda524598c335756c4.title: unit2ii

child_8940034ad4e24978bd288da568eac874.content:
As the name implies, the algorithm assigns each data 
point (customer, event, object, etc.) to the cluster whose center (also called centroid) is the 
nearest.
child_8940034ad4e24978bd288da568eac874.title: unit2ii

child_949740501dee4c6ea51d6bb06d65d5cf.content:
The center is calculated as the average of all the points in the cluster; that is, its 
coordinates are the arithmetic mean for each dimension separately over all the points in the 
cluster.
child_949740501dee4c6ea51d6bb06d65d5cf.title: unit2ii

child_2eaba100513e4499983ec95728ce44b2.content:
The algorithm steps are listed below and shown graphically in Figure 4.11:
Initialization step: Choose the num
child_2eaba100513e4499983ec95728ce44b2.title: unit2ii

child_f27de69dad5d4d8aa510308abf56ea85.content:
thm steps are listed below and shown graphically in Figure 4.11:
Initialization step: Choose the number of clusters (i.e., the value of k).
child_f27de69dad5d4d8aa510308abf56ea85.title: unit2ii

child_a3e8188a9315489a903b2c28230b2c8b.content: step 1: Randomly generate k random points as initial cluster centers.
child_a3e8188a9315489a903b2c28230b2c8b.title: unit2ii

child_0d3a96b3bcdb4edc9236db662d3af384.content: step 2: Assign each point to the nearest cluster center.
child_0d3a96b3bcdb4edc9236db662d3af384.title: unit2ii

child_96e4f50afaec421a9bdaa0298a7e4753.content: step 3: Recompute the new cluster centers.
child_96e4f50afaec421a9bdaa0298a7e4753.title: unit2ii

child_d7b7ce9d42df4a3691e282965c461ec9.content:
Repetition step: Repeat steps 2 and 3 until some convergence criterion is met 
(usually that the assignment of points to clusters becomes stable).
child_d7b7ce9d42df4a3691e282965c461ec9.title: unit2ii

child_a75354ad5a0746a5bd2cd0284603a9e6.content:
association rule Mining
Association rule mining (also known as affinity analysis or market-basket analysis) is a popu-
lar data mining method that is commonly used as an example to explain what data mining is 
and what it can do to a technologically less savvy audience.
child_a75354ad5a0746a5bd2cd0284603a9e6.title: unit2ii

child_c4f0e4f131da49a2a88aa623f2134694.content:
Most of you might have heard 
the famous (or infamous, depending on how you look at it) relationship discovered between 
the sales of beer and diapers at grocery stores.
child_c4f0e4f131da49a2a88aa623f2134694.title: unit2ii

child_284af2a69be14518b0df24593e1a87b1.content:
As the story goes, a large supermarket chain 
(maybe Walmart, maybe not; there is no consensus on whic
child_284af2a69be14518b0df24593e1a87b1.title: unit2ii

child_eaa578dab7094b22bf2ab210d9fc3f24.content:
the story goes, a large supermarket chain 
(maybe Walmart, maybe not; there is no consensus on which supermarket chain it was) did 
an analysis of customers’ buying habits and found a statistically significant correlation between 
purchases of beer and purchases of diapers.
child_eaa578dab7094b22bf2ab210d9fc3f24.title: unit2ii

child_96c62794bfef44c6b9f3c59844e24039.content:
It was theorized that the reason for this was that 
fathers (presumably young men) were stopping off at the supermarket to buy diapers for their 
babies (especially on Thursdays), and since they could no longer go down to the sports bar 
as often, would buy beer as well.
child_96c62794bfef44c6b9f3c59844e24039.title: unit2ii

child_e9c2385b5369472eb2d2f83aa7b0a8fa.content:
As a result of this finding, the supermarket chain is alleged 
to have placed the diapers next to the beer, resulting in increased sales of both.
child_e9c2385b5369472eb2d2f83aa7b0a8fa.title: unit2ii

child_c65d016a4cfd4c3aa26f4919095b3ce4.content:
Step 2Step 1 Step 3
Figure 4.11 A Graphical Illustration of the Steps in k-Means Algorithm.
child_c65d016a4cfd4c3aa26f4919095b3ce4.title: unit2ii

child_4d016a43f14f4af68512c38730017357.content:
M04_SHAR4877_03_PIE_C04.indd   206 1/23/14   10:02 AM	 Chapter	4	 •	 Data	Mining 207
In essence, association rule mining aims to find interesting relationships (affinities) 
between variables (items) in large datab
child_4d016a43f14f4af68512c38730017357.title: unit2ii

child_f12787591dee428b99106b84e252fb99.content:
mining aims to find interesting relationships (affinities) 
between variables (items) in large databases.
child_f12787591dee428b99106b84e252fb99.title: unit2ii

child_cea5b84ea3974c03aea371936d02db9f.content:
Because of its successful application to 
retail business problems, it is commonly called market-basket analysis.
child_cea5b84ea3974c03aea371936d02db9f.title: unit2ii

child_5f2d29116e244bf280dd373d96f94da6.content:
The main idea 
in market-basket analysis is to identify strong relationships among different products 
(or services) that are usually purchased together (show up in the same basket together, 
either a physical basket at a grocery store or a virtual basket at an e-commerce Web 
site).
child_5f2d29116e244bf280dd373d96f94da6.title: unit2ii

child_49ed6a21ec474831a8351229ea87cd6c.content:
For example, 65 percent of those who buy comprehensive automobile insurance 
also buy health insurance; 80 percent of those who buy books online also buy music 
online; 60 percent of those who have high blood pressure and are overweight have high 
cholesterol; 70 percent of the customers who buy lap-top computer and virus protection 
software also buy extended service plans.
child_49ed6a21ec474831a8351229ea87cd6c.title: unit2ii

child_873762907b3840b0aa8c9099ff94b51b.content:
The input to market-basket analysis is the simple point-of-sale transaction data, 
where	a	number	of	products	and/or
child_873762907b3840b0aa8c9099ff94b51b.title: unit2ii

child_a93f6c397a46410b9dddf0918b90d8ae.content:
et-basket analysis is the simple point-of-sale transaction data, 
where	a	number	of	products	and/or	services	purchased	together	(just	like	the	content	
of a purchase receipt) are tabulated under a single transaction instance.
child_a93f6c397a46410b9dddf0918b90d8ae.title: unit2ii

child_61ea4ee2dc0a489782158f0e010d7233.content:
The outcome of 
the analysis is invaluable information that can be used to better understand customer-
purchase behavior in order to maximize the profit from business transactions.
child_61ea4ee2dc0a489782158f0e010d7233.title: unit2ii

child_b823bfc8f9fc4efcba31dab79e3d7043.content:
A business 
can take advantage of such knowledge by (1) putting the items next to each other to 
make it more convenient for the customers to pick them up together and not forget to 
buy one when buying the others (increasing sales volume); (2) promoting the items as a 
package (do not put one on sale if the other(s) are on sale); and (3) placing them apart 
from each other so that the customer has to walk the aisles to search for it, and by doing 
so potentially seeing and buying other items.
child_b823bfc8f9fc4efcba31dab79e3d7043.title: unit2ii

child_d6fd3e6fd8cf4f5384ddee2ceec37990.content:
Applications of market-basket analysis include cross-marketing, cross-selling, store 
design,
child_d6fd3e6fd8cf4f5384ddee2ceec37990.title: unit2ii

child_55bfbeb9c32f4557ad5a849752e00eef.content:
Applications of market-basket analysis include cross-marketing, cross-selling, store 
design, catalog design, e-commerce site design, optimization of online advertising, product 
pricing,	and	sales/promotion	configuration.
child_55bfbeb9c32f4557ad5a849752e00eef.title: unit2ii

child_ef802ab19b334f8793709865d76922a0.content:
In	essence,	market-basket	analysis	helps	busi-
nesses infer customer needs and preferences from their purchase patterns.
child_ef802ab19b334f8793709865d76922a0.title: unit2ii

child_67f84cee905a47b5ad2e8eb43e1acd80.content:
Outside the 
business realm, association rules are successfully used to discover relationships between 
symptoms and illnesses, diagnosis and patient characteristics and treatments (which can be 
used in medical DSS), and genes and their functions (which can be used in genomics proj-
ects), among others.
child_67f84cee905a47b5ad2e8eb43e1acd80.title: unit2ii

child_d47ee546dca0437c87ef7efda7d015f1.content:
Here are a few common areas and uses for association rule mining:
•	Sales transaction: Combinations of retail products purchased together can be 
used to improve product placement on the sales floor (placing products that go 
together in close proximity) and promotional pricing of products (not having pro -
motions on both products that are o
child_d47ee546dca0437c87ef7efda7d015f1.title: unit2ii

child_dbb5b538e8094e7fa4ac261e8e102a92.content:
proximity) and promotional pricing of products (not having pro -
motions on both products that are often purchased together).
child_dbb5b538e8094e7fa4ac261e8e102a92.title: unit2ii

child_712b63ecc0d74ed398d8cd579fd52c72.content:
•	Credit card transactions:  Items purchased with a credit card provide insight 
into other products the customer is likely to purchase or fraudulent use of credit 
card numbers.
child_712b63ecc0d74ed398d8cd579fd52c72.title: unit2ii

child_41cf4f411ea448f8ae6fb754ed347d3a.content:
•	Banking services: The sequential patterns of services used by customers (check-
ing account followed by saving account) can be used to identify other services they 
may be interested in (investment account).
child_41cf4f411ea448f8ae6fb754ed347d3a.title: unit2ii

child_2b301da51bf74e20aab127b24cee27f0.content:
•	Insurance service products: Bundles of insurance products bought by custom-
ers (car insurance followed by a home insurance) can be used to propose additional 
insurance products (life insurance); or, unusual combinations of insurance claims 
can be a sign of fraud.
child_2b301da51bf74e20aab127b24cee27f0.title: unit2ii

child_189cb30cbdc74c4fae3edb58ca7e4e68.content:
•	Telecommunication services:  Commonly purchased groups of options (e.g., 
call waiting, caller ID, three-way calling, etc.) help better structure product bundles 
to maximize revenue; the same is also applicable to
child_189cb30cbdc74c4fae3edb58ca7e4e68.title: unit2ii

child_ec44ee16a899469da3bbffe06b5cc6e1.content:
ng, etc.) help better structure product bundles 
to maximize revenue; the same is also applicable to multi-channel telecom provid -
ers with phone, television, and Internet-service offerings.
child_ec44ee16a899469da3bbffe06b5cc6e1.title: unit2ii

child_66a137926f3340499c8bf36fecc63a2c.content:
•	Medical records: Certain combinations of conditions can indicate increased risk 
of various complications; or, certain treatment procedures at certain medical facili -
ties can be tied to certain types of infection.
child_66a137926f3340499c8bf36fecc63a2c.title: unit2ii

child_bb177e5e763246408f93ca9dfdfd98af.content:
M04_SHAR4877_03_PIE_C04.indd   207 1/23/14   10:02 AM208	 Chapter 	4	 •	 Data	Mining
A	good	question	to	ask	with	respect	to	the	patterns/relationships	that	association	
rule mining can discover is “Are all association rules interesting and useful?” In order to 
answer such a question, association rule mining uses two common metrics: support, and 
confidence and lift.
child_bb177e5e763246408f93ca9dfdfd98af.title: unit2ii

child_7b16446cd0e640b09509993a39ff0f50.content:
Before defining these terms, let’s get a little technical by showing 
what an association rule looks like:
X 1 Y [Supp(%), Conf(%)]
{Laptop Computer, Antivirus Software} 1 {Extended Service Plan} [30%, 70%]
Here, X	(prod
child_7b16446cd0e640b09509993a39ff0f50.title: unit2ii

child_9168ba95e3094ba7b66efb17f2a9c9fa.content:
), Conf(%)]
{Laptop Computer, Antivirus Software} 1 {Extended Service Plan} [30%, 70%]
Here, X	(products	and/or	service;	called	the	left-hand side, LHS,  or the antecedent) is 
associated with Y	(products	and/or	service;	called	the	right-hand side, RHS,  or conse-
quent).
child_9168ba95e3094ba7b66efb17f2a9c9fa.title: unit2ii

child_3b72acb41a254f4490ddc6bb98684442.content: S is the support, and C is the confidence for this particular rule.
child_3b72acb41a254f4490ddc6bb98684442.title: unit2ii

child_8b9b48a19c2148bbb2bc858bd79c4a41.content:
Here are the 
simple formulas for Supp, Conf, and Lift.
child_8b9b48a19c2148bbb2bc858bd79c4a41.title: unit2ii

child_e0eff2860030463c8fcb7c7076a2476b.content:
Support = Supp(X 1 Y ) = number of baskets that contains both X and Y
total number of baskets
Confidence = Conf (X 1 Y) = Supp(X 1 Y )
Supp(X)
Lift(X 1 Y ) = Conf(X 1 Y )
Expected Conf (X 1 Y ) =
S(X 1 Y)
S(X)
S(X) * S(Y)
S(X)
= S(X 1 Y)
S(X) * S(Y)
The support (S) of a collection of products is the measure of how often these products 
and/or	services	(i.e.,	LHS	+	RHS	=	Laptop	Computer,	Antivirus	Software,	and	Extended	
Service Plan) appear together in the same transaction; that is, the proportion of trans -
actions	in	the	data	set	that	contain	all	of	the	products	and/or	services	mentioned	in	a
child_e0eff2860030463c8fcb7c7076a2476b.title: unit2ii

child_f72877d4cb5142bd8fdc13e077e3349c.content:
of trans -
actions	in	the	data	set	that	contain	all	of	the	products	and/or	services	mentioned	in	a	
specific rule.
child_f72877d4cb5142bd8fdc13e077e3349c.title: unit2ii

child_6d11a6016b7c454a8a63643e3c3521c5.content:
In this example, 30 percent of all transactions in the hypothetical store 
database had all three products present in a single sales ticket.
child_6d11a6016b7c454a8a63643e3c3521c5.title: unit2ii

child_42c8f31cc47d41ec8aff0350f702d22e.content:
The confidence of a rule 
is	the	measure	of	how	often	the	products	and/or	services	on	the	RHS	(consequent)	go	
together	with	the	products	and/or	services	on	the	LHS	(antecedent);	that	is,	the	propor-
tion of transactions that include LHS while also including the RHS.
child_42c8f31cc47d41ec8aff0350f702d22e.title: unit2ii

child_1bf3b4dbc36841028188b6da83ce7dc5.content:
In other words, it is 
the conditional probability of finding the RHS of the rule present in transactions where 
the LHS of the rule already exists.
child_1bf3b4dbc36841028188b6da83ce7dc5.title: unit2ii

child_442d52e79b204e699ee7cf1fe7f07646.content:
The lift value of an association rule is the ratio of the 
confidence of the rule and the expected confidence of the rule.
child_442d52e79b204e699ee7cf1fe7f07646.title: unit2ii

child_45e4e94ed83d46f1891f2fd2a9db03e5.content:
The expected confidence 
of a rule is defined as the product of the support values of the LHS and the RHS divided 
by the support of the LHS.
child_45e4e94ed83d46f1891f2fd2a9db03e5.title: unit2ii

child_bc2f60747b144411b50411878d651f80.content: Several algorithms are available for discovering association r
child_bc2f60747b144411b50411878d651f80.title: unit2ii

child_b8cf13177fd14384a290f0a7c574f5ca.content:
S divided 
by the support of the LHS.
child_b8cf13177fd14384a290f0a7c574f5ca.title: unit2ii

child_a55938c92db4462fa223367c883b7648.content: Several algorithms are available for discovering association rules.
child_a55938c92db4462fa223367c883b7648.title: unit2ii

child_4a760c8ae5954010bab533e237c1434c.content:
Some well-known 
algorithms include Apriori, Eclat, and FP-Growth.
child_4a760c8ae5954010bab533e237c1434c.title: unit2ii

child_6e031c2d54a5451eacbed1ce6f5b651c.content:
These algorithms only do half the job, 
which is to identify the frequent itemsets in the database.
child_6e031c2d54a5451eacbed1ce6f5b651c.title: unit2ii

child_a4e6d937d388407b91102607ee7bb3df.content:
Once the frequent itemsets are 
identified, they need to be converted into rules with antecedent and consequent parts.
child_a4e6d937d388407b91102607ee7bb3df.title: unit2ii

child_609b9f380bb44d80b4c61207a0835ad6.content:
Determination of the rules from frequent itemsets is a straightforward matching process, 
but the process may be time-consuming with large transaction databases.
child_609b9f380bb44d80b4c61207a0835ad6.title: unit2ii

child_5d70d7d80c3e408fad7c5ac68e10d536.content:
Even though 
there can be many items on each section of the rule, in practice the consequent part usu-
ally contains a single item.
child_5d70d7d80c3e408fad7c5ac68e10d536.title: unit2ii

child_d7542ea878c64a9aa1bf983830f12162.content:
In the following section, one of the most popular algorithms 
for identification of frequent itemsets is explained.
child_d7542ea878c64a9aa1bf983830f12162.title: unit2ii

child_7780191e58bf4d47924aaaadca9a4558.content:
apriori algoritHM The apriori algorithm is the most commonly used algorithm 
to discover association rules.
child_7780191e58bf4d47924aaaadca9a4558.title: unit2ii

child_dbf8bcdc0b5240dbb5d88a8ec7d517b8.content:
Given a set of itemsets (e.g., sets of retail transactions, 
each listing individual item
child_dbf8bcdc0b5240dbb5d88a8ec7d517b8.title: unit2ii

child_f60614bcfabc46dda953b64717660a3f.content:
Given a set of itemsets (e.g., sets of retail transactions, 
each listing individual items purchased), the algorithm attempts to find subsets that are 
M04_SHAR4877_03_PIE_C04.indd   208 1/23/14   10:02 AM	 Chapter	4	 •	 Data	Mining 209
common to at least a minimum number of the itemsets (i.e., complies with a minimum 
support).
child_f60614bcfabc46dda953b64717660a3f.title: unit2ii

child_fffe6541f3aa4d28bcbda69206d6b0b0.content:
Apriori uses a bottom-up approach, where frequent subsets are extended one 
item at a time (a method known as candidate generation, whereby the size of frequent 
subsets increases from one-item subsets to two-item subsets, then three-item subsets, 
etc.), and groups of candidates at each level are tested against the data for minimum sup-
port.
child_fffe6541f3aa4d28bcbda69206d6b0b0.title: unit2ii

child_8c1b4e0b676a45efa484056d574320c9.content: The algorithm terminates when no further successful extensions are found.
child_8c1b4e0b676a45efa484056d574320c9.title: unit2ii

child_6fe224d41279492fa1d7013029b1c9ae.content: As an illustrative example, consider the following.
child_6fe224d41279492fa1d7013029b1c9ae.title: unit2ii

child_ae18a424ed8f4ee8b082199fd5c65850.content:
A grocery store tracks sales trans-
actions by SKU (stock-keeping unit) and thus knows which items are typically purchased 
together.
child_ae18a424ed8f4ee8b082199fd5c65850.title: unit2ii

child_2146f0dd306c43ffb7f07b3fff8a6aaf.content: The database of transactions, along with the subsequ
child_2146f0dd306c43ffb7f07b3fff8a6aaf.title: unit2ii

child_285d3fbd7758459bb446ea02972f8fc4.content:
which items are typically purchased 
together.
child_285d3fbd7758459bb446ea02972f8fc4.title: unit2ii

child_f6e812c5b4bd4ec4a7e4be8a7829e8f5.content:
The database of transactions, along with the subsequent steps in identifying the 
frequent itemsets, is shown in Figure 4.12.
child_f6e812c5b4bd4ec4a7e4be8a7829e8f5.title: unit2ii

child_3a81d77d315a4e2b900a868633216da3.content:
Each SKU in the transaction database corresponds 
to	a	product,	such	as	“1	=	butter,”	“2	=	bread,”	“3	=	water,”	and	so	on.
child_3a81d77d315a4e2b900a868633216da3.title: unit2ii

child_090fd1accf5749c789542e2b19554480.content:
The	first	step	in	
Apriori is to count up the frequencies (i.e., the supports) of each item (one-item itemsets).
child_090fd1accf5749c789542e2b19554480.title: unit2ii

child_cbd3a0d053d246ca90d3a8355f73a2cf.content:
For this overly simplified example, let us set the minimum support to 3 (or 50%; meaning an 
itemset is considered to be a frequent itemset if it shows up in at least 3 out of 6 transactions 
in the database).
child_cbd3a0d053d246ca90d3a8355f73a2cf.title: unit2ii

child_0d2cf6078c0541a4aff1d793eb14d4bb.content:
Because all of the one-item itemsets have at least 3 in the support column, 
they are all considered frequent itemsets.
child_0d2cf6078c0541a4aff1d793eb14d4bb.title: unit2ii

child_68bb69c7635643779228fd58ab098cd4.content:
However, had any of the one-item itemsets not 
been frequent, they would not have been included as a possible member of possible two-
item pairs.
child_68bb69c7635643779228fd58ab098cd4.title: unit2ii

child_ed593cd9017748a39cdead5d17c2838f.content: In this way, Apriori prunes the tree of all possible itemsets.
child_ed593cd9017748a39cdead5d17c2838f.title: unit2ii

child_c03876b7d7e045028b03bbed7dcd1b07.content:
As Figure 4.12 shows, 
using one-item itemsets, al
child_c03876b7d7e045028b03bbed7dcd1b07.title: unit2ii

child_fc3ed8b049d24592a83c0a891266f954.content: Apriori prunes the tree of all possible itemsets.
child_fc3ed8b049d24592a83c0a891266f954.title: unit2ii

child_4f4fc43a2ffe4d0d9f72e83b1f81cd7d.content:
As Figure 4.12 shows, 
using one-item itemsets, all possible two-item itemsets are generated and the transaction 
database is used to calculate their support values.
child_4f4fc43a2ffe4d0d9f72e83b1f81cd7d.title: unit2ii

child_c225db9463734c4f8f9eae7a95efcaf1.content:
Because the two-item itemset {1, 3} has 
a support less than 3, it should not be included in the frequent itemsets that will be used 
to generate the next-level itemsets (three-item itemsets).
child_c225db9463734c4f8f9eae7a95efcaf1.title: unit2ii

child_2fef0bb838fd43e5bd1119fbf8a3f2ac.content:
The algorithm seems deceivingly 
simple, but only for small data sets.
child_2fef0bb838fd43e5bd1119fbf8a3f2ac.title: unit2ii

�1�
Systems that handle a company's routine ongoing business
Constantly involved in handling updates to operational databases
Examples: ATM withdrawals, bank deposits, grocery store purchases
Each request is a transaction - a computerized record of a discrete event
Requires database updates completed in an all-or-nothing fashion
Efficient for transaction processing but inefficient for end-user analysis and reporting
�1�
Data warehouses work with informational data used for OLAP systems
Intent is to give management ability to analyze data for business insights
Provides tactical or operational decision support
Enables quicker and more informed decisions
Data warehouses contain wide variety of data presenting coherent picture of business
conditions
Always online, contains all OLTP system information including historical data
Reorganized and structured for fast, efficient querying, analysis, and decision support
